Possible the worst beer that I have ever had. Even Natty light is better than this stuff.

12 oz bottle-clear golden color you can see right thru the bottle! Not much to say @ this one-it was the least offensive choice @ a playoff party after the good stuff ran out. Was pretty smooth & drinkable for a BMC product, had a little bit of sweet corn flavor. Better than a lot of the swill out there...if that’s a complement!
Another golden lager.  Flavor of corn.  I actually prefer this to many of the other Miller offerings, but it is far from good.
not much to say about this , just another bmc lager, but for the price, much better than natty. Mainly aromas and flavor of corn and metal
not much to say about this beer. not impressed, but not depressed either. was ok. best from a tap in my opinion. not bad for the price.
Sampled a can in Mass with Dan and Vanessa. Pretty crispy and watery. Metallic too. Not so nice.

Bottle.  Faint adjunct stink.  Poured palest yellow with fast dissipating head.  Faint adjunct flavour.  No finish, God sy dank.  It’s a .6 rather than a .5 for 1 reason.  It’s cheaper than other pale liquids.
TAP, BOTTLE, CAN: clear golden, no aroma, watery, fizzy, only slighly better than Coors Light, but less flavor than Miller Lite
Can with Butters at Second Cellar Reduction.  White, fading head and crystal golden color.  Sweet and malty.  Some hops to balance.
Sampled a can in Mass with Dan and Vanessa. Pretty crispy and watery. Metallic too. Not so nice.
the champagne of beers it right. stright up foam with horrible taste. once again another good beer to get smashed to that is if the foam ever gos down.
Bottle. Pours a golden yellow body with a fizzy white head.  A note of grass, corn, and metallic lingering.  Thin body and no alcohol.  I hate this beer.
My dad says this is the best beer ever made. I drank one out of the can tonight, and it was metallic tasting, corny, and almost horrible. Still, the commercials get points.

My swill of choice, a capable measuring stick when deciding activities.  Lets go to the movies, 8 dollar ticket, OR we could have 16 High Lifes.  Clear golden yellow with a finger of foamy white head.  Dry, boring aroma, metal, pale malt, metal, corn.  Taste is bland corniness, standard adjunct macro lager.
By far my favorite heavy cheap beer. It tatses better than mgd in my opinion.
Bottle.  Pale golden.  Almost no aroma.  Almost no flavor.   Almost no finish, no malt, no hops.

Festive fall can.  Had beer with pizza.  Pale yellow fizzy lager.  Aroma of grain, corn, rice.  Taste is pretty watered down.  Not bad for washing down pizza.  Not too much to enjoy, but not repuslive either.

Part of a six can blind pale lager tasting with Blatz, Miller High Life, Pabst, Hamms and Budweiser.  Boy I’ve always hated Miller beer, but was that more a product of their lousy advertising campaigns or me just hating the big guy?  So trying this one blind was an excellent way to take the bias out of the beer I affectionately call either piss water or colored water.  Speaking off piss, that’s what the stuff in my glass looks like with a thin foamy head. Aroma smells of must, piss, corn and bad malt.  Taste of corn, aluminum can (I had it in a glass) and bad malt.  Mega astringent, perhaps the worst beer I have ever had.  Of course I wrote the review after I knew what the beer was but the comments were all written down before I took another stab at Miller.

Yup, pretty much terrible.  Although I’ve moved on to greener pastures, this reminds me of the good old days when $20 in your pocket would mean a great night for you and your friends.  Of all the budget beers, I’d say this would be the best - although I’d say I can drink roughly 1,000 before getting drunk.
Bottle.  I can tolerate this beer, if there is nothing else available.  Reminds me of the poor college days.

This, in a tie with Strohs, is my favorite American mass produced beer and I give it the highest rating i’m willing to give this type of beer, 8 out of 20. In my opinion there are three categories of this kind of product; the creamy ones (MIller), the ones with a hint of hops (Pabst, Strohs, Schlitz), and the no taste ones (Anheuser Busch). This is definately of the creamy variety, very carbonated with yeast hints. There is a pleasant hop hint in the aftertaste, almost like a German Pisner, better the colder you can get it. Sure, this isn’t Dukenheimer Stout, it doesn’t pretend to be, but judge it for what it is, a good refreshing drink to enjoy at a party in the summer where you know you’ll be having at least a 12 pack. By the way, the commercials are great!
This pours yellow/clear with no head to speak of and tastes very watery.  Advertising and price is what sells this beer.
Pours clear yellow. No aroma but it’s fizzy. Got me drunk. Let’s face it, it’s not very good.

Pale yellow with an extremely small head. Smells a little like corn. Just another cheap pale lager.

*EDIT* I had to re-rate this beer because for an unknown reason, I hold a strong appreciation for the High Life... If I had to choose a cheap beer, it would come down to High Life... I love it more and more everyday

can.  Poured clear pale yellow with minimal foamy head. Corny aroma. Light body, typical macro carbonation,  slightly more creamier mouthfeel than expected. Sweet grainy malt flavour, creamed corn and hay.  A generic lager with no funny metallic after taste.
Hahaha, this is the worst beer ever.  The commercials make me hate it even more.  Send me a message if you have a suggestion of a beer that sucks even more, because I would like to try it.

Bottle. This beer has its place in American Popular Culture.  That being said, MHL is more about the aesthetics of the bottle, label, and slogan, than what comes inside.  MHL tastes a lot like MGD go figure--nevertheless MHL is actually one of the better mass produced "piss" beers on the market mostly because of the experience that surrounds the consuming of the product. Its long lasting life on the American market can be tied to its image not necessarily its taste.  This beer is great cold after a hot day of laborious activities. Taste. Corny and Grainy with little hop action.  Meh.

All right all right, back off. I know. I was at walmart, and I already had everything in their shelf, ...except this.  I knew there weas a reason for saving it for last.  Basically, how can I say this gently....piss water. I actually looked for sewer water first. When I found there was none, I went for the Miller high life. Pale yellow, little head. No real taste. Clear bottle which doesn’t help the situation any. Not  that it would have helped. Champagne of beers...HA!
16oz can. For what it is, I prefer nothing else, not even hipster PBR. Certainly not champagne but sweet and easy to drink. Don’t think I’ve ever poured this.
Had a couple of these bad boys last night and must say I did enjoy them.  Aroma and flavor is grainy and malt. For the cheap swill that it is it is not too bad.

Bright yellow color with a cola head that dissipates immediately.  Aroma is corn and malt.  Grainy and slightly cloying all the way through.  Finishes with distinct grain aftertaste.  I used to drink this when I was much younger, and bought a six pack of bottles on a whim.  Not as terrible as I remember it being, but certainly not good.
Pours bright yellow gold into a shaker. Cola head recedes to nothing. Cookie, adjunct aromas.  Grainy malts from front to back. Dry and crisp.
Pours a golden clear color with a nice fizzy white head. Aroma of malt, grain. Flavor is malt, corn, and a faint touch of hops. Much better froma  can than bottle.

I am glad they show the picture of the miller high life 40oz. because that is exactly what I am drinking right now. "A picture is worth a thousand words" and that picture of that 40 says it all. Light urine gold color. The beer has a cheap hop taste. I think Miller Lite is better. My brother picked up a twelve pack of 40’s. What the hell? I didn’t think they sold 12 packs of 40s, but they do. Imagine that, an alcoholics dream. The beer proclaims to be"The champagne of beers", sure why not? You don’t have anything to lose with that statement. Hops are cheap, the malts are cheap, the beer is a little thicker than a lite beer, so if I am looking to get trashed I will definitely drink this beer. I have had two 40s and I am waiting to feel this!
Bottle. Light gold with fluffy white head. Aroma is weak, grainy with vegetal overtones. Taste is weak, almost all grain. On the plus side - nothing offensive here. Not mcuh of anything here.
This beer looks and tastes like piss. I would call it No Life. I dont know who would want to go out to buy this beer.

12 oz bottle...pours clear yellow, quickly diminishing white head, with no lacing. Nose of malts and grain. A light hops preseance in the flavor, along with a some malts, and grain. The palate is weak and water. Crisp, dry finish...Not as terrible as I had imagined.

Bonus points for the underrated clear bottle. You can actually see and anticipate the deliciousness before you consume. Known to encourage freakish strength and endurance.  Rumored to aid fertility.  Known in certain circles as the "nectar of the Gods," or "Bill Braksy’s ballsweat."

Warning- The bottle should be consumed within 5 minutes of opening.  If not, the skunk quotient reaches Stroh’s-level, which is undrinkable, and likened to deer piss.

One of the better lawnmower beers. I usually buy the canned version to avoid the dreaded "skunk".  It has a real mild good flavor if poured into a glass instead of swilling from the container. It seems to have more character than MGD. Just had a back to back with Bud. The Miller has much bigger malt and hop flavors. It even produced some lacings!

Drank a shit load of these this weekend at an ultimate frisbee tournament in Greenville.   This stuff aint bad.  PBR has been my shitty beer of choice for quite some time, but damn if I wasn’t somewhat enjoying these.  Especially an ice cold one after a long day of ultimate.
Actually preferable to MGD which costs a bit more.  The same weak taste of a macro, without even a hit of hops, but if all you want is beer without taste, then it’s better than Bud.
Yeah it’s beer flavored water, but it’s my cheap lager of choice before and after my team loses at softball, or when I need 12 beers that cost $1.25 each while playing shuffleboard.
Since I have alerted the Low charecter alert I have to write this down before what I have to say.  All I have to ay about this beer is.......CARBONATED BUTTER!;;
Nonexistent aroma and flavor. I do drink  the High Life from time to time....when it’s this or water....though I think water out of the tap has more hops and malty character.

Wow!  I’m impressed that this has a 2 percentile score.  Not much of a beer in this beer.  In fact, I didn’t know pale lagers can get this bad.  Tapped from a keg at a party (yes, this is my excuse for drinking this), poured golden with a big white head (I’ll give it that).  Absolutely no aroma, nothing; no aroma equals no extra points i guess.  Cracker like flavors but I was really just drinking tonic water with yellow food dye I think.
The champagne of the toilet, pour it down the drain your toilet doesn’t deserve this.
This has to be the worst beer of all. Expect...well...nothing except 6 - 40 ounces of checking the bottle/glass to see if you’re finished with this catastrophe yet.

12 oz bottle.  One of the best cheap bears in the world. Very clear golden lager with a big fluffy head. Not much on the aroma, just a little malt and corn bread. Flavor is where this one shines, there is actually one there and it’s not bad. When I can’t afford high quality craft beer, this is one of the few I will turn.

Good cheap beer. Great in can for beach or fishing trip. Pours clear golden with thin white head. Aroma is sweet and taste follows aroma. Good carbonation. You cant beat this one for the price. $14.99 a 30 pack.

Solid cheap beer, even though hipsters have caught onto it. I spent a good 15 years drinking these in the park across the street from Yankee Stadium, where the new one is being built now. Drank them fast too, because as soon as it gets slightly warm it’s vile. Yet, ice cold it reminds me of the Summertime and stumbling into my section in the 3rd inning loaded and feeling great.

I find my budget-constrained self drinking this more and more lately. It’s super-cheap and surprisingly drinkable, at least from bottles. Barely noticable, but not objectionable aroma of cheap cereals, especially corn. And the rather weak flavour is definitely a bit more corn than barley but is smooth. Like most cheap beers, it is definitely lacking any hop character at all. It has a sweet, watery aftertaste. Maybe a bit too carbonated. I’d say this beats Coors Original or Budweiser, while being cheaper than either.
Pale, carbonated and cold.  A forgettable yellow lager, but to my surprise, not undrinkable.  I enjoy the good beers, but can put away *most of the bad ones.
Pours a pale yellow color with medium size white head. Aromas of corn and cereal grains.Very surprising! I’m catching a slight hint of malt in here! Nothing fantastic, but i’v defiantly had worse!
It is a good stand by, if you just need some beers for friends that pissed you off you just have to pick up a case of this and they will get the picture.
Out of a bottle in both 12 and 40 oz. forms.  What more do you need to say but I did not reach the High Life at all.  Did anyone?

This is the beer I buy when the funds are low...It’s incredibly inexpensive here in South Carolina...around 7 dollars a 12 pack, and the best part is it’s actually a great tasting beer...definitely worth a try if you’ve got little cash and want good quality beer.
Bottle. Very little going on here, Lots of fizz,and some flavor but not bad if your on the cheep .

Very light yellow in color.  Aroma is strong of corn, flavor the same.  Overall, it’s a more preferred cheap beer that I don’t mind drinking.  A bit too heavy for a beer pong game but great for drinking 12+ during a football game!

I’ll tell you what, a 30 case for around 10 bucks and it doesn’t taste like Rotting Cigars, Old People, or Complete crap, you can’t beat it.

Way better then most other Alt. for the same price. It still has some flavor, and the flavor it has isn’t too bad at all, can’t beat it for the price.

40’s night at a friend’s house, straight from the bottle.  Light yellow color.  Aroma of corn and grain, and not much else.  Similar flavor with a bit of malt present.  Good carbonation.  It’s not the worst thing I’ve ever drank!

Great overall beer... good for hearty meals, good for BBQ, good after a long day, and good after working in the yard in the middle of July.  

Truly the champagne of beers!
I’m just not a miller man.  If I’m on a budget and need cheap beer, I’m going with Natty Boh - far better than this.
This is my favorite 11 dollar case of beer by FAR. It has a good flavor and does not taste watered down. I’ll live the high life at any time of year.

The champagne of beers!  For functional purposes only.  Many prefer the other American macros, this is cheaper and probably has more going on.  After a few good beers, I often finish a night off a couple of these.
There is NOTHING better on a hot day than an ICE cold miller High Life in a bottle.   Its just too bad the picture is of a 40oz!!

Bottle.  Pours exactly how it looks in the bottle and with fair fading head.  The aroma is almost missing entirely but I find a faint hint of corn.  Flavor is a little more pronounced grain, butter, and corn.  Medium light body and fair carbonation. For american swill, this one stands above the rest, due in large part to the cheap price and drinkability.
By and far my favorite cheap beer. It actually has a bit of flavor and the bottle is not mistakable. The lady on the moon is deffinetly a goddess of those bad financial situation.
can. Smooth.  A bit better than MGD I think.  High life is truly the champaign of macro swill.  Very drinkable, very inoffensive and clean.

Im gonna say it I like the high life!
Great Price
Decent clean taste
No bad after taste!

The lady on the Moon knows how to please. If your on a buddget grab a 12 pack of these got them for 7 bucks at a gas station!

Opened a 32 oz. I smell malt, thin hop notes and grass. Head is white  and the beer is yellow and light. Light hint of hop citrus and esters of orange. I smelled a strong grassy feta cheese from Greece and then took in a deep smell of the beer. The malty smell you get is very nice. Subtle American grains. Like driving past a field of dry wheat. Carbonation is just right and the finish is smooth. Wish this was a little more malty on the palate. Mouth feel is silky and bright. Very Bohemian but a little thin and watery. At least 1 major American brewer gets it right. Considering that this beer is brewed for mass consumption it is not only drinkable, it’s delicious.
The only mass marketing mega produced beer I can drink.  at $1.49 per 32 oz. this beer saved my life more than once.
hmm...watery, kinda skunky, but has enough flavor to make it my favorite shitty beer.
visual is obvious from the 40 picture on the left. pretty clean taste with little to no aroma.
Golden yellow color with a thick white head. I don’t know if it was the beer or the atmosphere of the party, but I really liked this beer. Smooth flavor with no aftertaste.

Ah, the Champagne of Beers.

Watery enough that it goes down fine, but it doesn’t really taste like much of anything.

Extremely cheap, yeah!
yellow pour with a ring of white froth.  bitter malts and a slight hop scent on the nose.  just like drinking water with a malt flavor.

I can’t believe I never reviewed this beer. I guess when you review one you feel like you’ve reviewed em all. This is a bad beer but considering it’s competition I suppose you could do worse. Low quality corn, grain, rice, malty mix that doesn’t taste very good. It’s watery enough to make it go down without too much of a grimace. Barely drinkable and a notch above the pour-down-the-drain Beast level. It is cheap as hell so at least it’s got that going for it.
Pours a yeller, smells yeller too.  This is a classic sesh beer, i like this once in a while in a bottle, cheap.  Livin the american dream, throw back yo 40

Absoloutely delicious my favorite brew! , it pours a very yellow liquid and has a delicious smell too it. I admire the miller company for this as this is the beer i grew up apon and is my favorite for parties.

the only reason i gave this a "2" on overall is because of the price. I was able to knock back 5 of these the other night, and had a rather nice buzz going for less that 6 dollars. But by any measure, this beer is the benchmark for what is wrong with big beer companies today, and I will probably never purchase this beer again. The only way ill drink it again is if It’s in an unmarked tap, and it’s a surprise.
the only thing i enjoyed about this beer was the price. besides that id rather put pine cones in a juicer and drink that.

Honestly I love this beer.  To me, it tastes a whole lot better than any other cheap beer like Coors or Keystone.  Honestly I think it’s in a whole other league.  It doesn’t have the "piss water" taste that Keystone and Coors have.
Miller High Life was my first beer back in 1978 when I was 13. It had the best color back then. I try one ever few years just for memories.

the girl on the moon always brings back memories of getting stinky finger at a high school bonfire which we had often livin in so illinois. a teenage beer. but hey what a great time and a good beer to establish memories. do they even have this on tap anymore?
um ...it’s cheap and we drank alot in highschool. The champagne of beers brings back alot of fond memories.
Truly the champagne of beers.  It is an acquired taste.  A classic cheap beer.
Bottle. Have not had one of these in a while. slightly sweet. Yellow nastiness. cant believe Im selling this at coles

Can.  You gotta give them credit for calling this the Champagne of Beers.  Almost Orwellian it its blatant falsity.  Yellow pour.  Aromas of wet cardboard, corn, and grain.  Same flavors, just watered down.  Sour metallic finish. At least the wateriness helps mute the flavors.
not much happening with this one, just tastes like corn juice, at least i have one more rating!
This beer is trash. It’s the worst from the miller brewing company other than Red Dog and i wouldn’t pay for it.

Overall... I can’t believe I used to drink this all the time in college. This stuff is terrible. I went to a place in vegas that had three dollar 52 oz beers, and the only choices were high life and icehouse. I actually chose the icehouse because highlife is that bad. I don’t know how this is the champange of beers.
How tantalizing can one get?  Livning the high life brings me back to college days, as our motto was fulfilled.  Not bad for a cheap beer, and it made you feel special.

Cheaper & has more flavor than Miller Lite.  If you don’t care about calories, it’s a better beer, although the finish isn’t quite as clean.  My mouth kind of feel sticky after I drink it.  High Life oozes class.  The cheapest bottled beer I’ll ever drink.  (PS... Schlitz only comes in cans, and is better.)
Another crappy miller product. Only reason i bought it was $3 bucks a six pack....no other reason to buy this.
Absolute crap, tastes slimey.  Ugh, just thinking about it makes me squirm,
24 ounce can. Corn. Hops. Skunky smell. Pale, watery, too carbonated. Noticeable sweet-corn taste. For the price, it could be a lot worse.
Pale yellow pour with minimal white head.  Soapy aroma with faint hints of corn, malt and bitterness.  Semi-sweet corn flavor with a soapy aftertaste.  Thin body.

Has a somewhat skunky aroma. There isn’t much in the flavor except a watered down somewhat sweet/skunky/hop taste, having an aftertaste that isn’t good. Better than many other watered down beers out there but not by much if you can taste the difference.
Alotta marines i know love this stuff.  Its cheap and does the trick.  The banquet beer... more like the Johnson’s family reunion beer.

bottle; did not deserve dirting a glass. from what i can tell from the bottle corny aroma with some light malt. light crisp body. taste like a watered down malt liquor. almost no hops, very corny. what little malt you can taste is over powered by the corny (dms?) flavor.

Not as bad as everybody thinks. Light yellow color with a thin head. Taste is sweet malt with a hoppy bitter finish. Though I only drink this beer in the bottle, its taste a little different in the can.
I FREQUENTLY HAVE TO ASK MYSELF,  IS THIS A GREAT BEER??, OR THE GREATEST BEER?? I’M LEANING TOWARDS GREATEST. VERY AFFORDABLE AND EASY TO FIND IN STORES. PERFECT FOR ANY OCCASION AND ALL AGE GROUPS.

How can I deny the fact that ive had the Champagne? Not really good at all, and not really the champagne of beers. but theres something about the bottle and the lady on it that might make you wonder what’s inside....

Champagne of beers? Hah!!!!!, Can be only if you count the highly carbonated, bubbling wihte head, actually the only catch would be the head which doesnt fade too quickly or at all. But overall, has a metallic taste,higher corn presence than hops or malt for that matter, This is one of my parents favorite but not mine, weak flavor, dull experience. Save your tokens pals!!!

I generally don’t rate pale lagers because, well, what’s the point?, but some of my friends asked me to rate this beer as a joke at a party on May 17, 2008, and I obliged them. I can’t believe my first beer rating in weeks is Miller High Life. Approximately 6 oz. pour into an 8 oz. clear plastic cup, poured from a 12 oz. can. Aroma is grassy, with a noticeable dry hops scent. The smell is surprisingly neither bad nor weak, but it’s certainly not particularly impressive, either. Pours an effervescent, clear, pale gold with a large amount of short-lasting, white head. Produces surprisingly extensive, long-lasting lacing. Apple sweetness in the flavor. Grassy taste, as the aroma would suggest. A touch of dryness in the finish. Okay, yes, I did perceive all of these elements, but, ultimately, this is just a typical, macro, pale lager. It’s drinkable, but it’s not tasty by any means. Terrible palate effects: Light body, crisp overall but not by the standards of a lager, undercarbonated, not lively, and watery.
This beer is sold for $1.50 at the local bar. It’s an ok tasting beer because of that fact. Otherwise, not so much.

I just can’t believe this could even score a 2 overall....

Aroma. THis is supposed to be beer?
Appearance. Does not look drinkable.
Flavor. Lacks the interesting vomit-in-my-mouth quality of MGD. It’s Bud with less carmel food coloring.

This isn’t completely AWFUL beer. I will drink this before Bud, Busch, Coors, etc. Certainly a bit more complexity than most big domestics. Still, try not to avoid a situation where this is the only option.

Can! Pours clear gold with a fizzy white head. Aroma is grainy malt, very lightly sweet. Light, clean, carbonated body. Flavor is lightly sweet malt with a note of apple/pear. Absolutely no bitterness. Surprisingly not that bad. One of the few of this style I wouldn’t mind drinking a few of.
Absolute epitome of a poundable beer.  Can, bottle, or 40, low on cash and want a drink, reach for the High Life.
I love this stuff.  it dirt cheap and it tastes decent to me.  i like to drink it at the bars or slam it to the face at parties.  come on its the champagne of beers
One of the better low end pale lagers. The fizzy nature gives it its nickname. Nothing to boast about, but one can do far worse.
champagne is right. foamiest beer ever. and is a bad beer. another last resort beer that you dont want to get unless you have to.
Very underrated Beer. Was once a premium American beer by price. Today it’s the best choice of all the low end priced Beers. Simple flavor and while nothing special is easy to drink and enjoy.

A little darker in color than some of its contemporaries.  Decent mild flavor that is surprisingly smooth for such a cheap beer.  Not much depth or complexitybut no bitterness either.  Better than I thought.  Good for those all day barbeques over the summer holidays.

Looks like all the other cheap pale American lagers, maybe a little darker yellow, with a white head. Used to be my go to cheap beer back in the day, not really sure why. Taste isn’t offensive, but certainly nothing to write home about. Considering it is one of the cheapest beers its not too bad.
Gold-to-amber tones. Has a very stinging aroma and sharp taste. Taste tends to leave your mouth as quick as it arrives. Would not buy again unless desperate.
pours clear and fizzy tasted like wet grains and processed sugar wouldnt drink it again unless it was free

Poured from the 32oz can my friend had. Pours with a small, fizzy, white head that fizzles away quickly. Pale yellow color that looks just like the stale sweet corn aroma smells. Corn and stale cereal in the taste, sugar too. Pretty fizzy.

.8 only b/c of the good memories of the people i drank the first sips with (my friends and i choose the cheapest beer to buy in western nc).  big mistake.  no flavor or body, just bad, stale aftertaste.

Wow.  Really?  Hmm.  Manly.  What does that even mean?  Does that mean I will instantly and convulsively feel the need to retch as soon as I imbibe this horrid funk of a "brew".  If you drank this beer more than once in your life you are prime candidate for deportation.
F-
The champagne of beers is called so for a reason.  High Life is very bubbly and is reasonably smooth.  Taste is somewhat watery, but finishes nicely.  A real manly drink.  It is good.
More wattery than Miller Lite.  Reminds me a lot of Bush light.  It has a skunky smell and taste for the first couple sips.  After that it tastes like water.
Some of the worst beer I’ve had.  Only had it due to it being a logo glass at the college bar.
Bottle. If only the EU could sue Miller for domain of origin violation and end the Champagne of beers.

12 oz. can from my girlfriend’s minifridge. Poured a yellowy gold with a highly carbonated and quickly dissipating head. Aromas of corn (Adjunct city) and alcohol. Tastes very adjuncty and feels fairly carbonated, but smooth as promised. A decent beer, but I’m only drinking it because the beer I bought is still chilling.
let those fruity micro lovers have their Johnny-Come-Lately sludge beer. A real man drinks the High Life. Where in the world is the delivery guy?

This one manages to be even worse than the low, low, standard by which the rest of the world ridicules American beer:  Miller lite.  Tastes pretty much like that nauseating swill "Lite", but with more chlorine, added just to make it as horrific as possible.

The only true way to live the high life .... its a bit over carbonated and the aroma is not very great but its a great easy drinking beer .... it will always be better than budweiser in my book .... truly the champagne of beers when you are broke

Its consistent, and not the worst of the value beers out there.

Very yellow pour with a ton of visible carbonation.  Tastes like malt and corn but the flavor is more apparent then in a lot of low cost macros. 

The high carbonation and easy drinkability make it refreshing, but quickly lends itself to headaches.

...well, I have had this Makes you angry as hell when you get drunk off this"champagne  of beers"  many, many times and it goes right to your head due to the over carbonation.  Goes down good after a few, used judt to get frunk, no good flavor here.

Bottle- Apearance:Fizzy, white,quickly diminishing head. Body. Pale yellow with many large bubles. Sub par aroma of cooked corn and rubber. No hops or malt noticable. Finishing flavor pleasent enough for what it is(tinny touch of malt at end). Light and watery.

I’m actually somewhat fond of this classic. This was bum juice before there was malt liquor. If you don’t take into account the fact that it’s $1.50 a quart, then yeah, it’s below average. But if it’s a toss-up between this and anything else cheap in a 32 or 40 ounce bottle, then yeah, it’ll do me.

Truly, the champagne of beers...If champagne tasted like balls wrapped in gym socks.  Kind of like how Andre is the beer of champagne.  I can stomach these if they are near freezing and I drink them fast.  At least the labeling is sort of nostalgic, and the commercials are good.

this is the greatest party beers, yellowish color tastes very sweet like corn, it´s ok for the beach...and a carne asada too, a bit bubbly, really great combo with a chilly cheese burguer from carls junior...very refreshing..

750mL can from the Beer Store.  Innocuous.  Plenty of corn in the nose and the flavour, but it doesn’t try to hide it, rather, it’s not entirely unattractive.  As far as cheap beers go, surprisingly good.
My favorite of the cheap beers.  It’s cheap and drinkable.  Nothing special, but beats the pants off of bud light, and there’s just a certain je ne sais quoi involved with drinking the high life

drunk the way a miller product should be drunk:  a 24 ounce can!

pours watery, clear yellow, foamy head, nice lacing.  i get corn in the aroma.  mildly grassy flavor, too mild to detect much else.  watery palate.  overall the best quality of this beer is the lacing of the head.

I don’t know why High life is getting such a bad rap. This is my normal drink, if you’re looking for high end beverages you’re not buying High Life. If you want a refreshing drink that can be drunk all night long, here you go. It’s not a great beer but it’s not meant to be. It’s a cheap good tasting american brew. So this low life is living the High Life baby..

Having just tried this and compared it to Pabst, I can say that this is my new favourite cheap American beer.   Pabst looks better and tastes better, too.  However, but this clearly edges out Pabst in taste and palate when the Pabst is a bum batch, which occasionally happens.  It is gold, bubbly, with a medium white head that quickly vainishes to a few bubbles.  The aroma is a good "American beer" aroma - a stronger and more pleasant variation on the theme with grain, wet hay, and a little grassy herbal hops.  The body is light but pleasant and the taste pretty much lasts throughout.  It has a clear taste of grain and hay, along with a hop quality of wet hay, grass and a hint of pine, making it both lightly sweet and lightly bitter, with a crisp, lightly bitter finish with both hops and grain.  It does the job that cheap American beer should do and with decent flavour.

12 oz bottle left at my house by my Father- Inlaw, Golden yellow, with a white foamy head. Smell of corn, grass, soap. and yeast. Sharp skunky flavor, My dog lapped up some overspill before i could catch her, we both had  stomache issues the next day.

Far, far, far from the best beers, but I love their commericals with the Budweiser dalmations jumping ship to the Millers truck. I can’t blame the dogs, Millers is a mass brewed thats 500 times better then Bud, but still a beer I drink only when choice is between it and any Bud beer.
i love the champagne of beers. the beer is as good as the commercials. top notch stuff i cant get enough
Come on, this isn’t beer.  The only way to drink this is to bring it to the point of almost being frozen and then you will need to be as thirsty as you have ever been. NASTY.
Good for a mass brewed beer.  Very easy to drink. Corn in there.  Yellow straw colored with an ok head.

Some slight fruit on the nose, with cream of corn notes.  Crystal clear gold with decent medium head.  Slight caramel corn sweetness, with some surprising minor complexity of hop flavors.  Solid carbonation, with a long, but crisp finish.  It really is one of the better choices for a mass-produced American Lager.  Very enjoyable for what it is…

On a hot summer day or night, and you wanna kick back and just drink a lot of beer this is perfect. Its so easy to drink . the biggest prob you can drink a case and really not feel drunk, but for a replacment for a water or soda, this is number one haha

Bottle.  Pours a light yellow color white a decent fizzy white head.  Aroma is slightly sweet and of grain/corn.  Taste is of corn and is a little sweet.  Is fairly smooth and clean tasting, but slightly watey.  Overall, this is a pretty decent brew considering it is exceptionally cheap and rather tasty.  It is also nice to see a beer in a clear bottle.
Flavor and aroma are subpar at best, but at least it looks good in a bottle or glass.  Ironically, in either a bottle or glass, it surely does resemble champagne, a cheap one at that.
I like the commercials but do not like the beer. Pale yellow, void of aroma and corn taste. "The Champagne of Beers" has no place in my fridge.
this is my shift beer at work.  when i’m broke it is my beer of choice, but mostly for the aesthetic value of the bottle.  i

Man this thing lacks flavor. But I love the fact that a 40 is in the picture.  
It’s sweeter than most macros, and for some reason drinking it from a bottle makes me happy. Is that wierd? I think not, it is Champagne of beers.

Shared a 12 pack with my buddy Keppel.  What can you say about the Champagne of beers?  It serves it’s purpose getting high school kids drunk all over America.  Not a lot of aroma, not a lot of taste, but it has a place. To be honest, I’d rather drink the Low Life than MGD anyway.
You can swallow it. Yellow in color, hardly any head. Only worth bonging.............
One of the better cheap domestic beers.  I think it has more flavor than coors/bud/pbr and it is more drinkable.

It’s a clasic and the best cheap domestic beer around. There a plenty of better beers out there. However nothing compares to High life in the sense of valve. By far better than anything from Anheiser-Busch

Absolutely aweful.  It is one of the ONLY beers I have ever had that gets worse when you chill it.  If you HAVE to drink this. . . please drink it only moderately chilled unless you really want to relive everything you ate for the past few days.
a decent yellow fizzy beer, if anything with more body was available i think i’d go for that instead.
God I hate this crap, I find the light version better actually. A disgrace to America
Hey, its Miller High Life, what can you say, its better than miller lite, bud lite, and bud as well.  You could easily do worse at twice the price in the genre.
i love miller high life its smooth and has good flavor one of the better beers miller has to offer

Had this next to Rochefort 10 and Westvleteren 8, and have to say, while this tastes a bit like cat urine in comparison, the nuances of the other two did draw out areas of ’the champagne of beers’ that I’d previously missed.
Vastly better than High Life Light.  Beyond that, not much to say.  Corn and not much else.  Bleh.
Better than Coors, Bud, and PBR to me. Not really in the mood for one a lot, but if someone offers me one, I will Take it.

Somewhat of a head.  More of a corn smell and flavor than the other Big Three... this isn’t always a good thing,  Sort of like eating an expired can of corn... can inluded!  A decent beer served cold on a hot day but of course, what beer isn’t?  Personally, it doesn’t rate as high as Coors, Bud or PBR to me.
However, after about three of any of these, one can’t tell the difference.  Get a REAL beer!
Miller High Life is better than Coors, Bud or other beers of this type. Drinkable, but spend more money and buy better beer.
True class right here!  Actually not that bad but all in all very similar to other pale american lagers.  I like a high life here and there

Sure its just a step up from US domestic light beer but it does have a little more flavor and at a cheaper price.
$5 for a 12 pack of bottles makes it taste even better in my book.
smooth and sweet great job of brewing keep up the good work and maybe one day you will win at yhe great american beer awards go screw yourself crap

If you can manage to get a batch that doesnt taste like metal, then you’ll have your hands on a great beer. When you taste it you know its beer, not like these chocolate colored ketchup consistency beers that dominate ratebeer.  Goes great with food. Two thumbs Up. Plus, who can argue a beer that sells for $3.48 for a 6 pack?

I personally love High life, the champagne of beers ads is pretty close for me.  Love the taste but the low alcohol content for me..an avid drink to get drunk person, is very disappointing..even ,y gf whom hates beer likes this
I wouldn’t call it the "champagne of beers" but not terrible for a big mainstream American beer. Still, not much flavor but put it on some ice on a hot summer day and I’ll drink it.

“Its clean, smooth taste has stood the test of time and represents the finest in American beers.” By that we mean it is lacking flavor, color, and body.  Why not just take some water and add alcohol.  Finest in American beers?  Don’t insult me.
Bottle.  It’s cheap and I love the old ad campaign.  Better than most of the other crappy industrial brews.  Dry, corny, and fizzy.  Not skunky, not much flavor in general, but drinkable.

Bottle. Might as well rate right from the bottle. Champagne of beers? Probably not but I don’t ever recall getting any honey flavor. The good thing is I don’t get much corn from this. This stuff is giving me a headache.

Through thick and thin there has always been the  "High Life"...  Smooth flavor with hints of corn but refreshing.  Plus when they had the Orange camo cans for hunting season who can knock it...   
It’s like family.
Sweet, corn flavor.  But it’s my guilty pleasure, and although I know it’s bad, I will admit it’s kind of nice to kick back with on a Saturday afternoon.

This has been a staple of my beer diet since college, when I discovered what I believe to be the cheapest beer available that I can bring myself to actually drink.  It is not my favorite by far, but drinkable...and at ~$0.50/can, it really can’t be beat in its price range.
I love how the picture is a 40oz. this beer is not too special, but it can work on hot summer days that have all day long drinking.

32 oz. bottle.  Oh Miller High Life.  When I imagine my sad ending in a cheap motel surrounded by pizza boxes and taco bell wrappers.. it is you I share my bed with.  

It doesn’t matter what it tastes like.  It tastes bad if you think about it at all.  Get it as close to freezing as possible, and just drink quickly.  If you finish the bottle in 4 or 5 drinks, it will all be okay.  

  The "I can get this beer today..." really made me laugh.  If I ever open a bar, I WILL have Miller High Life on tap!
This beer does have a sligt flavor to it, but unfortunately its not a very good one.

nothing at all special here in the champagne of beers. The only good thing about this beer is that it is the cheapest bottled beer you can buy around here so if you want something for target practice this is usually a good option. I would rather light my money on fire than purchase this swill.
Pale color, with little carbination. Nothing special, other than being cheap.

It’s cheap, smooth and refreshing, but absolutely nothing special.  Probably better than all of the other pale lagers I’ve tried, but would only buy because of the price and not the flavor.  It is slightly sweet and smells of grains, tastes pretty much like it smells, decent aftertaste.  I prefer MGD.
For the price you can’t beat it. Better than Natty light or keystone or any beer that cheap. Used to drink this all the time back in high school.

Terrible beer, I’m stereotypically supposed to enjoy this beer, but I do not. whether in a bottle, or 30 rack this beer is gross. Terrible aroma, smells much like the floor of a party/bar the next morning. This beer maybe the remains of a mop and bucket job. Little to no head, not appealing by the palate or appearance. My best friend, also stereotypically inclined, LOVES this drink - buys on occasion because he’s a cheap basterd!

40 oz.  Didn’t pour it,  40z are not meant to be poured.  Clear bottle so you can see the color,  swirling gets a nice bit of head.  Aroma of sweet grass,  grains.  Similar flavor.  Very carbonated,  smooth.  Good.

From the clear 12 fl. oz. bottle with an April 30, 2018 expiration date.  I wanted to update based on the style.  Clear, yellow, heady pour with a head that fades,  Corn syrup, bread, and grass on the nose. The body is light and refreshing.   The taste is classic sweet and grainy with a mild bitter and clean finish. For the style it is fine.



(Jan 10, 2008 rating) From a 12 fl oz. (US) bottle with a manufacturing code of 03108 E50108.  My turn to review this internationally known pale lager.  Pours yellow-orange with lively carbonation and a short-lived bubbly head.  Somewhat grassy aroma.  The taste is OK and watered down.  I don’t get as disgusted by these beers as so many other reviewers do.  They’re not my first choice but sometimes they are my affordable choice and at $3.99 a six pack, it worked for me.  This one is bit better than most.

I find myself drinking alot of this. For the price you do get a sort of "bang for your buck kind of thing." Certainly has a better flavor than some of it’s competition and, again, for the price theres not a whole lot of complaining to do. Have some with wings while watching the game and i think youve made yourself a nice little afternoon
Better out of a bottle than a can. A nice cheap Union Made beer. Its a light beer. One of the better massed produced beers.
this is the best of the cheap beers made here in the usa, i like it it’s cheap and drinkable in fact it’s better than bud miller has favor
The "Champagne of beers"? WTF? Why is this crap mass produces in America? I wish I could move to Belgium! At least it is cheap....
You get what you pay for...need I say more. Pours incredibly light. no head. always the cheapest beer around. the aroma is not good. taste is of salted corn.

32oz bottle: twelve pack...   for some reason this always seems to be the cheapest beer when I’m home at my parents due to some random deal at this or that store in town.   twelve 32oz bottles for twelve bucks?   Solid.   Unfortunately, you get what you pay for.   the only flavors remind me of old cooked corn, and aromas of cardboard and stale vegetables abound.  Just smells like poop really.    Not the worst light lager, but its down there. Rerate:   Better on tap.   As far as being tied with natty for the cheapest keg you can buy around here, I prefer MHL these days.   Has slightly more flavor and a softer palate.
Not a huge fan of mainstream American beers, but I’m the first one to admit that, given a choice of mainstreamers, I’ll do this one.
If you drink this, you are classy.  Period.  End of discussion.  High Life sustains me.  Nah, whatever, but it is still one of my first choices out of the macro’s available.
If you drink this expecting this to be classy, I am sorry.  Tastes of the same thing as miller light but with slightly more flavor.
Sad to say, but of all the commercial, mainstream American beers, this is probably my favorite.  It actually has a flavor.  Granted, that flavor is wino piss but at least it’s something.
bad beer, great commercials. i always get a kick when i see high life because I just imagine the commercials and get a good chuckle gotta love the big, jolly black man.

Poured a light watery golden yellow body with a fluffy yet quickly disappearing head. Metallic sweet malty adjunct nose. Sweeter than the Genuine Draft but just as rank. Surprisingly there is a mild hops presence in there.

Rating #1200 24 oz. can from Circle K - I won’t bore everyone with the details.  Its already been done 1186 times.  A typical American Pal;e Lager.  Little aroma, flavor, or body.  I guess it’s better than drinking Mountain Dew!
Golden, fizzy, slightly sour smell and taste. Highly carbonated. One of the better mass produced brews.

This is a cheap beer of choice for me on video game day or guitar playing. I find this better then it’s competitors with cheap american lagers. Light golden color, highly carbonated, easy to drink, and as one poster put it, do not let it get warm or you will get bad after taste. Aroma isn’t bad (unless warm). Has slight malty sweetness, I did not know this before I became a home brewer. Better use of hops compared to competitors. Im actually amazed this is cheaper then miller light, budweiser, coors or bud light..Decient beer for the price.

Date: 12/15/2007

Mode: Can

Source: Tasting, Cellar Party



clear gold, wispy white head, drippy streaks of lace, 
sweet corn and green apple aroma, 
creamy body, 
sweet malt flavor, lots of green apple character, light balancing hops, 



Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 8/20

Rating: 2.2/5.0
Drinkability: 7/10

Score: *+/4

I’m not a fan of people who describe the appearance of the beer as "yellow", but all of a sudden I can’t think of a single adjective that better describes the color.  Good beer overall, just don’t let it get warm.  You’ve gotta finish this one quick if you don’t want to get that bad aftertaste.
This is exactly for the kind of people it is marketed too........college kids and bums that want to just get faded and puke up everything they just ate.  A great buy if you are on that midnight run.
Pale yellow piss fest. Clear bottle killed the taste.  Have a few of these and be prepared for self induced vomiting.

16oz can: Pours a bright clear effervescent golden with a wispy-lacing covering of white head.  Lightly grainy malt and rice aroma has some noble hoppiness to it.  Body starts thin and fizzy with a hint of sweetness, some grainy texture and a hint of earthy tartness toward a thin mostly watery finish.  Drinkable and bland, but not all that offensive.

We all know the High Life, no sense in trying to reinvent the wheel.  After you’ve had some good beer and can no longer taste, I prefer the High Life.  Or when you’re slummin’ it.  There’s certainly worse but this beer will always have a special place in my heart.

Not a great beer for sure, but my dad offered me one the other day and who can turn beer from their dad down?  Decided to give it a quick rating.

Typical American lager look, golden yellow with an average head and loads of carbonation.

Smells kinda skunky and not very appealing.   I’m kinda dreading this.

Not as bad as I thought it was gonna be, but it still wasn’t great.  Just kind of a non-dememo  beer that didn’t have a lot of outstanding characteristics.  Thank goodness it was cold.  

Probably won’t spend my money on this one.

Pretty much the standard american beer for better or worse, same as bud.

Not too good
A truly awful beer... perhaps one of the worst I’ve ever tried. Little or no taste, with, somehow an unpleasant after taste! One to avoid!
Tastes better than miller lite but other than that is essentially the exact same beer: a sub-par americanized pale lager

i think the photo they have over to the left of this beer says it all.  be sure to sample in its purest form, a 40oz bottle with a wet brown paper bag to lock in all that precious flavor and steer away those pesky coppers.  mine came with a ’champagne of beers’ bumper sticker.

pours a clear pale yellow with about five fingers of white, rapidly dissolving head.  Smells of corn and...macro.  Very crisp and clean, but at the expense of...taste.  A hint of the generic miller aftertaste that reminds you of drinking from a funnel with a hose in your mouth.  Better than Miller Lite... I guess.
Can. Its just water. Easy to drink if youre a woman or a freshman. Heck, why not. Its cheap.

Clean and smooth, check.  Never bitter, check.  There is so little flavor to this beer it barely registers on the palate, however, what you do taste is not objectionable.  Very light, very grainy.  Crisp and sweet.  I recommend serving this bad boy extremely cold.  Nearly clear in the bottle with a light yellow color.  I will give it a style point for having a cool label, however.
Very smooth beer at a great price. I prefer this to other miller products, even more that regular Miller.

consumed in all forms draft, 40oz, 12oz, any way i can get my hand on it... its delightful. easy to drink has some taste which isnt entirely funky nasty pale lager.... not bad.. truly the champagne of beers /sarcasm
Even with my poor ratings, this is still a beer I drink quite often.  It’s cheap and it’s tolerable as long as you keep it cold.
good beer when you need something cheap, not high on flavor, but doesn’t taste like some other american crap
1 of my favorite miller products very drinkable and at a cheap price goes down real smooth overall a decent beer
Draft-what else do I have to add?  I like the commercials, it is better than bud.  I now know what to grab out of the free, picnic coolers.  Produce place, free

A light, sweet, cheap and readily available mass-production brew, Miller High Life, "The Champagne of Beers" is a harmless alcoholic soda pop-style pale lager that’s good when you crack open a very cold tallboy on a hot day. This is a convenience store standby strictly designed for drinking with your buddies and chili dogs out on the front steps. So if you’re an adolescent, overgrown or not, this beer will serve you well. I like it better than Budweiser.It has more character. Even if that character is named Gonzo.

11/11/07: Bottle – and drank from the bottle.
 Humm, this is the first time I’ve tried this beer. Had to pick up a six based on the commercials, which crack me up.   I just wanted to know what the “High Life” was all about.  Advertising at its best.  So, I walk into this new bar down the street from where I live.  The sign in front window says “Weimaraners Welcome”.  I just happen to be walking my weim and we are thirsty.  We walk in the door and are greeted by dozens of weimaraners and of all people, Howie Long.  Howie looks over at me, smiles, hands me a beer and passes a treat to my dog.  Am I living the High Life?

A great baseball watching beer when you are thirsty in the summer.  Goes good with your goofy friends and cards too.  Hands down the best cheap american beer out there.  They slide down quick and easy, so why does it need to taste good?  For gods sake DO NOT let one get warm!!!!  11.50 for a hamburger?!? YALL MUST BE CRAZY!

Is there nothing better (or cheaper) to drink after mowing the lawn.  I think this might be the only context where this is acceptable.  The exception being if you have a need for 60+ beers in a night.  You can’t beat the price, you can beat the taste with almost anything fermented.
Very light. Clear. Can. Sweet smell. Sweet tasting. Very little flavor - definite adjuncts. Not too good.
Better than MGD but that isn’t saying much. Still very bland taste and a aftertaste that is sour. If this is the "high life" I’ll stick with my present life.

Clear yellow color.  Boring taste and appearance.  Definitely not "the champagne of beers."

On tap.
Smells like urine.  Looks like urine.  Tastes like urine.  Palate is like carbonated urine.  Easily one of the worst beers in existence.

Golden color, pours a medium head that dissipates but hangs around.  Primarily has a malty taste.  Pretty light bodied.  Not absolutely terrible, but not even remotely great either.  I’m used to drinking IPAs and Ambers and I’ve had worse.
12 ounce bottle. Classic  macro brew for less tha $1.00 not worth a comment.

Wasn’t this beer at one time the # 2 beer in the nation next to Budweiser? Now it’s Bud Light & Miller Lite.Isn’t that neat Miller can’t spell. Anyway I would take a Miller High Life anyday to that nast crap Lite Beer from Miller , the # 2 beer in this nation. Miller High Life once a premium beer now $6.49 a 12 pack here in sunny FLA. Good for this beer drinker anyday.
i enjoy this one from time to time, i like it’s golden color and the smoother taste.
pale gold.  flavor is lightly sweet.  grains, and corn syrup flakes flavors.  corn syrup flakes?  pours pale gold with a fizzy white head.  my trip to moultrie is getting worse.

I love the picure here shows a 40, I feel kind of dumb rating this.  It really is bad though.  There are some macros that are drinkable and have their place but just shell out the extra buck and pass on this.  I would have given it a one for appearance but I feel that the sight of beer alone garners at least a 2, a one is reserved for non beers.
not that great, looks too much like toilet water, and tastes close to it...

this is simply the worst beer i’ve ever tasted. i got 1/3 way through a bottle when i was 10 and one sip when i was 25. that’s all i ever needed. i’m pretty sure it’s fermented yak urine...sure looks that way.

i dont find much wrong or right with Miller high Life as far as cheap beer goes.  Fair taste when coming from a clean tap.  Good white head.  Refreshing as water on a hot day, low hangover incident. Could be crisper, but the Champaign of Beers makes up for it with character.  it does NOT taste like Pabst as someone said.  Cool bottle.
Bad, and a disturbingly bright yellow.  Nothing much to differentiate it from the other bottom-of the-barrel beers

Had on 2/22/1999.  Color is a light bright gold with good carbonation and head.  Aroma is a light scent of hops with a touch of a skunk to it.  Taste is light and crisp.  It starts with a very light body that goes down very smooth  and clean.  Finish is a light hop fruitiness with a slight bitterness.  It is my favorite American premium but is still lacking in flavor.  It would be a good beer to drink on a hot summer night and the best for beer drinking games.

a 40 and a blunt becomes your stilo.
not a beer that i would buy again but would definitely pre-game in college with it

why is it so carbonated?  why is it hard to find the stubbies...nobodys wants this unless its hot and then you wnat the stubbies.  really it should be on my dirt list but it made it off by a bubble or two.
high life is pretty similar to many other in taste. it goes down pretty easy and not to mention the bottles are pretty cool as well
This beer tastes very similar to the other big domestic beers.  In fact I had a PBR the same day with no noticable difference in flavor.
Don’t know what makes this beer so bad, but all I know is that I hope to never come across this one again.

come on, everybody has kicked one of these back at some point in time.  I gave this a 3 on palate for the refreshing carbonation while still having at least a noticeable taste.  Just missed my "top of the bottom" list.
I drank this beer when I was 18 and had no concept of flavour or taste in a beer.

For some reason i dont think this is that bad a beer, probably my favorite from all the miller productts...i dont know why but it is probably caue it has somewhat of a taste to it and doesnt taste like water like the rest of millers products.

At a kegger. Tasted like cardboard. Or cotton. Not that I’ve tasted either, but it’s what I imagine. That said, as far as beer pong beers go, it doesn’t have that sickening piss-flavored mid-palate taste that say, coors light or any of the "cervezas," making it much easier to chug during pong.

12oz bottle.  Okay somebody handed this to me at a picnic and it didn’t kill me.  Not that it’s saying much but it at least had more character than other American mass productions.  Plus their tele commercials are hilarious.
This beer is a nightmare amongst nightmares. I really don’t understand the name but whatever. I’ll take Mickey’s over this. Overly carbonated and a nasty finish.
Eh, not bad. Typical pale lager, very thin on the taste, but easy to pound back.
12. oz can.  pours a staw color with a grassy aroma settling with a small white head. lively carbonation. Faint malt and subtle soft bitter spice. finishes surprisingly refreshing.

It isnt all that bad. Blind taste test and you got an easy 10th place finish among 12.
Taste is not great....so what....i’d drink this over colt 45 anyday

Absolute crap, but those 8oz’ers go well in the sun.  $3.65 for an 8 pack is pretty nice for some afternoon fun.  The Champagne of Beers is really a farce but its all good sometimes...Piss yellow pour, flavorless, skunky but when really, really cold, it is passable for and bitter.  8oz’ers rule!!!
My college beer of choice. Taste isn’t revolting, even out of the can. If you serve it at a party, complaints will be minimal.

If by "champagne" they mean "Andre", then yes.  Only passable when having a 40 and one doesn’t care how intoxication occurs.  Otherwise, throw in the trash with MGD.  Or give it to guests you don’t really like.
I love the picture of a High Life 40.  The beer looks and smells pretty bad.  Very carbonated, why do people still drink this beer?

Decent, cheap, easy to drink beer.  I tend to favor Miller beers as far as cheap macros go as they just have more (and better) flavor to me than the rest.   I think High Life is about the best cheap macro out there...$4 for 6 bottles!   Not much on the aroma, smells slightly sweet and like corn, but more refined (less skunked) than MGD or Lite.  Flavor is good within its class, as far as macros go, but consists entirely of corn (like all of Miller’s beers) with some sweetness; not much bitterness to this beer at all, I guess that’s where they get the "champagne of beers" from.  I’m also a fan of MGD, but find High Life smoother and more tasty, maybe more refined is the word.  Overall, when I want a cheap, but still tasty, beer to knock back a few, HL is the one.  Admittedly not even close to the best beers out there, but within its peer group I think HL is the best and my go to brew.
Only beer available during my game. Drinkable, light, and watery sums it up.
Lousy beer that is surprisingly drinkable, abd not as skunky as most cheap beers.

If this is the finest of American beers, it’s no wonder most people have such poor opinions of US brews.  I guess its the champagne of beers in that its so highly carbonated the cap is liable to pop off.  I seem to remember it being more bitter than most American macrobrews, so points for that I guess.  Also, it kinda glows like a lava lamp.

Miller High Life to me, is an average pale lager.  It’s just slightly sweet.  It’s pretty highly carbonated.  It’s not the junk some people write about.  I paid $5.38 for a 12 pack.  It’s a cheap beer, but it’s worth the price.  The other impressive thing to me is that I don’t get heartburn after drinking a couple of bottles.  Some heavier beers give me heartburn.  Plus, after 2 1/2 bottles, the room is not spinning.  It’s pretty decent for a cheap beer.  Having had a chance to try a canned version of the beer (the first one was bottled), there’s a real difference.  The canned version is flat.  It is not nearly as good as the bottled version.  Much rather have the bottled version.

Pours Yellow-Gold. Aroma, sort of sweet, like garbage thats been aged for a week.  Taste is no surprise as it re-inforces the smell.  Actually does have a little sweet kick to it’s watered down corn flavor.  I rate it better than most PLLs.

Miller High Life is to beers of the US as Corona is to Beers of Mexico.

Drinkable when free.

Chill ’n Swill.  Pre-birthday beer.  Grabbed a 40 of this at the local Circle K.  Ironically, my brother sent me a birthday shirt in the mail today.  It was a Miller High Life shirt, which was advertising the champagne of beers.  Fuck, can’t believe I haven’t rated this yet.  Should saved it for a fuckin milestone.  Creamy, grassy, lightly fermented corn aroma with a touch of DMS and some light sweet biscuit aromas.  Not overly bad.  Transparent yellow body with a pretty strong whitish head and a bit of lacing.  Nice.  Spritzy, sour, acetic, astringent start.  A little grainy and corny in the middle.  Finishes a bit metallic and grassy.  A little overdone on the carbonation, but not overly flawed or bad.  Far from good, though.

Bottle. Unfinished with residual sugars, seemingly from some type of grain adjunct in this lager.  A slight hop nip will follow through with a wooden and natural palette.  Although uncomplicated, this brew certainly qualifies as a half decent golden lager.
Not much you can say about this beer other than we have all tried it and lived to learn never again.  This is the king of brown baggers!
piss beer! why is this beer making a come back, it sucks. would rater not drink than drink this beer. poor mans beer.
I’d rather drink Crazy Horse Malt Liquor.  Really.  I’m being completely serious here.  Miller should pack it in.

Appearance: Pours a bright, clear yellow body with a full, sudsy white head.

Smell: Very, very faint of aroma of DMS with a touch of graininess.

Taste: Cereal sweetness with an overbearing, ever-present adjunct corn flavor. No hops to speak of. Finishes sweet and decidedly watery with a slight solventy hint to it.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Moderate carbonation. Suspiciously smooth mouthfeel.

Drinkability: While it’s not one of the worst fluids that mankind has ever developed or encountered, it’s still swill. Swell swill, sure, but still swill.
This sucks.  Real bad.  The only reason I’m writing anything else about how bad it sucks is due to the 75 character minimum for ratings.

I bet this is different than the American version...as it is, High Life in Ontario Canada is just fine. Not much to it, just a bit of corn taste and some pale malts, maybe half a hop in the finish. This is an okay beer, better than a lot of Canadian macros, and even a few of the micros, in fact. Nothing special, but one of the best things Molson brews here in Canada.
Yuck, this is the WORST beer of all. I can’t believe that it is called "the champaign of beers". It’s grotesque.
this is just the tiniest bit better than Bud... gives American beer a very bad name!

You cannot disrespect the high life.  For the money, this beer is great.  Has a much better flavor than all the other cheap 30 pack beers. And when it comes in the 40 oz bottle it is the best 40 also.

not much of a smell, very light clear feel, smooth to drink. not big on flavor. But its not that horible on a very hot day at a BBQ. Especially if you want to fill up on food and want to drink beer instead of water.
It has a corn/grass odor a piss yellow appearance. Does not taste any better.
Looks like Champagne.  Feels like Champagne.  Tastes like Champagne.  Hmmmm......

Slight skunky smell, with some gross sweatiness thrown in for good measure.  Tastes like a pale lager but with an off taste added.  Not good, but I drank most of the bottle.  How can you waste the champagne of beers?

Bottle (shockingly not a 40oz bottle).  Looks like watery, yellow urine.  Smells like tart yeasty funk.  Taste reminds me of salty sweat a little bit.  Just not a good beer, in fact this is a really sour, awful beer.  Would rather drink a Bud Light than this anyday of the week.
Of all of the miller beers this one is about the best. And that is so sad. Boring taste, no bite, no warm glow. Its like a ride in an elevator.

Simple and smooth. This beer doesn’t offer a whole lot when it comes to flavor or appearance. The flavor is somewhat sweet and goes down like water especially when ice cold. The appearance is a light golden color. I think this beer is great when you really don’t want think about what you’re drinking. Sort of like watching television rather than reading a book. You don’t really have to think much. Did I mention how cheap in price it is? I could dig for change in my couch and afford a sixer. Great beer!

355 ml bottle.  Pours clear amber with a dissappearing fluffy head.  Nothing distinct about the aroma, smells just like any other macro.  Tastes like bland sweet corn.  Feels almost just like water; very light and almost nothing to it.  Hell, it’s cheap though, and for the price, not a bad beer.  I do feel like an alcoholic when I drink it, though.
Had a 32 oz. of 3.2 a few years ago when the only place open after work was a Edwards Street. High Life? Compared to whose? Would be tolerable if it were 11% ABV.

Pours clear yellow with a minor, fluffy white head. Aroma is very minor, but lightly sweet. Flavor is sweet. Some signs of corn and rice adjuncts in there, but no specific flavors.  Mouthfeel is rather watery. 

This was a difficult rating. It’s hard to give a good, objective rating on this beer due to its name and reputation. However, it is better than several I’ve had in the past.

Its palate is simple and uncompliated, its light on flavor and the apearance isnt anything spactacular.

BUT it is cheap, and it goes down smothly. no lime needed.

IF it tastes good, DRINK IT.

Light on the palate, almost evaporates on my tongue. Not strong on flavor, which is perfect for this type of beer.  If I am trying a new beer I always pick up a 6-pack of High Life to fall back on.   A true American-Style Lager.
A LITTLE SWEET TASTE ON THE LIPS. GOES DOWN PRETTY SMOOTH. REFRESHING BREW. LOW RATING ON THE AROMA BECAUSE THERE ISN’T MUCH OF ONE. GOOD BEER FOR THE SUMMER MONTHS.

Yellow soda-like pour. Watery flavor and palate. Almost no aroma or flavor. I can’t help but feel I am rating this just to get a rating, but I did actually drink this during the weekend, so I feel I should.

Why do people do this to themselves? If you have to drink a macro, Coors light is the way to go. At least it doesn’t taste bitter (in a bad way) and linger in your mouth until you find something to remove the taste. Would sooner give up beer than drink this again.

Slightly better than bland in every aspect.  just an un-offensive, no redeeming characteristics, everyday unimaginative vessel by which to consume some alcohol.  Considerably cheaper, but also considerably better than MGD----Miller has somehow gotten away with pricing MGD higher than High Life, and pulling the wool over the eyes of the masses.  At least this tastes like beer, reminds me of my college days

Pure American gold. Aroma like a college football game, anemic gold color, head taller than the beer, cheap as dirt and much more like beer, the 32 oz can brings back only the best memories. The common man’s brew. If you hate this beer you have no humor, no soul, and are a beer snob - the only thing worse than a teetotaller.
12oz can, 12oz bottle, 40oz.  A refreshing beer thats great for a BBQ.  Better than Miller Lite.

This was the first beer I can remember tasting - around 10 I think.  I hated it then and I kinda feel bad for it now.  The ad says "always smooth, never bitter." The apparent use of corn (like Yuengling) really comes through with each taste.  If this beer had some bitterness it would be a delicious refreshing beer....oh wait Victory makes lagers like that!. Oh well, I will just savor the memories.....

Thanks Little Don.  Broken 12 pack off the truck.  Freshly bottled.  Good Beer fresh, keep out of the any light and cold.  The clear bottle makes it skunky and pasty to the taste bud if placed in the light for any amount of time.  The Champagne of Beers... I guess I’m living the High Life?!
I bought this beer because I loved the commercials of a guy living "the high life" just to find out that drinking actually provided me with anger for the lost money.

I was expecting a really grassy, hay, cardboard taste based upon my last experiences with High Life, but I have to admit that it wasn’t so bad this time around (compared to other cheapy beers). There were, obviously, a lot of adjuncts in the beer (pretty corn heavy), but I think I would honestly drink this before Bud or Coors. I guess it just depends on how long this beer has been sitting in the convenience store fridge.
High Life indeed.  This is probably only good stoned.  Very fizzy and busy.  Ideal for DMB shows.  $10.99 for a classy 30 pack o cans.
A fizzy and decent brew. Not much to praise, but it is smooth and refreshing. The aroma can really be bad, but for the price..

Cold 16oz. Can - I think this is the best mainstream American beer you can get. It’s cheap, everywhere, flavorful and goes down easy.

When you don’t feel like "fancy" beer, grab a good ol’ High Life.
Not horrible.  Really nice mouthfeel actually.  Sometimes the high carbonation is really what you’re looking for.  Color is horrible though. Piss yellow.  Smells  badly too.

This is what I normally drink if not drinking a micro.  MUCH better appearance (golden straw), aroma, and flavor than Bud or Coors.  Lighter than MGD.  Nothing special, but it doesn’t even pretend to be more than fizzy (e.g., the "Champagne" label).
Pretty bad. It smelled a little like beer and it looked a little like beer. That’s about it.
dont really like the taste of this one, but its not that bad. i agree with others that its easy to drink, makes me burp more often than other beers

Not as bad as a lot of people make it out to be, but then again definitely not as good as it’s market share would indicate.  Pale yellow water, no appreciable aroma.  Very little taste.  Drink it ice cold if you have to.
12 oz CAN.  Unfortunately I did not use a dimpled mug to sample the delights of miller high life.  Simple, boring beer, but easy to drink. Stay gold pony boy.
probably one of the worlds most drinkable beers, high life never lets you down.   sure, it’s not fancy or complex...but sometimes, beer just needs to be beer.

Was surprised to see I had not rated this one long ago.  Today I had one just to put another "notch" on the gun handle.  As expected it was a flavorless macro pale lager.  Very drinkable but not very enjoyable.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours clear golden color with a small white non-lasting head.  Aroma is corn. The flavor is corn.  Thin mouthfeel.  I don’t care for the champagne of beers as much as some of the other Miller offerings (not that I drink the Miller offerings much at all).

This is what I buy when I’m down & out.  Before I started drinking beer someone brought a 12 pack of these to a party I attended, I thought to myself "Wow, this girl must have some dough to be bringing a 12 pack of the Champagne of beers."  Haha, how foolish was I?  Clever marketing, decent piss water for the price, drink it fast and for the buzz not the taste.
I finally tasted the High Life.  As expected, not very good.  Is it better than Bud?  Not really sure, but I’m not about to do a side by side taste test to find out.
Not bad for cheap beer.  No real taste so its easy to drink alot.  Still you should avoid this unless its all you can afford.

Not much of an aroma...smells like beer.  Lots of carbonation...very drinkable...and probably great on a super hot summer day.  Not terrible, but nothing great and special.  One thing is for sure is that it is the same Miller High Life I remember from days gone by.

aroma was slightly skunky, very pale, very clear, full head, mixture between a fizzy and creamy head, smooth taste, body was very light, medium carbonation.  Would not buy again.  Not that its offensive, just nothing going for it. Nice if your mowing grass, or digging a ditch.  But, if your wanting to relish a good beer this is not it.
The champagne of beers.  I like it.  really I do.  6 pak cost me 3.49.    Its smooth and has a distincly American flavor.....
Smooth, like buttery ass.  But its cheaper than budweiser.  Very corny.  Really crappy looking.

There is not a lot to say about this beer that is good, not for me anyway.  The beer is a nice light gold colour that is reminiscent of American lagers.  There is no discernable smell to speak of nor is there any discernable taste.  The mouthfeel is very watery with hints of carbonation.  Overall this is not a beer that I would try again, nor is it a beer that I would recommend to others..  It gets a 6 overall simply because they had the Bottom Bottle Opener at one time.  Unfortunately the case we got contained bottles that had obviously been used many times before because the glass around the opener had been well chipped/worn away meaning that we needed the bottle opener anyway.
Ghastly yellow white with big white head. Sweet corny aroma is hopless.  I’m sad because once I open a beer I’m virtually obligated to drink it.
Canned(355ml). -Pale yellow coloured, small airy (almost no)  white head, fizzy. The taste is completely corn, sweet corn, soapy corn, syrupy corn  and of course corn in the finish.

The perfect working man’s beer.  It’s in a class all it’s own and really shouldnt be compared with pale lagers, it is marketed as a regular beer and should be treated that way.  a great beer for the person who just wants to have "a beer" every now and then.  i don’t ever bother pouring this one into a glass, right out of the bottle is the way it was meant to be.  Tastes light and slightly sweet with no aftertaste.  goes good with cigarettes and food.  Live the high life!

The color was pale yellow.  The head was fizzy and thick-bodied.  The aroma was extremely lacking.  The flavor was not very yeasty and tasted like your typical macro-brew.  The palate was thin and the finish, abrupt.

hmmm.... how can i put it... it tastes like your licking a rusty pole... but hey if you dont have enough money for a good beer, or you dont like ice house or red dog then go ahead and try this discrace to america

Finally get to rate SAB/Miller’s oldest brand of beer. Pours a light clear golden pale blonde brew with a fast dissolving white head. Aroma of multi-grain malt, mostly corn, alcohol, and some sweet rice.  Taste is highly carbonated, lightly sweet with a very, very clean fnish. No bitterness or any aftertaste. Pretty much another Macro-brewery produced corn brew.

I dont really feel like rating it like  I rate REAL beer, but  I must say this beer sure has gotten me so many memories. Golden colour, aroma of grains and some malt, thin maltish and grainy flavour. Cheap and drinkable when washed down well cooled. The most hilarious about it is the slogan: "The Champagne of beers"! Great joke!.
xxx only reason i ever drink this is because there is a special of $1/pitcher of high life that just cant be turned down.
Yellow in color.  NO hop taste.  NO malt taste.  Watery.  This does not represent the finest of American beers.  Beers like this make me ashamed to be an American.
its high life. good with food, good after work, good with friends, but not worth 3 bucks at a bar. i drink it often, its part of my regular rotation of pbr, grainbelt premo, and high life.
This is probably the greatest beer ever. I feel the 40 oz bottle really brings out the true flavor of this one of a kind brew. Truly the champagne of beers.
12 ounce bottle. Shaker glass at the bar. No apparent smell. Crisp and clean as advertised. Not much else. It does not have that annoying grainy taste that MGD does. It’s just kind of there.
One of the best Miller products...period.  This is one of the only ones I can have ice cold on a hot day and enjoy it.
people tend to hate on all macrobrews no matter what but I enjoy this one evry once in a while.  Softer and smoother tasting than many of it’s counterparts.  Nice to drink ice cold on a hot day.
very cheap rice taste, watery, not much carbination at all, definitely not the champagne of beers.

Drank straight from the bottle redneck styel. I actually liked this MUCH better then Bud...Best cheap beer I have had yet, actually...Even straight out of a bottle! Yep, I am indeed, living the high life!!

You are living the high life when consuming this beer.  I will only compare cheap domestic beers with each other.  So, on that note, I would rate this a lot higher than most cheapies.  I consider price a big factor in rating beer and that is where the High Life stands out.  After a night of consuming mass quanities of this fine product, I might wake up not knowing where I am, but I don’t feel like I got ran over by a dump truck.  And, I never had the liquid squirts off of this stuff.  Isn’t that what we are really looking for in life?

Hard to imagine it gets any worse than this. This stuff tastes AWFUL! It’s too heavy; also looks and smells like some of the worst beer I’ve ever had. Only positive side is the price, but I’d buy just about anything over this.

A good, old school beer. I consider the reasonable price a bonus, not an indictment.  It’s just proof that the whole world hasn’t gone completely crazy. The question is if this is the champagne of beers, what is the beer of champagnes?
typical mass produced stuff.  I just like it for the slogan.  This is the trailer park champange.
Well...30 of them costs about 12 dollars if you shop around.  I think that speaks to both the beers qualities and faults.
i gave this a higher rating than what its defaulted at because its beer, and thats about it.  you can do better for the price, even though it is pretty cheap.
i don’t know if i’m awesome o what but this tastes exactly like corn.  it’s definitely carbonated.  especially easy to drink.  especially terrible in taste.

From the tap, served at a cold cellar temperature in a shaker glass.

Poured a clear pale yellowish macro lager golden with a foamy, bubbly white head that slowly dissipates in a thin sudsy lacing.

Faint, clean aromas of cereal grains and sweet corn, no real hops scents.

Good, fizzy carbonation and a softly crisp, dryish, thin and clean, smooth, yet firm, light bodied mouthfeel.

Like practically any American macro lager, a thin, sweet malt presence, cereal and sweet corn, I’ll give this marks for not tasting like boiled, overly cooked corn, a little corn "fruitiness" towards the end, nothing really in the way of hops, and a dryish, sweet and clean finish.

A safe, predictable choice from the tap, after a round of golf on a hot, muggy afternoon, did the trick, somewhat refreshing.
