color is pale gold. nose is corn and some grass. taste is strong of cereal with a sweet malty finish.
I love this stuff! It’s sooo cheap, yet it does not taste it. High Life is a very underrated beer. It’s very smooth and strong. It’s way better than it should be at it’s price.

RE-RATE::  24oz can.  I drank this one side by side  along with the Miller High Life Light.  Not much difference!  I was amazed how the color, the aromas, even the flavors were identical.  The only difference,(and this is really digging)is that the head dissipated faster on the Light.  Aroma of pale lager.  Light malt.  A little corn, a little fruit.  Light bodied.  Overall, perfect on a sunny day. 


Tap.  Overall, it is the Champagne of Beers!  Poured a clear, golden pale.  Aroma of corn and malt.  Very fizzy.  Not very appealing anymore.  When I was in College this was the kool kidz sudz...

(12 oz. can) Miller High Life is a very sparkling light golden lager with an ample white head.  It actually has good retention and leaves good lacing.  How about it.  The aroma is faint and of corn and butane.  It is watery and slightly bubbly on the tounge.  There isn’t really any flavor except for maybe some strange chemicals.

Champagne o’ brews. Absolutely no taste. Some notes of hominy. No real smell. To be honest, it isn’t that bad though. It’s kinda like drinking urine colored soda water, except this will cause bad hangovers and loose stools. $7 for 12 ain’t bad though.
I only had 2 bucks in my pocket, and it was 11pm, Forgive me! Quite sweet, corney, but I’ve had alot worse, I drank it, it was ok, can’t belive I haven’t rated it, drinkable, but not good. eh..
This is crisp clean and refreshing. By no means is this top shelf beer but it just works.

12 oz bottle-its the champagne of beers how can you go wrong... still crap. There is one staple point in this beer in that you can buy it cold, let it go warm, and then stick it in a fridge and it won’t skunk... scary

This beer isn’t bad but not real good. Would drink again. Bought a 12 cold drank 2 and said "not too bad" Left it in the back of my truck for about a month and drank one warm in a field. Me and my buddy said, "tastes the same cold". Put the rest in the fridge about a week later and next day drank another. tasted the same. Truly amazing beer.

Rated 1/3/06:  This is not my first choice when it comes to the classic american pale lagers but I do get the itch every once in a while. Yesterday my friend brought over a 12 pack of bottles for the Fiesta Bowl and after drinking a few porters I made the switch. I had two of these beauties right out of the bottle, they were cold, refreshing, and delicious! The key to the high life for me is to stop after two or three.
Hey, Its better than Any of the light beers by far. The taste has Bud beat to hell and back. Stuck in a dive with this and a dozen light berrs its King. Just hold your nose when you drink it
Thin, fizzy, skunky.  Non-existent finish.  Quenching for what it is. Cheap as hell too.  I’ll drink if someone hands me one.
cheap, dry, sweet, nasty. MESS WITH THA HIGH LIFEE AND THE HIGH LIFE WILL MESS WITH YOU.

Ah! the champagne of beers. dry as a popcorn fart in church. Had it semi warm. stored in basement. Thought. woh thats one skunky beer. then in order to make sure I wasn’t going to create a biased rating I tried a cold one stored in the refridgeratador. Not much different. At least it’s stronger then the other piss waters out there. Foss used to love this. cause it was gold and he thought he was a king.

THe only merit I can award this brew, is it’s palate. I am not a hard drinker, but I drank a six pack in little over an 2 hours.
That was a first. Very crisp, and yet ultimately nondescript.
what a mess. if you combine some honey thats been sitting out in the sun for a week, some sweat from some old gym socks, and bear excrement fortified with rat dander, you get this beer

This is my favorite cheap beer. It’s obviously very simple, little corn aroma, nothing special about the appearance. This is usually what I’ll drink during cookouts/bbq’s if it’s around. It has a better taste than MGD. High Life is what got my started drinking beer, and it deserves praise. As I ponder/test taste more beers in my young age, I will never forget you. Here’s to, the High Life. Cheers.

In the pony bottle at the High Life Lounge in Des Moines and in the can during Dollar Beer night at Rosenblatt Stadium. I remember gathering uo those tiny clear pony bottles of Miller from the ditchlines when I was a kid so that I could use them for BB gun target practice. Who knew that I would someday be drinking the swill contained therein? Perhaps I would have done better to have grown up a shooter and not a drinker...  Nonetheless, for my money in the BMC ratrace, Miller wins the dubious distinction. One question though, just what the f**k kind of chemical do they put into this "beer" to keep it from getting skunked? I mean, I’ve never, ever had a skunked High Life and it spends its entire life in clear bottles surrounded by intense fluorescent lighting. If I could score some of this chemical to rub on myself, I’d never have to take a shower.
pours a very light golden color and has a very light head. has an overbearing taste of corn like other cheap pale lagers but is one of the better cheap beers.
a golden barley, two stage taste pattern that transcends into a lightly toasted wheat. the palate starts light and deepens a bit. tastes golden but on the light side.

This beer is flat for getting drunk.  Can’t find much to like about it.  Very watery, typical American style beer.  But if you would like to get drunk for a cheap price, or can’t afford another beer I guess this is the way to go.  A good tip I can give is to add some lime to it and it takes away a bit of the metallic taste and much easier to enjoy.

You know I don’t even understand why they make this beer. It should be removed from all shelves. If I could rate this lower I would. To carbonated, no enjoyable tastes. Basically it tastes awful I don’t even want to describe it.
Can.Pale yellow.It smells of corn.Fizzy and metallic.It’s not very good but it is inexpensive.

The way a beer should taste goes
   well with everything whether its
   pizza steak or just hanging out
Of course it is awful, but maybe not quite as bad as most other American macro beers.  Maybe it has a little more corn taste?  Better than any Bud products.

This is what the cool kids drink when they’re not drinking PBR. Comes in a sexy longneck bottle with a cool vintage looking bottle cap. I can see from the clear bottle that it’s fizzy and yellow. The cool kids looked at me funny while I sniffed the mouth of the bottle. I think I smelled some corn. The flavor was light, sweet, and unpleasant in most ways. Before I knew it, I was done with the first bottle and on to drinking about 3 more. There is definitely worse beer out there and few beers make you look as cool as this one does.
Overall, fairly simple and smooth. Almost like drinking water at times. Can be refreshing, though is a bit of a downer.
The world’s greatest beer according to golubj.  He just loves the grainy flavor, which to me is ok to porous.  Pretty generic for the style; not overly bad, but nothing too tasty about it.
fizzy... always leads to a headache... unique from other american macros...
This beer does what it was designed for.  Very little aroma, no head, but carbonation still active after half an hour.  It does have a rich color that matched the 16 oz. can from which it was poured.

Bottle.  This truly is the high life (for those who cannot afford anything that would customarily be considered part of "high life").  Good grainy flavor compared to other american pale lagers.  My favorite of the macro brews of this style.
This has a slight distinction among other miller beers.  I can’t really place it.  It just isn’t as bad.

Champagne of beers?  Yeah thats about right.  Light, bubbly and doesn’t taste  like good beer.  Its an american macro it tastes like all of em.  bready light pissy colored and taste like theyve been skunked.
The "machoest" of the Millers...lol..once again..I give a 1.5 to all big named, American macros...
Use to be a favorite of mine until I discovered what beer can be. we called this a desert cocktail. Serve ICE cold with 2 garlic stuffed olives.

bottle. MGD vs. HighLife. so 2 friends were each drinking 1 and asked me which one i thought was better so i took a sip of each.High Life was very watery, stale, bready, and the flavor was pretty bad, blah blah blah. In the end HighLife ha a bit nicer flavor than MGD.
Slightly better than bud, on par with coors, but not a good as the ol’ PBR. A typical american macro - light pissy and weak.
The champagne of beers.  This beer has a nice crisp flavor that gives a nice smooth flavor that does show some interesting flavors.

Bottle.  Very pale gold.  Cheap, easy to find, great for a light after-work relaxer.  Only complaint is that I was burping constantly while I drank this thing.  Too much carbonation without the flavor to back it up.
Very good all-around beer.  Very versatile.  Also a very inexpensive beer.  Medium finish.
Very bad one, at first interesting if the heat is too high. But later the flavour is completely disguting.

Almost clear, and tastes like skunky water.  The only time this beer is worth drinking is after a couple of hours of mowing the lawn, and only then if there’s absolutely nothing else and no way to get to a bar.  

The stuff smells absolutely awful and comes in 40’s - ’nuff said. 

Let’s see - something good about it?  It’s cheap.  If you’re in college and on a budget... well, it’ beer.  Kinda.
Ewww! It’s cloudy with no justifably good reason. It has a very strange flavor which is unpleasant. If ever a beer tasted like piss it’s the High Life. I’d rather drink the Beast.

Beer drinkers need to be tougher than this gang of wussies. This is not a yuppie beer. This is a beer that puts the salt back in a working man after a hard day’s sweat. This is a beer for someone who’s going to down 12, at least. If you think you are gonna bash someone who likes this one, back up, because my money’s one them. Nuts and bolts standard taste with a back-of-the-throat burn that goes away after number 4. Great as a chaser. Uh, that means for whiskey. Not for Mimosa drinkers or other dilletantes.

Pour was golden; huge bubbles, white head quickly dissipates. Light lager taste. Little to the imagination. Tastes like most value line beers out there. It is more tolerable than Miller Lite. Good lawn mower beer. Sweet initial taste. Some hints of bread, but very little. Leaves a stale/sour aftertaste.
I am probably rating this higher than I should be which is sad. Overall bad beer

The ratings scale does not allow for negative numbers.  Negative numbers would indicate that this piss water took from me.  It provided nothing but a disgusting flavor, an excessive ill-feeling, and the desire to smash anyone who reports this crap as in anyway tolerable.

Can’t say too much about this beer, except that it’s never treated me wrong.  Flavor wise, it’s drinkable, but who really wants to analyze it too much.  Still, as a broke college student, I’m not gonna ever turn it down.  Plus, one of the best labels out there.  It’s only the champagne of beers if you drink really cheap champagne, but hell, there are worse things to drink.

This beer’s redeeming quality is it’s color tones. The flavor itself is very weak, almost watered down. The body is thin, barely any hops or malt - simply bland. This is the kind of beer to waste on beer games. The kind of beer to use up, not enjoy.
The champaigne of beers.  Of course it smells like corn.  Of course it is skunky.  Clear bottles?

This was one of my high school beers (the other was Coors).  I cannot believe this is what I thought beer was.  I am so ashamed...I will never go back to macros.  This is definitly one of those quantity over quality purchases.  Fortunately, I now drink beer for the taste alone.
Similar to MGD, aroma is decent but the appearance is pour. I dont understand the popularity of this beer other than its cheap cost. Flavor is horrid and best served cold.
my favorite ubersession beer. clean and drinkable, unoffensive, even if it has almost zero flavor.
Gold clear pour with a lot of head, that is all there is good to say about this one.

Miller High Life is a budget beer, like keystone or PBR. Hell, man, it’s always dirt cheap. I stay away from it like the plague but recently picked up six in a bottle becasue it was 4 bucks. That famous Horse Urine Stench hits you in the face after opening and all your 8th grade memories come flooding back...say what you will about Wisconsin beer, Miller HL has staying power, and is good during the work week if you are stretched thin.

Apart from the fact that the hops used in this brew are not the best and completely ruin the aroma, I found the flavor to be sweet, light, and agreeable...  Until it got warm.  It was horrible.  The aftetaste does leave much to be desired, but nothing offensive either...  Until it got warm of course!  "The champagne of beer" makes champagne look bad.

Ok. I might have this a bit overrated.  I grew up drinking this.  It pours ultra pale yellow.  It had a big fizzy head that took a while to calm down.  The flavor is sweet with corn and diacetyl.  Very light palate.  This is a beer you can slam.  I know, I know, what’s the use.  Well, this beer has the halo effect with me.  Kind of like Stroh’s...
Standard Macro-brew Swill. the taste of adjunct overpowers everything that would make a beer decent. the aroma was vegetables and skunk. Taste is corn alcohol. not worth worth time nor money

Very sweet and carbonated. Aroma is adjuncts and heavy gross malt. Color is darker than most pale lagers. I heard a rumor that back in the day, all Miller beers were derived from one beer; Olde English. If this is in fact true, I can actually see the correlation between High Life and Olde English. Fan - Fucking - Tastic!
A decent beer to have, mostly out of the can because it will get you drunk fast. It has a higher alcohol content then most other beers in its category. Cheap and good for getting wasted.
the champagne of beer tastes more like a highly carbonated non-alcoholic beer.  nice to enjoy them out of a bottle during the summer, but even less than satisfactory in a can - especially pounders!

Packing 4.7% ABV into this lightly golden color with a fluffy white head is kinda of impressive, I can understand why the 32oz bottles are enjoyed by frat kids, homeless dudes looking for something fancy and when your at a party and the beer is free...Great to drink when it’s hotter than hell and water is just not available...maybe...it could happen. 

But you know what you’re getting yourself into when you pick up a Miller High Life, the champagne of beers of course!
im drinking this beer right now not impressed at all booooooooo miller beers boo them like the creepy foot doctor.

Obviously nothing special here. But as a broke college student, this does the trick for weekend parties. It’s cheap and watery, but it’s definately my favorite of the bud/coors/miller junk. The taste is fine and it goes down like ice water.

Great beer, what can I say I am hooked on it, great price, great taste, you cant go wrong with the champagne of beers, it always has satisfied my beer craving.  I would recomend anyone this beer, I have tasted 100’s of beers and this one ranks in my top 2 with Rhinelander beer being at the top.  Get ready to give your mouth an orgasm, try living the HIGH LIFE!!!!!
a decent beer with an amazing price.  im not quite sure why they call it the champagne of beers though

This is the best cheap beer money can buy, they call it the champagne of beers for a reason. light in color, smeels like bad water, tastes good when near frozen, all in all a decent hot florida afternoon beer

This is one of the very few beers that I honestly can’t drink.  It has a taste which is almost unbearable.  I find absolutely nothing about this beer that I like.  One of my life goals is to never drink this beer again.
You shouldn’t be allowed to drink this unless you have on sweatpants and ducttape is somewhere within your immediate vicinity.
Typical American beer smell, and appearance.  Medium carbonation, refreshing when served very cold.  Fairly smooth.  Non-existant head and quickly diminishing taste.
Haven’t had this in a while, but I remember liking it. An average, crispy, light flavored beer. Refreshing, but a littel flat. pairs pretty well with charred meat, good on a weekend barbeque.

40 oz bottle. $2.08 at the gas station. Nice golden color. Not alot of smell, typical of an american pale lager. Tastes pretty good, yeasty with a hint of alcohol. Pretty smooth finish. A little more palate than a typical american pale, leaves a little bit of a creaminess in your mouth. By the end of the 40 it tastes downright good.
This beer is just another watered down economy pack.  There is no real flavor to this beer.  Good for watching football on Sundays.

smells like a skunks ass but didnt taste nearly as bad as I would have thought for a beer that costs next to nothing.  The flavor (if you can call it that) is gone immediately, but that may be a good thing.  Seriously, this beer is kinda fun to me for some reason.

This is the cheapest, best tasting canned beer,for the price, by far over all the rest of the cheap shit out there... it is sweet and golden out of the bottle or can... $7.99 an 18 Pack{cans} is a really good price is you are looking for an everyday drinking beer, go with the High Life ......

Pretty average stuff. Looks and tastes like your average American pale lager. I do think this is a little smoother than some of the others, so it gets a slightly better rating than it probably should.
drinkalbe is about all better than thier flagships which aint surprising SAB can go to hell i say!

Very clear yellow color, with a surprising amount of acid white head. This bottle must have been knocked around a bit, the suds actually tried to climb up the bottle, like they couldn’t wait to meet my taste buds. The feeling wasn’t mutual, but I bravely pushed on - all in the name of science. Slurped the suds away so I could take a whiff of the gaseous odors. Sweet macrosscented beerish um... what?

Tastes like it smells, only less so. Initially sick sweet, then fades to nothing in no time flat. Very thin body, no beer character at all. Watery and eventually almost tasteless (each sip had that bit of cloying sweetness

For the price I decided what the hell, got a 32oz. It wasn’t bad for the price, has the regular lager yellow color, and some head to it, very non offensive. Way better than Bud. If your in a pinch and want some decent beer, go for this.

Champagne of beers my spit...
Poured like you think, pale and lightly fizzy.
smelled like, well, it didnt smell like mush at all, actually. Like wet hops left over a real hopping.
Taste is limp, but slightly hoppy.
I will give it good mouthfeel and damn high drink ability.
It is the king of Miller, which doesnt say much.

Why does it taste so sweet?  What is this candy?

Give me a Guiness and get this shit out of here!
Bottle: Clear yellow with white head. Skunk piss comes to mind when smelling this gawd aweful beer. Taste was a sweet grain.
Reminds be of bowling, not a very good beer. Tastes like beer mixed with a little cider because its so bitter.
Gimmee a break, it was bowl season.   As if that’s a decent excuse.  Not much in this one.  Yellow, grain, and light sour.  Unpleasant.  Next time I will have a Pepsi.

So my dad-in-law loves this stuff.  I confess, it is the champagne of beers, but still it lacks some basic quality.  It is watery, corn flavored alcohol that is a good thirst quencher on a really warm day.  Other than that, it is not that great. I will take this over a Budweiser, but it’s splitting hairs at that point.

Had this at a party, ice cold from the bottle, after several other beers. Nothing special here, just a typical BMC macro. Okay appearance, aroma and taste of grain, and an aftertaste that left soemething to be desired. However, in the absence of micros and good imports at the party, it fit the bill as well as any other BMC.

I am not going to go to far into this. IT IS SHITE !!! Watery corn flavor/aroma a bit more flavor than coors. It is a crap macro. I sampled it in a plastic cup 3 sips and then right into the trash. Absolute Garbage.
Brilliant gold color with frothy, large bubbled head. Sweet on the palate but smells like sour bread. Not too mad except for the 2 day hangovers.

40oz bottle; bargain (2.99 in UTAH).  Color meh.  Has a slight taste of hops and corn. Goes down nicely.  Preferably served cold and with some snacks.  A good brew for the money and the amount.  Overall I was pleased, will try again.

Smooth, but not much to it. Leaves my mouth feeling like i was chewing on cotton balls for a while if i have a couple. Color is luke yellow, not bad for the price ($3.99/sack). Decent beer for all day consuming.
great this is a great beer it is the best i love it tastes great smells yummy

If this is livin the High Life, I’m glad to be middle class. 
Aroma really skunky, clear appearance nothin special, Flavor is abyssmal, sits on your tongue like I’d imagine piss would. and it’s only 4.7% ABV. Damn, if i’m gonna drink crap like this, better have at least 5.5 or greater

This is the beer to drink when you can’t afford anything better.  In its price range, it’s one of the better brews.  Not very complex or bitter and goes down smooth until the last ounce, which turns very unpalatable.  Nice golden color but the sloped bottle can be difficult to hold.  Serve ice cold with fast food.

I’d like to learn more about how the phrase ‘high life’ come to be used. This one was a twelve ounce clear bottle with a twist off cap.  I’ve grown to become fond of these long neck bottles, it’s becoming with those neat labels and the proud. proclamation of “The champagne of beers.”   The picture in this avatar is missing the pleasing woman in the red dress and hat mounted in the center of the X! These bottle types allow for a great pour. So you are mumbling ‘This can’t be the first time he’s tasted it?”  No it is not….. I’ve had this countless times before I became an amateur ratebeerian.  First, I wanted to get some experience with about 200 ‘good’ beers and really give this brew equal footing before I BMC step on it.  So, this is neither a number padder nor a memory rate.  This beer is being sampled as I review. Pours like any other good pale yellow beer I’ve poured in my former stooges and present steeler stein.   Barely any visual carbonation  but there is a spot where a bubble or two rises randomly. Aroma of a clean dishrag with yeast in the background, nothing much different than other good pale lagers. I have many good experiences with this brew but I’ll try not to let that bias my rating. Nice tingly carbonation on the initial flavor sample.  No offensive bitter hops in there. Does not have any displeasing tones and can be considered a clean tasting beer. Easy to drink - like a refreshing tonic. Finish is tingly as it rolls off the back of your tongue and there is a very , very slight hint of malt or bitter hops on the end, but it does not linger. Hey, this may have been your grandfathers beer but it’s still worth checking into if you haven’t sampled it lately.  Better than Henninger but not quite as sophisticated as Carlsburg.
It’s pale, thin and fizzy. Slightly metallic, corn syrup, and not much else.

This is my least favorite of all the beers I consider to be "bad".  score is 0.2, not 0.5.  Really sick smell (why do people bottle beer with clear bottles?  It makes it oxidate and turn skunky and sick...) Terrible palate no matter what temperature...it doesn’t even sit well after I choke one down.  Foul smelling, weird and nasty tasting, gross looking, it doesn’t feel right in my mouth OR stomach.  What the hell...
I have enjoyed High Life on many occasions. It’s ok on a hot summer day. A light color beer with alittle flavor to it. Not too bad.

Very light with an awful metallic taste that dominated the flavor. I really couldn’t get past this taste, reminded me of that iron flavor blood has, or sucking on a penny. Definitely not the clean, smooth taste stated in the commercial description.
If you like quantity over quality this is the beer for you.  Not much to it.

Nothing to complain about. Typical macro swill. Nothing overly unpleasant and nothing that stands out. If I’m going for a cheap beer theme, I’ll go with Natty Boh, Pabst or Schlitz before High Life. They had some cool commercials back in the day though.

This beer was incredibly cheep and I hadn’t tried it before so that’s the reason I bought this thing. Aroma is kinda skunky and sweet. Pours golden with no head. The beer tastes kinda sweet and with sharp carbonation. It just set me the wrong way. PBR is better in my opinion.
Just a good old fashion brew. One of the better low dollar beers. Nothing to be ashamed of if your seen drinking this.
Has a real nice golden color. Has a light head with little duration. Weak flavors.
Bottle. Ah the champagne of beers! Well not quite. Has a decent look to it and decent flavor that is somewhat smooth.

Typical American macro pale. Not worst of the worst, not best of the best. Can’t describe the taste other than typical. This is a senior citizen’s beer. Miller put the label "High Life" on it to trick old people into thinking it was good. We know better.
Really bright yellow, much sweeter than other pale lagers.  Huge fizzy head, white and lingering aftertaste of corn.  Guilty pleasure on a hot day when on a budget.

I really like the color of this beer -- a bit richer than other pale lagers. Smallish head, but there was some lacing. The aroma is quite unappealing, as there’s a rather strong metallic component to it. The same is true for the flavor, and I have to say I don’t remember Miller products being like this years ago. This odd metallic quality seems to fade as the beer warms a bit, but the overall palatability really doesn’t improve that much.
Golden color, medium white head.  Weak aroma, flavor is a little hoppy, mostly watery.  Slightly better than normal american macro pale lagers.

Bottle.  Brilliant golden pour, large snow white head.  Aroma reminds me somewhat of cat pee, but fortunately it is faint.  Bitterness balanced with some hop flavor.  Not the best Miller offering, but it will do when there is nothing better around.
The worst kind... of beeeeer... all apologies, no apologies.  High Life is a great song by Counting Crows but a crappy beer by Miller.  Try the song, pass on the beer.

They say the chalk soils of champagne gives its namesake wine its distinctness.  Miller filters their beer through chalk.  And its distinct.  I buy 12 of them, I distinctly remember drinking 13.  It chugs like kool-aid, and makes rotund men burst through walls, "Oh yeah!"
I’m not sure I would claim this beer as the Champaine of Beers, but it’s not terrible.  I would rather spend my money on MGD or Miller Light if staying within this family of beers though.

I joined the High Life briefly-- it was the longest 32oz of my life! Just joking (kinda). What can you say about a poorly made American macro lager that hasn’t already been said? I get tired of repeating myself...

Minimal aroma. Nice golden color with a fluffy white head that keeps a quarter-inch line the whole way through the beer. Somewhat sweet flavor with a bit of corn taste. Can’t detect any hop presence. Decent mouthfeel and definitely easy-drinking. I had to re-rate this at the urging of Biggmike. Not entirely heinous for a macro-beer. Especially for the price. I paid $7.48 for a twelver. And that is including tax. Much better than Bud.

The name has given this beer a certain vibe, though really actually unwarranted. First I would never drink with out some sort of food. With this beer I had fries and a  burger. Unfortuantely after my food was ate, I  still had five left. Watery feel in my mouth, aroma too faint to label, however it did some aroma of maybe milk or cheap cheese. Tastes like dairy as well. With food not bad, compliments the grease in burgers/fries.

not as bad as one thinks, but is cheap and shitty, fuck miller bcuz of rusted caps and they don’t give a rats ass about their customers!! prick company! This horrible beer is truly , well horrible! It has a disgusting taste that only gets worse, and it has a terrible after taste to boot, but it is on the cheaper side of the spectrum.

The Champagne of beers, Can any beer really be the campagne of beers..really? 
Anyways. I’ve had worse but not much worse.. I enjoy it for the simple fact that i’ve had memories made with this beer.. i dont know if i’d go so far of drinking it out of a 40oz, more likely a 12 or 22.. I dont like it in the can. but whatever, its a decent beer, actually has somewhat of a flavor. best miller beer I think. theres not alot to say about it. old style is better..and way cheaper, if thats what your going for.

I have a sentimental weakness for this swill water considering the fact that I grew up on it.  However now that I have grown up (and discovered real beer) I have no reservations in condeming it as a false beer that’s not fit for human consumption

Man I remember this stuff back when it was all about quanity. For what it is, it’s not a bad beer. It’s light in body, making it easy drinking,without some of the sweet corn-like flavor you might get with other beers. I’m not sure how they get away with using the word champagne on the label since it’s an appellation...but anyway, there’s very little hop or malt flavor, but it’s lagered clean with no flaws as you’d expect.

Now this is the worst beer I have ever had.  Champagne of beers?  are you kidding me, under what moon?  Smells like urine.  And tastes like urine.  And if it talks like a duck and walks like a duck, than it probably is a duck.  Pass this, I will never drink it again.  Not like I can even get it close to my lips.  At parties in college I would actually hold my breath while drinking it.
a trashy man’s beer.  If I lived in the forest and raped skunks for pleasure, this would be my choice.  A watered down version of water and piss.
In my opinion this is the best "cheap" beer you can buy. Although I can’t say that it’s great. It’s drinkable and better than a lot of other things you can buy at it’s price

A nice smooth drinkable cheap beer. My first experience with this beer was right alongside Budweiser. It was amazing how much more drinkable and flavourful this beer was. Not complex, but nice and simple.
Nasty hard to take down beer, basically shit, BUT CHEAP!   It has a clean start with a bitter after taste.
i agree this is the best miller has to offer! but still not better than budweiser and definetly not the champagn of beer not even close!
Better than budweiser.  Not by much though.  It smells kind of like vomit, which is barely tolerable when drinking it.  Get better beer.

I like this beer.  The best of the Miller family, aside from seasonal and specialty beers.  Light coloring with a white, frothy head.  Easy to drink with a pretty good flavor.  It is especially good on tap.
Not bad for an American beer. True beer taste, if perhaps a bit sweet. At four bits a bottle, you really can’t complain.
12 oz. Bad But is drinkable if it is ICE COLD.My buzz didnt last that long either it is a beer that is to be drank in large amounts like A couple 40’s

Granted I gave it a high rating.  But, IMO it is the best mass produced american pale.  High carbonation, but compared to Bud, Busch, etc.  Much less.  Has a good malt flavor to it, but not tough to choke down like a malt liquor.  It is best drank direct from the bottle as the aroma is a bit skunky.  I am currently drinking it with steak from the grill, and I couldn’t enjoy another beer any more in this situation.  At $0.99 for 24 oz., it is best in class.

I have had this one a number of times over the years. Overall probably my favorite of the macro lagers. Of course being the best swill is a dubious honor. Sampled from a 24 oz can this beer poured a very pale golden color with a huge soapy white head. The aroma is sweet malts with a bit of sour tang and a hint of pepper. The flavor is light dry malts with a vague hint of hops and a slightly dry nutty finish. Pretty tasty for a macro lager.

Tall Boy. 34F Lager Glass, why not pour it into a glass. A sweet and slightly sour aroma not overly pleasant.  Clear pale yellow color, with a white head and a touch of lace. Sweet taste, a touch of hop essence. Smooth ok whatever that means.  Palate is very similar to soda water. Overall not the worst of the macro’s i think I prefer the taste, becuase there is a bit more, over miller light. And 1.39 a tall boy what can you expect.

yellow, high carbonation, nasty.  Tastes like rice.  The chambagne of beer?  Maybe a 2$ champagne.  The only reason this beer gets a 1.2 is because I just had a far superior brew in the same glass and didnt rinse.
My opinion of this beer is not a good one. I find the flavor very bland and the aftertaste bad. I would not even drink this beer for free!
Bad all around.  The lightest of the light beer.  I dont know how they made a high life "light".

i heard once from an older gentleman that high life was considered a good beer when he was younger. i didn’t find it to be quite that, the champaign of beers. and what do macros mean by "smooth"? you hear it everywhere in their marketing campaigns, and yet the only thing that punctuates my high life experience is the twist off cap, a true novelty and sign of quality. miller i salute you.
(Can) Pours yellow with slight white head. Slightly sweet, but otherwise flavorless. Glad I got the can for free.

Rice, corn, light hops, but with a lot of carbonation.  Pretty refreshing, but I know why purists hate this beer.  Clear bottle, unnatural, pale yellow colour and a screw top bargain package are just a few of the characteristics of a lame, macro brew.  But I like this.  People need to realize that brewmasters aren’t the only ones who drink beer.  People do, too. Better than the score reflects.  Recommended on a Cincinnatti chili night or after a day cutting firewood.  Worth the  price at 50 cents a 12 oz. bottle.

Can.  Miller High Life.  I can certainly tell you that there is nothing "high" or "life" like about this beer.  It’s terrible.  One can of this beer and I could puke.  Way over carbonated.  Not a good beer, stick to keystones if you want the cheaps.
THE official beer of North Mississippi.  I drank more of this stuff at Ole Miss for six years (yeah, MHL was the reason) than any other.  But man, this stuff is horrendous.  STAY AWAY!
Cheap Beer, with little taste, mostly corn, very little hop and watery texture, better than bud, but for what it is, its not so bad.

Bottles. Bubbly head transforms into foam. Daisy yellow, actually as pale a yellow as I’ve ever seen in any beer. There is no flavor other than carbonation and the slightest hint beer flavoring. No aftertaste. The is beer flavored club soda. If you chug about 6 or 7 of these in a row fast, you might begin to catch a slight buzz.
Clear yellow liquid with a full white head.  Nose is acrid and adjuncts like rice I think.  mildly sweet but mostly thin and weak watery beer.

Smells like corn and some form of urine. Pours a very pale, almost clear, yellow. Head is white and frothy, there is some lacing. Tastes like it smells (corn, urine). But i suppose it also tastes like it costs (.50 a beer). If you’re looking for something to cruise through/get drunk with this is probably better than Bud or Coors Light, but by no means admirable.
It does the job.  Clear bottles are cool.  It’s fizzy like champagne.  That’s all I got.
The only thing that I can say about this beer that is any good is that the commercials are sort of funny.

the pic of this beer decribes exactly what it is, if it comes in a 40 you know what to expect.  it’s a good beer to bring to a mystery beer party or to buy in a 30 pack on a slummin night.  outside of that, it is your typical bmc.

Aroma: Watery with a hint of yeast, malts, and hops.
Appearance: Pale yellow with a decent lasting head of medium to large bubbles.
Flavor: Of all the Miller brews this one is the only one that has a hint of sweetness against its bitter taste with a just a hint of hoppiness.
Palate: Bitter alcohol.
Overall: I prefer Miller beers over Bud and Coors and when in comparison against other mass marlet brews of this variety it is not terrible.  In comparison against a truly well-crafted it is awful at best.  However, often due to availability at sporting events and dive bars you could do a lot worse than selecting this beer.
this is the cheapest american beer. the head isn´t there and the taste is thin. But i got alcohol in it. not much else to say than chears.

After four years of Miller-sponsored fraternity parties, I can confidently say I am a pro at rating this garbage.  Urine in a clear glass bottle that also contains the world’s worst hangover.  This stuff is for poor bastards that can’t afford Miller Lite.  Avoid at all costs.

I like High Life, and it’s fairly cheap in my local grocer. I bought a 6 pack of 12oz botles for $3.99 and have enjoyed every minuted of drinking this tasty beer.

A++
Its the champagne of cheap beers.  It tastes a little better than bud light and has more substance than blue ribbon.

With all the good micro-brewed beers in this country, I can’t believe anyone would choose to drink this swill.   See my comments about Budweiser, it pretty much applies here.  Another company that spends plenty on marketing and advertising and next to nothing on ingredients and brewing.  Warning:  Must drink ice-cold to distinguish from urine.

Tall boys for 99 cents. that’s all i got to say. Really though, this is an easy drinking beer that I easily perfer over all other Miller beers. Goes with the BBQ, pizza, late night drink fests, you name it. This beer has no exceptional taste to speak of, besides an average exceptionally expected beer taste.

I personally find High Life to be delicious.  It’s just one of those anomalies that exist I guess because I am usually very critical of cheaper beers.  It has a smooth, light, and always pleasing flavor down to the very last drop.  I grew up on this stuff and will continue to live the high life.
Ah yes, the champagne of beers. Eh, okay cheap beer. Don’t expect anything. It’s good for what it is.
This is your average cheap beer, but I do enjoy the label thoroughly.  "The Champagne of Beers."  A blatant lie, but a fine slogan.

Miller High Life
Deuce-deuce in a brown paper bag
Always fresh, always sampled.
Guzzled.

Couldn’t see through the bag, but from years of experience looking through one of the few clear beer bottles left on the market, a perfectly refreshing 24K pilsner gold.

Smelt of the paragon of cheap american pilsners.

Taste was extremely hoppier and maltier than most swills. MHL still clings on to some taste.

Overall, the champagne of beers.

Notes: The Story Of Eugene
A cool old dude comes in the beer store everyday; recently retired, chaw drippin from his lower lip. Before he retired, every weekday, Boss, would buy a deuce-deuce of the High Life for the road. Eventually, he retired, and I would see him only on two or three random days a week, when he would do menial manual chores. Then he started coming in almost every day, so I asked him why he’s working so much if he’s retired. He said "Oh, you know, gotta stay busy" I just realized today that his only thrill in life left is unapologetically drinking a brew while driving home after work. Also, he’s an old man, he can get away with anything. He probably has a garage full of plates in case he gets caught. That is how I will live my last quarter century.
why did i drink this?  i had this beer just before heading out to the bar, and i wish i would have waited to spend way too much money on an average beer there than have this free drink.
This stuff is pretty bad.  Tastes like a corn malt liquor.  Other than being cheap this beer fails on all points.
Pours clear yellow, white head. Aroma is malt and sweet corn. Flavor is malt and corn. No complexity.

12 0z bottle.Pours a very light yellow with a fast fading head.The aroma of fermented corn and lack of hops is present.There is a sweet funk with no hops present with an aftertaste that makes me just want to throw it away but that might be classified as alcohol abuse.
junk junk junk.. you’d be better off finding a bum on the street to donate this "beer" to than drinking it yourself. save your money and buy real beer.

This stuff was pretty awful.  The aroma was funky, wrong.  This beer is very, very heavy.  There is little bitterness, just a strong, heavy, funky malt.  Miller light is so much better...I don’t understand the point of this stuff.

Nothing like enjoying the champagne of beers in a 40 oz. bottle equipped with brown bag.  Best kept in the brown bag as to not remind the drinker of what it actually is.  Comes out rough on the back-end, too... damn champagne!

Quite possibly, one of the worst beers ever made.  Smells horrible, tastes wierd, like corn juice with a little cheap liquor thrown in.  Must be the champagne of beers because it is so over-carbonated.  A definate must not.
Not a real nice aroma  - I mean slightly uriney.  Decent palate and carbonation.  No bitterness but really no real flavor.  Too smooth.  No character.

Bottled, 500ml. Yellow, highly carbonated, white head. Another chance to experience the taste of an American Macro, and boy is this bad. A roughish sweetcorn type flavour covers the tongue with the cardboardy flavour of CO2 added to this is a tinny sweet perfume note. I try not to be harsh, but this is really bad.

This is the beer of choice for college girls. They all drink it like its their job. It has a very flat watery taste, thats complemented by a mild skunky flavor. Oh and i forgot to mention bottles are almost always double the price of cans...and that’s because the cases of cans taste totally horribly different.
What can i say!  When you cut the grass or do yard work.  You need to drink this.  Light color.  Smell of malt and some smoke.  Tastes very weak.  It’s like drinking water.
The most watery of beers. How can they still print the label "The Champaigne of Beers"?

Poured from a 32oz can. Pours clear yellow with a soapy white head. Leaves bubbles on the glass that look like soap. Smells like soap. Over-carbonated, the usual American macro corn taste. I heard my grandfather considered this beer his "special" brew for celebrations and such. I certainly hope it tasted better in 1960 than it does now.

you know what it tastes like, if you live in the us, you’ve had it.  its simple a bit of malt that yeilds a low level of alcohol. very little flavor, palate, and aroma, but this for me and (probably like many others) is the first beer i ever enjoyed. and i can credit the champagne of beers for opening up the door to enjoy thousands of other really good beers.

   i love that they picture a 40 for this.   .. ahh that takes me back.
Salty and bad. Very watery and cheap. If miller wants to call this the champagne of beers its definitly 4 dollor champagne.

This was the hands down winner in our Redneck beer blind taste test. It had more flavor than all the other cheap beers, but still not very good. If this is the ’Champagne" of beers all the other Miller products must be the High Lige of beers.

A medium to light body American lager. This has mostly light grain aroma and grain corn flavor with no complexity. It has a bit more of that flavor than say Coors. A mediocre macro that falls between Coors and Bud, average in an unremarkable class. Not really bad but just very one-dimensional.
Woof.  No good, I’ve had it out of a can that was mediocrely warm which couldn’t of helped, but cold vomit doesn’t taste very good either so I’ve heard.

Sampled as any Macro lager should be in a disposeable clear plastic beer cup.
Yellow/gold with a small white head.
grainy aroma and grainy taste with a small hint of malt.
another watered down horse piss in a bottle. not entirerly drinkable, unless you want to be sick.
No head, clear pale yellow colour.  Smells like corn piss.  Bland corn taste, bland wateriness.  Complete shite.
Pale piss yellow color with some light fizziness and a small white head. Light grainy aroma. Sweet grainy flavor in the beginning with strong corn flavors in the end.
I drank this the other day? Gave me heartburn and a sour stomach. No taste,  just like Bud. About the same level. My Dad liked this, but he liked Eastside too!
What is this swill? Burns going down. No flavors meriting description, it seems to be mostly.....water?

After drinking this a bunch this weekend, I’d have to say that I didn’t mind it that much.  I only drank it out of a can...and the majority of it was after finishing a keg of oberon.  It does taste like corn syrup...but there were definitely times of drunkeness when I found myself thinking "this is the champagne of beers."  Sure it is a shitty macro, but I think I’d rather have this than some of the uber shitty micro/crafts I’ve had.

A sad misnomer as a "beer." I would never have tried this one, were it not 1 of 3 sad selections in the fridge in a beach rental property that were for the taking. In fact, I felt obligated to try it since I’d never buy it on my own. Blah, blah, and blah.

If this represents the finest in American beers, I am undoubtedly moving south to Mexico.  Fortunately, I think Miller was pulling  our leg on this one.  It’s not as bad as Miller Light, but overpowering corn, carbonated like crazy, and nice and watery.  One of the better beers you can buy in a 40 ounce bottle, but that doesn’t say much.

my friend loves this enough to pay $2 extra for it.  i have nothing positive to say, therefore i will say nothing at all.  rerate: my god the bottle looks like shit.  funny they use it to advertise. apparently champagne of beers means it’s the most cornish smelling beer ever.  probably canned: i eat lot of popcorn and it tastes/smells like neither the unpopped nor popped form.

Draft. Pours yellow gold with a large white head. Aroma typical macro, grain, corn, water. Flavor is corn, watered down, grainy. Thin bodied, not a good brew, if that is the high life, it ain’t for me.

dont listen to most of the reveiwers on this beer. the sweet aftertaste is so nice that you know your living the high life. you know that its mass produced but thats why it has a clean and easy drinking flavor to it. please drink this out of a bottle and drink it very cold. great beer to chug even better to put in the beer bong(john wyane!!!) all i have to say is ask eric thompson about the high life!!!!! r.i.p. c.lutz

*Clear* 12oz bottle--Im rating this on a hot and humid night with it right out of the fridge so I may be a little biased. Maybe not... Aroma is standard and weak of sweet bread/corn. Flavor begins slightly better that some other US macros with a fuller cereal flavor but then quickly recedes to the typical metallic corniness. Palate is also standard and does nothing that stands out. If youre looking for something light and refreshing while staying a step above corn seltzer and only happen to have a few bucks, this might work for you. PS - high life? I can only assume it means ’high’ as in ’stoned’. champagne of beers? ...ok, so  thats like the monster truck of golf carts i guess

I’d say this is a cut and paste job from a dozen other pale lagers I’ve rated but that’s just not true.  They’re all very bad in their own particular manners.  Idioms.  Clear straw hue with a medium and frothy white head that dissipates damn quick.  Aroma has a bit of hay and corn to it, but both are overshadowed by expansive farmlands of rotting vegetables.  Yum.  The flavor doesn’t manage much better and is, in fact, exactly the same.  Plus more rotten veggies.  Mouthfeel is thin, watery and extraordinarily fizzy.  At least it washes away quickly.
Light taste is all it has going for it.  Inoffensive, but not very good.  Watery.  Champagne of Beers my ass.

Miller High Life for the lowlife. Had this with some americanised chinese food. I’ve been loosing weight, down to 170 now! Figured ID combine the two to purge a few more pounds later when it made me so sick I vomited. Anyhow,  taste like soupy grits or something. Those corn grits. nasty yo. nasty. I had to wash this down with a bottle of water and a rolling rock. then I had to wash that down with 2 more bottles of water. Anyhow, its almost clear, not crisp, doesnt really have much taste. sweet corn. yahoo :- ( LOL @ Bartzilla’s review. I thought the "hipster" beer was Pabst?

I love High Life.  Head and shoulders above anything in its price ballpark.  Cheap, refreshing, and delicious when served just above freezing.  I used to love case race night in college because of this beer.  Major skewing for memories.

Had on tap for this rating. It’s yellow in color with a white head. Aroma is sweet malts and corn. Flavor is more malts and a touch of corn with a hint of hops buried in there somewhere. Good  ice cold on hot summer days when you just want to slam some down. If I have to drink a mass produced american beer give me a High Life.

This pale lager pours a pale light gold color from a clear glass screw top 40oz bottle. Medium sized white foamy head. Aroma is corn and sweet, some chemical. A medium bodied pale lager. Malts are sweet, touch of cereal and grain. I could say fizzy yellow beer and be done with it, but it does not have the horrid metallic and medical flavors some of these mass produced beers get. Still it kind of sweet and thin and over carbonated. Better than Budweiser. Mouthfeel is thin. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is sweet and a little artificial.

I dont care, I like High Life, better cold from an iced cooler than the fridge and only in a bottle.  HL was the first (legal) beer I ever had, and I like the sweet grainy taste better than most mass produced brews.

<!-- B -->12oz bottle<!-- /B --><!-- BR -->
First bottle i’ve had in years and it will be the last for years to come.  Cheap, so if quantity over quality is your goal, go for it.
this beer is for somebody you does not like good beer and wants a cheap buzz taste like frog...... i would try to avoid
Average American beer. It has a slightly sweet  flavor.   Ok on a hot summer day.  Aroma slight.  Appearance not inviting.   Flavor is acceptable for the price.
Simple evaluation, smells like the lion house at the zoo.  Not to be crude, even the loyal drinkers in the Pub asked Erma for four more enimas

For my 50th review, I wanted to make it a special beer, something near and dear to my heart.  Something that gives me fond memories of more sophisticated times.  Something that takes the upper eschelon and redefines it on the merits of it’s greatness.  Unfortuantely, this isn’t it and my 50th review is wasted begging you people to flush this crap down the toilet. Gross.  Hipster juice. The only remotely redeeming quality of this might be the fact that the bottles make good weapons in bar brawls.  And, trust me... if you’re at a bar that serves this, there will be plenty of fools you’ll want to club with a bottle.

Bottle,  Won’t drink it again, once is enough.  So light yellow with no head.  First opinion of taste is wow, this is good but within 15 minutes I wanted to give it to the drain, but didn’t want to offend the person who gave it to me.
Actually not a bad beer...especially if it’s hot out. Bit of flavor for a pilsner....even if it is corn.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Pours a beautiful, clear pilsener golden with a small, white head. Aroma of brewing syrup. Sweetish, malty body with notes of chicken fodder. "The champagne of beers", the label promises, and it does indeed look pretty in its clear bottle, but this really is just another American Pale Lager. 060406
I have consumed more of this beer than any other in my entire life. It is dirt cheap and you can guzzle it like water. Still on of my fav’s when u are just looking to get hammered on a budget!

The first time I tasted Miller High Life, I wondered why it is called "High Life". This is generally low quality beer that is brewed for quantity rather than quality. The beer is too watered down with barely anything left to taste. The head is thin and slimy, smells like bland rice. This beer is bland.
Smells like corn. Slightly fizzy, aftertaste isn’t the greatest. There are worse....
Your basic run of the mill mass produced beer.  ............................
the champagne of beers huh?  doesn’t champagne taste horrible too cause this sure does. barely any aroma, and the flavor reminded me of mouth wash, but on the bright side it’s cheap.

Bomber. Smells like: Corn, sweat...like creamy sweat. Tastes like almost nothing. Watery, but not oily, lots’s carbonation its actually pretty refreshing. Goes without saying that this is ugly pale yellow with a soapy head. So, this isn’t offensive, but seriously, for the same price you could have a Pabst (still not too exciting, but, well, actually has some flavor). For just a few cents more you could have a Yuengling, so why bother with this? Because you can use the bottle to hammer nails into Sheetrock afterwards, that’s why. This is just...beer. It is just so blue collar, you have to love it on some level.
A cheap beer, but for its price its actually not that bad.  Would take a micro beer over this one just about any day though.
Strong but smooth taste, is quite drinkable. A refreshing tasting discount beer for sure.
Not for me.  Light, crisp, yellow.  I’ll drink it in a pinch.  Hate the commercials.  I’d prefer a Bud for those times when you want something watered down.
this is by far the best of the cheap beers even though it may be like drinking water. on the other hand sometimes it tastes good, sometimes it doesnt, depends on the batch you get
If you like american beers, i feel sorry for you.  But if you need to drink something american, this is the beer to do it with.  Decent, light flavor, with a pretty color.
Well, it’s got a nice color, I guess. It’s got a very boring taste, though, very typical to the big American breweries.
This is definitely one of the best of the Millers.  I will definitely take this one on picnics this summer.  But I would rather have a Genny, and give the Miller to my friends.  Still Good.
your average macro brew pale ale.. BORING!!! come on, why don’t they just get rid of this and stick with miller lite and MGD!!

This is the best beer I have ever fockin had.  Seriously, it’s great!  It’s got the color of gold.  And you know what gold makes?  It makes bling bling.  Biotches.

I will never drink another beer unless it’s Miller High Life.

It truly is a champagne of beers, because it is brewed in france.  Thank you france.  Thank you.
You know this is probabally one the better beers on this site when the photo shown is of a 40... This is a trashy beer. Tastes like burnt corn, and club soda.
Super carbonated.  No head.  Bitter flavor.  Just bad beer.  But for 17 cent drafts ay a St. Patrick’s day parade... you choke them down.

boy i’m stretching now.  funny i found this beer. one of my buddies from school who used to only have a keg of snpa on tap at his house at all times.  grabbed a couple of these last time i was there and said he really enjoys the flavors of high life.  holly sweet corn adjunt water flavors bat man...has the boy lost his mind?
This is a bad tasting alcoholic beverage.  It does not qualify as beer in my eyes. Flavor is just plain bad.  Way too carbonoated.
they say this is the champange of beers, and I believe them. It has the nastiest sweet taste. Its like a wine beer, and I wont touch it.
Way overrated, not on here but from people I talk to.  If I bathed a sweaty dirty bum in water, carbonated and bottled it, it might compare to this.

What can I say.  It’s cheap, and very pale.  But I can drink it, especially on special for $1 at the local bars.  I think its my favorite of the cheap beers, I mean come on, it is the champagne of beers ;)

Another shampoo/conditioner from
Miller.Don’t drink it!A clear bottle could 
only improve this beer.

Fizzy pale yellow with a head that is gone before you know it.  Weak aroma of corn sweetness.  Flavor is quite like a cheap malt liquor - just about no hops, very light.  I can tolerate most macros, but this is kind of stomach turning actually.
I am an alcoholic and I swear I threw this beer away.  I was careful not to drop any on my grass though.

Thjs one, for a mass produced working mans beer is not that bad. I actually like the sweetness, for a change, sometimes. Not much of a head, but ice cold it has pretty good taste with no bitterness. Beats their ML or MGD to me...if I need to upgrade..will go to Mich or Mich Light.  When a stout isn’t around, like at the lake or hunting cabin it will do. Better than Bud...which is suprizing with all the hype Bud has.

Ok, here goes. This is an awesome mass-produced cheap beer. Seems like saying it is the best ’Yugo’ around, which is pretty true. However, you could dupe quite a few hipsters by exchanging a pint of High Life with their ’$5 Stellas’. Sometimes has an odd mustiness. Try the ’Stella Exchange/Swap’  it’ll work, I swear. If there isn’t enough head, add some merrange or foam, I guess. Follow the comments below it is indeed sweet, tastes a bit like creamed corn, and better in bottles.

Not as bad as everybody thinks.  Light yellow color with a thin head. Taste is sweet malt with a hoppy bitter finish.  Though I only drink this beer in the bottle, its taste a little differant in the can.

Bottle.  OK, we know what we’re expecting folks.  Let’s not get carried away thinking we’re the first to have the amazing insight that miller does not rank with the greatest beers of all time.  It’s got a sweet lagery corn aroma, which actually isn’t as bad as other aromas in its class which are usually staler corn.  As others, little to no flavor, less corn/metal than I was expecting.  also gotta give it to this hardy little sonof a gun for not being skunky at all even though it’s ina clear bottle.  How they pull that off?  2nd bottle of this was less "good," more corny.  Why would I be drinking 2, you ask?  Well, that’s all dad had in the house.  He was generous enough to share the last 2 with me and of course like an obsessed nut I take out my pen and rate the stuff.  I finished it though, which is more than I can say for a number of beers that have higher average ratings.

Aroma is stale grain.  Is it corn, rice, is there any barley in there?  I don’t know and I don’t care, it smells bad.  Doesn’t look particularly awful.  Flavor is pretty corny and sweet, finishes sour.  Carbonation intense, helps it go down.  Not the worst of the lower-end beers and IMO better than Bud.  Serve ice cold.
Not the worst beer ever, in retrospect. Sweet, corny, alright alright alright.

Pinched this off my roommate for the sheer amusement of rating it.  (Thanks Matt!)  I’m kinda regretting that decision.  Smells awful;  like rotting corn.  Taste is pretty much the same.  Actually comes off crisp and light at first, then the crap comes out.  Literally tastes like I assume garbage would.  I find that other BMC stuff just doesn’t taste like anything.  This is actually full flavored, which makes it so much worse.  I do not, by any means, plan on finishing this one.  It does get one point, however, because I think it could actually be worse, but not much.

Alright, if I was stranded on a deserted island, with no Blatz anwhere to be found, I could deal with this shit.

Not great, by any yardstick.  Yet, much better than Miller Lite And MGD.

If you are gonna drink this stuff, pour it out of it container into a mug or what have you.  That way you can avoid the embarrasment of having friends seeing you drink this unsophisticated grog.

When you head to the store, bypass this stuff, and get some 40 ouncers of Blatz.  Your liver will thank youin the morning.
This is the best of the chep beers! If money is an issue then living the high life is right for you.
My wife uses this swill to make beer bread.  As sometimes I’m too lazy to go buy beer, I grabbed one of these.  I no longer have any excuse to NOT go out to buy beer.
Clear yellow color stands out.  Very smooth.  The ideal working class man’s beer.

occationally on a hot night after work............this is as good as anything....i sit backin my chair in my trailor park...smoke my winston and think about how much of a wastel i am......because that my friend is the high life. For all intensive purposes is champagne for poor people.

i really enjoy this beer. while it may not have the flavor of some other beers, it is quite refreshing. it is the only beer that i would be willing to drink after a hot day. it truly is "the High Life."
Golden, crisp and very carbonated.  Lacks the aftertaste of most macros and usually sits pretty well.  Definitely a cheap beer, but one of the better cheap beers.

Salty-tasting as hell.  It’s strange...everything about this beer is sub-par, but something about it makes it great beer for bowling.  I keep coming back to it now and again.  After all, it is the official beer of the Professional Bowling Association.  No, I am not a paid spokesman for the PBA.
I just love this stuff.  Been drinking it for years. Great ice cold in the bottle on a hot summer day.

While I rarely imbibe with this any more, I will have to say it is a guilty pleasure when it comes to beers. This beer started it all for me and will always have a corner spot reserved in my brain. If I ever have to go the route of macro beer, this is it. High quality macro swill that won’t make you feel like you just drank a quart of toxic waste.

Ah yes, it’s another pale lager that bills itself as smooth, never bitter.  What they mean to say is that it’s water.  Granted I’ve had worse (MGD).  But calling it the champagne of beers like it’s something classy is laughable.  If this is the high life, I’ll stay in the gutter.

Clear, pale straw color with a clean, sweet corn aroma. Compared to other macros, this at least has the beginnings of complexity. Inoffensive, refreshing and mildy interesting. Faint, grainy odor at end.
Ah yes!  The Champegne of beers!  It really looks like champegne!  Pours golden yellow from a 40 oz. and tastes like metallic water and corn juice!  Smells like a homeless person’s aftershave.
My dad drank this stuff, and I used to think it was good.  Well, it’s good for tailgates or for that engine overall you are working on in the garage, but that is it.

Light yellowish amber. Initial creamy white head that quickly diminishes. Light crisp sweet taste, a bit of corn and light hopping. Overall, not completely horrible. One thing worth noting is that it takes on a new life in the Miller tasting room. Crappy corporate macrobrew, yes. But there is also a long history.
The best of the regular miller beers, still not very good, but I can eat it with a burger

This is a refreshing beer, just be sure to buy the longnecks and bury them in shaved ice up until the moment you drink it. It definitely tastes much worse when even the slightest bit warm. Refreshingly carbonated without off tastes (aside from a bit of corn)... as someone else said, one of the very best of the cheap beers!

On draught in a pub in Boston: Only had two of these and they actually went down reasonably well. Don’t know whether it’s coz the red Sox were winning on the TV screen in the corner of the bar. Tasted like most of the mass produced stuff at home in Australia although this strangely tickled my fancy in some kind of absurd way. I can’t describe it. Wasn’t the worst beer I’ve ever had, but I reckon if I had it again, it wouldn’t be as good. Maybe my good mood at the time had a lot to do with it?

Reminiscent of an Oly. Very faintly reminiscent. It’s better than water and any of the light so-called beers. Although in a food situation, I just might choose water. Might go well with chili, though. The Lady in the Moon is still on the cans. Trip down memory lane for those who can recall seeing the lady on the metal roadside signs. Damned if I don’t think I can detect hops! Could be wrong.

This is the final bottle from my Miller test.  No better than MGD.  Yellow with too much carbonation.  No flavor.  Some places in this town serve this on draft, which shows there is no accounting for bad taste.
This is an ok beer.  Another beer to buy if it’s on sale for really cheap.  Champages of Beer is a little crazy yeah...

Champagne of beers?.... only by carbonation and not taste.  Pours a bright yellow color with aromas of corn and minor hoppiness.  Not much to flavor - mostly water with a hint of hops and bit of a greasy mouthfeel.
Pours a fizzy crisp golden yellow. Aromas of corn, minor hopping, and not much else. Flavor is bland american lager with almost no hops.
This beer used to be my beer of choice, until I threw it up one night. Ever since then it’s never been the same
Can.  My father-in-law’s beer of choice.  So it will do in a pinch, but not if you’re drinking for the flavor, enjoyment, or character.
we used to drink this stuff in my friends basement. It gets the job done and its cheap.
pours clear and golden, faint aroma of malt.  taste is watery, soapy as with most macro brews.  better than the lights out there but still nothing to it.
This beer is my favorite of the poor beers. You know who they are, we have all drank them before! It treats you well until the next morning, and doesn’t taste too bad. Still not a good beer...

Ok, drink this beer only if you meet the following three requirements:

1.  Your almost broke
2.  You just need to get drunk
3.  You don’t mind a horrible hangover.

If you meet these three, cheers, go get a case for like a $1.50 and drink up.  Don’t expect much.  I will say that it did do the trick though when I was broke!

Crap crap crap, this stuff sucks. It pours a piss pale yellow, aroma smells bad, and the flavor is just bleh. And by the time your done with two 12 ouncers you’re piss will be transparent. The price is right though, but spend the extra two bucks and get something half way decent.
really all not that bad, certainly drinkable.  does leave a bad aftertaste.  Has a bit of a malt tasty, and isn’t really skunky like most macro crap.
I have had worse but not by much.  If it’s the champagne of beers, then why is it so cheep at the gas station?

UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCE DO YOU DRINK THIS BEER.The only good sole purpose this beer has is when you’re warming up for a night of vodka. I usually down one of these before the first shot so I can have an empty bottle to throw up in. I could probably carbonate my piss and pass it as some of this shit.

Not even worth reviewing, this beer is junk. No taste, no smell, no enjoyment, Champagne of beers my butt! If you just drink beer to get drunk, 3 things: 1. This is for you. 2. Why are you on a site like this that appreciates beer? 3. I feel very sorry for you.

Not a bad beer for the buck.  Considered the "champagne of beers," don’t know if I’d go that far.  It is smooth, crisp, not bitter or skunky.  Below (well below) average as a beer, decent for american brew.
Lack of taste and poor aroma equate to a beer that one should avoid at all possible times unless the only goal is to get drunk, or to play catch-up with those already drunk.

Very little taste, watery, almost no hops or malt flavor, heavy carbonation.
American standard. Rated for availability and price.
For a feller with not a lot of cash, high life is best beer you can buy. It get’s the job done with a refreshing, cool, crisp finish.
Bottle. My father’s beer. The name has lasted longer then the quality. Little aroma, flavor and finish. Again, cold wet with alcohol.Surprised this isn’t a 0 percentile overall.

Ahhhh the high life.  I like the radio commercials, and even the TV ones sometimes.  But this is a lackluster lager.  What more would you come to expect from the wonderful world of Miller Brewing Co.?  Not much thats for sure, good commercials and shitty water substitute beer.
Pretty bad cheap beer, but still better than most.  At least it doesn’t have an overly terrible aftertaste like most cheap beers have.
I used to drink this all the time before I learned what good beer was. For a cheap beer it’s not THAT bad. Besides you can get 32oz cans for $1.50 here.
The greatest of all cheap beers!  Nothing else is worth drinking at this price.
What can I say.  High life is the cheapest keg you can get in most places.  However, why not just drink water.  I drank off a keg of this stuff all day and it wouldnt even put me to sleep, WEAK!
don’t understand why they call it the high life it didn’t improve my life any infact it was and will always be a bad beer

12oz Bottle: A middle of the road beer for me. Kind of a regular brew for me do to affordability and taste. Nothing overly exciting, but it at least has a complexity that other American brews lack. Has sort of a stale smell to it, kind of like if a glass of beer has sat out all night after a party. Pours a nice clear golden, with a rather large head. Head stays for the remainder of the glass, and leave lacing. Feels a little thin, but still has a semi-robust flavor as far as American brews go. Kind of quasi-alcoholic. Goes down smooth and leaves no horrible or great aftertaste. Average, but better than most macros.
Not much too it. It’s relaxing to have like any other beer. Better than most cheap beers i’d say
I’d say you have to be high to live this life. Drink this piss ice cold. At least it’s cheap. Beer Bong anyone?

Straw colored with a thick white head that quickly deminishes into a very thin layer that actually causes some lacing.  Smells like cold boiled sweet corn.  Lots of corn in the taste with a hint of sweet malt and hops.  Another unremarkable macro beer, but with more flavor than Coors or Bud at a lower price.
Bottle poured a clear pale yellow with a short lived white head. Aroma is sweet malt and corn. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavor was light malt and a bit of corn.

Another macro in my runs.....end of the season pig roast and it was this or Bud....Terrible malt aroma and the taste is all malt. Goes down very easily, almost like water and makes you piss like you were drinking water. Wet malts with really no depth
It’s not a bad beer I liked the gold color to it. It was a smooth beer that does go down real easy.
12 oz. bottle. Pours yellow / gold with a thin white head that disappears quickly. Virtually no aroma or flavor. I will say that it is smooth and goes down easily. Easier to drink than Bud.
Pours light yellow with a wispy white head.  Aroma of cooked veggies and corn. Taste is bland, and full of nothingness. Light and fizzy.  Often cheaper than water, it’s a fairly suitable replacement.

I’m probablly one of very few people on Earth that loves this beer. Lives up to the name Champagne of Beers. It has such a unique taste for a Lager I’ve never tasted in another. Great with a burger. Oh, and is there a better beer commercial then the High Life ones? I think not.  Cheers
This could be the worst beer I’ve ever had.  Champagne of Beers nothing.  If I could give this one a negative flavor or aroma, I would.  Awful.  And for the record, I don’t mind Bud or other macros.
Taste is kinda fruity, mostly corn, nice... the fruit isn’t like a good kinda fruit, more like nasty, rotten fruit. And okra. Okra is never good. Never.

It has little aroma, tastes heavily of stale corn and ethanol (I remember this taste because it’s how the air tasted in South Bend, IN when you were around the ethanol plant), but when you are out tailgating for the big game and are looking to have more than one or two, it does the job.  It has a cool bottle too.

When the drinks are free on the south side of the lake for you best friends bachorlette party, who is going to turn down a vial tasting beverage in a can that has some, but very little alcohol content??

Out of a bottle on vacation.  A cheap pale lager, not much more to say.  Aroma not much, poured bright yellow foamy head.  Flavor,  bread, malt and cheap adjuncts.  That’s bout it, but I’ll still drink it when I can’t get good beer.

341ml brown bottle, brewed under license at Molson. Poured very pale straw colour, held a small creamy head of tight beaded bubbles. Rather weak aroma, corny, light grain. Flavour is predictably sweet and corn tinged with some husky grains. Body was rather limpid. No dicernable aftertaste.

"The Champagne of Beers" This one literally looks like champagne with its light yellow pour and slight carbonation. Has a nice malty finish but is thin in palate overall not to mention alcohol content. I love it and drink a ton of these when fishing in Montana! Thats what I call living the HIGH LIFE!
Yellow body.  Aroma is adjunct and mild malt.  Taste is rather bitter and flat.  Only good thing about it is the bottle is cool looking and it’s cheap.
nice classic bottle. Champagny yellow body (as described). decent bready/corn/malted base. not much else flavor wise. Why do Americans put up with this crap?

12 oz bottle pours pale golden with a white head.  Aroma is corn and grain.  Flavor is much the same.  No hops to be found.  This is corn flavored water.  Not very good at all.  Ran out of good beer and needed something so I drank one of these.

Although this beer holds a special place as it was the first beer I remember tasting because my father used to drink it, it is not very good in the beer world. Light, thin grainy, malty taste. Better than Bud.
um what can i say about another easy to make shitty beer by MILLER. it isnt good but it gets the job done if all you need is to get drunk for cheap, but it is quite refreshing on a hot day
refreshing (like water) with a pleasant cream corn aftertaste......there are many worse beers out there, this still tasted fresh despite the clear bottle(see corona light)

Please people, what do you want from this brew? You get what you pay for, and I say its a deal! High life is a great brew on a budget, and the fact that it is considered the "champagne" of brews makes this guy feel quite high brow. Still doesnt beat old style though.

It is the basic American pale lager.  It has no head, because people looking to get drunk don’t care for the head getting in their way.  And it is very cheap.  No smell, not much taste except for alcohol, and the usual beer taste.
Pours a urine color with fast dissipating white head.  Corn preeminent.  Very light and tasteless
So awful there really arent any words to describe. watery,  hints of piss.  not even worth it being cheap beer. go for the bud or the busch or the coors.
Hey... I have an idea... don’t waste your money or palate on this, rather, go for the cheapest brand and get about the same thing for less money.
had it once.. never again, ok taste, not my pick, how a company can make any moner buy producing such product?

This beer isn’t so Bad.  It suffers from 2 major flaws.  The aroma of this beer isn’t at all attractive, and beers little distinction from similar beers of the line.  The 2nd biggest problem is of course the VERY watery aftertaste.  I’ve had bolder LIGHT beers.  The excellent color and easy pouring are a + though.  Overall not as bad as most rate it.  Drinkable

On tap. Clear golden with a fluffy white head. Corny grainy aroma. Taste is more of the same along with the slightest touch of caramel and hop bitterness coming in at the end. Thin, watery mouthfeel. Interestingly, nice lacing and head retention. Not good at all but there is definitely worse out there.

The champagne of beers is it?  Well, perhaps if you enjoy piss cheap champagne.  No aroma, little flavor, very watery, but hey its Miller.  Drinking it from a keg probably didn’t help these matters but i doubt i missed out on much anyway.

gosh dang it, anyway, i’m still drinking this miller brew and from a 32 ounce tin @ that!!!!!  chilled close to icy-ness and poured into 1 of those huge beeer mugs and when the $’s sparse, it’s what i get’cause my wife’ll even drink it, too, still. it used to give me hiccups real regularly, but not lately.  sometimes, i use a fluted pilsner glass, 12 oz., preferably clean, slowly slide it @ a heavy tilt and add a unground shake from a sea salt grinder and watch the salt crumbs dissapate if the top crust lets the granules pass.  that’s actually the best part.  then it gets drank. it used to swell up my fingers, too, still, not lately.  and it’s still neat to tip a chunk or 8 of sea salt into the foam and see it burn thru the white clouds; historic, too.
Keg. Ugh...tastes of cardboard, piss, vomit...and corn. This stuff is horrible. Definately is the champagne of hobos...
How on earth can this be called "the champagne of beers". It’s the champagne of urine, as far as I’m concerned. Aroma is of corn and... welll... nothing. Taste is just a hint of hops and more corn.

This was just a bad beer.  And in a clear bottle do you think the light could hurt this beer?  You need to give the beer a chance cover it up.  The poor beer is in need ot more flavor hops, barley and even some malt.  Next time I am drinking water.
Oh my god!  Miller is truly amazing.  It is as if they found a method for removing all of the good taste and flavor leaving yellow colored seltzer water with a tinge of formaldehyde.  Great stuff...
this beer is ok ONLY its cheap and if your looking to get a little woozy then ok, but you really get what you pay for id say spend the coupke $ extra and get the 6 pack of yuengling.
One of my least favorites.  Only might be good around the campfire, but only after 3-4 glasses of Knob Creek.  Avoid the high life.

12 oz bottle. Quality varies – can be rancid. Cans usually taste fresher. Rancid corn nose with hints of phenol. Light translucent yellowish pour with non-lasting foamy head. Highly carbonated. Malted corn topnote with phenol and slight vanilla gracenotes. Quick finish with no lingering aftertaste. Average, inexpensive macro that is worthy of a few on a hot Arizona day.

Miller High Life is my cheap beer of choice....which, opinion, does not a good beer make.  I  can see the flaws like the minihead that dissappears after like 30 seconds and the metallic taste on the palate.  I don’t really think this beer is much more skunky than some of the more expensive imports that I’ve tried, but this is no boquet of roses either.  It does, however, get the job done and after about 3 or 4, regardless of your weight, you probably won’t care about the quality of this beer either.  (takes a drink) this stuff does kinda have the aftertaste of a brick, so I guess that counts against it.  Just remember, you get what you pay for.  Still, a step up from PBR which used to be my cheap beer of choice.
I have been drinking MHL for over 25 years. I have travelled the world and drank beers in many, many places. I can afford to drink whatever I choose and I keep coming back to MHL regardless.

A step down from Miller Genuine Draft.  Most noticeable features are that it’s rather yeasty and a little skunky.  Refreshing when ice-cold on a hot day, but if you can part ways with a little extra change, go with something a little costlier.

Piss Gold completely clear color. There’s some strong skunky aroma with this, "The Champagne of Beers", it’s Florida and hot as hell out so it’s refreshing my thirst but if it were cold out no way.
