Plus the only reason I’m drinking this is because my future mother-in-law bought it and it’s free. Could be worse and has been.
Not terrible on a hot summer day. Basically a slightly above average BMC, with a bit of grain and corn in the flavor.
Can.  the Champagne of beers.  Okay I don’t like champagne much but I know champagne is better than this.  Very pale and watery.   Not much flavor.  Hopefully I don’t have to have this again.
Better than PBR and Bud, but only as good as miller light and Coors light. Prob cuz the lights have less bad flavor.

Aroma is a bit stale, and it ain’t anything to look at, but for a crowd-pleasing beer that’s got some taste it’s great.  Taste is sweet, a bit like meat.  Has a good carbonation level for the taste, many macros use too much.  Taste is clean and smooth as they claim, and the sweetness adds something to the beer.  Though macros are not great when it comes to their individual components, this one is put together well.
Very little aroma and strawlike color.  Thick white head forms on initial pour but quickly fades.  Not much flavor and no aftertaste.

Light yellow, translucent color.  Thin, fizzy  head.  Smells like bubble gum and corn sugar.  Tastes buttery.  I suspect High Life and MGD are the same beer.  Really, what’s the difference between this and Budweizer or Harp’s, other than half the price?  A fine bear at a fair price.  Second only to PBR in its price range.

I personally love this beer. It’s my choice tier-2 macro brew. It’s as cheap as the horrid swill (most of which is also a MIller production), especially if you buy bulk at a highway liquor store. Better than all the Coors beers and I can take it in place of Bud or MGD. Thank God for this one.

Another clear bottle skunk.  Corn, dried tomatoes, wet grasses and molasses nose.  The taste is about the same.  I wish beer makers would stop bottling in clear bottles.  This makes people not so crazy about trying it on tap.  I pass it up every chance I get.
Very pale amber, white foamy head that fades fast.  Aroma faintly reminds me of hay.  Not much taste except for a bit of malt and cereal.  Gave me a headache too.
very smooth, alomost too smooth. No Head.pale yellow almost like water. If i have to drink it i pefer it out of a can(that way I can drink it quick and get it over with).
Worthless. A typical American mass produced beer that is what  I call a "canoe beer", which means close to f’ing water.
drinkable, not worth buying to me, its named should be changed to miller low life.

My ultimate cheap-ass beer. Noticeable yeast flavor and a bit of hops, making for a very distinct taste, for a mega-macro, anyway. Yellow and carbonated, but much easier for me to tolerate than Budweiser. I may be the only person I know who likes it, but I stand by it. Not what I drink in celebration or when I really want something good, but you something you can often find in my fridge. Your basic meat and potatoes, Joe Bagofdonuts beer -- nothing wrong with that.

12 oz. can into pilsner glass.  This one is for my moms.  I promised myself long ago that I wouldn’t be a ratings whore and load up on all the macros, but I found myself sitting with my mom on Mom’s Day, drinking a High Life (her favorite beer; trust me, guys, I’ve tried, but she’s an old dog and good beer is a new trick) and talking to her about how to rate a beer.  Since I’d done all the work (I was actually taking notes), I decided to enter it in her honor.  Skunky, citrusy and somewhat bready (!) aroma is not bad, with a vague impression of European hops (and I mean vague like Bill Clinton in a courtroom vague).  Pale as all hell in the glass, this has a largish fizzy head and quite a bit of visible carbonation bubbling up through it’s clear yellow body. Head  leaves some impressive large-bubble lacing on the glass.  Barely any flavor, this tastes mealy and oily at the same time, but doesn’t have enough body to be oily.  Tough to describe.  For a beer with this much cabonation, there’s no bite (since there’s no hops).  Somewhat sweet and tasting of rice.  I’ve got to redouble my efforts with mom; it is perhaps one of my most important beer geek goals to find a beer that both my mom and I can enjoy.
love it, no one else does, guess that is why it is cheap, love cans or bottles, ice cold by the case!
Its high life, what else can I say.  I only had this becuase I was at a party where we bought the classics; high life, budweiser, and PBR.
This has to be the worst of the macros for me.  Give me anything other than this.  Can’t drink even if I’m broke.  Can’t describe other than nasty.
Pale clear when poured although I think it taste better out of the can.  Cheap Amer Macro beer as good as any other and just as bad.

Hmm...The Champagne of beers interesting..I drank this one straight out of the bottle, because basically,  "what the hell is the point pouring this into a glass when you can see the appearence throught the bottle."  I wouldn’t want to drink more than 1 or two of these the aftertaste is strange.  And The Champagne’s hangovers are horrible, also gives you the beer shiznits  I’d have to say that this is a bellow average beer.

I don’t care what anybody says about this being an off brand or cheap beer its a great tasting beer that in my opinion is the best beer that Miller makes. It has a very yeasty taste, but very smoothe, good till the last drop, and best of all it won’t get you bloated but it will get you shit faced!
This one’s nothing special at all, except you can drink twenty of them without gagging, and you can get thirty for fifteen bucks.  It’s the best cheap beer; perfect for parties and empty pockets.
blah.  water anyone.  this is no beer for me.  i think id rather take water instead.  little flavor and no beer character.

Bottle.  There really is nothing special about this beer.  Looks like urine.  Very malty aftertaste that lingers around for a while.  Hardly the champagne of beers as it likes to say it is.  I’d take Coors Original over this any day if I needed an American Pale Lager.
It should be noted this is Oklahoma’s 3.2 beer, so therefore, the quality may be compromised somewhat.
living the low life.  Flavorless, light  color.  better than bud.  always the last to go in my fridge, only the brother-in-law brings it over.... frigin’ in-laws!!
This is something that they try to advertise as beer.  The only reason to buy this stuff is if they are out of Natural Ice and you are near broke and desperate.
Really out of all the national brands this is the one I can tolerate the most. It has a pale appearance which offers no aroma no descernable taste and looks pretty much like apple juice.
another bargin beer thats not good but it aint bad....stuck in beer limbo.  pours a light fizzy yellow. very watery going down with typical cheap brew taste...
Nice color small, small head crisp taste, weak palate good beer to drink in excess. A little pricy for the taste but  im cheap i guess.
About as average as it gets.  Non-offensive, cheap and drinkable.  Nice color , slight nutty taste.
Yes i know this is high but the other night at college i wentto go to a old guys bowling alley and they had .75 bottles of this and i never thougth i oculd have so much fun with old white trash
Common swill. Pours a yellow color with a small head that disappears. Some lacing on glass. Available for party use at at reasonable price compared to other swills.

Had it on tap@ChuckE cheese’s (grand daughters birthday):  Pale golden color. Small bright white head. Aroma...a hint of something (grain?). Flavor is light a and crisp with a lightly acidic dry finish. Palate is weak and watery.
yellow color, watery, plenty of white head. Hey it is cheap though. When your on a shoestring budget.
The champane of beers marketed to women and then to men.  Very dry beer, combined with a weak bodied water taste makes this beer a champ.

My mom insists on keeping this in her fridge, so I have one whenever I visit. Apple Juice color with a scummy white head. Smells of grass, corn and cardboard. Light bitterness in the flavor, but not in a good way. Blech.
This is the worst of the top 3 American Beers.  The appearance is aweful and this is not a beer for the beer drinker.
you might get confused and think you’ve already thrown-up after drinking this beer.
Cheap bad beer. Tastes like any other American macro. ......................
Not as smooth as MGD.  Has a surprising sweet flavour with loads of carbination.  Not horrible, but doesn’t make me feel like I’m living the high life.
worst beer i have ever had doesn’t even taste like a beer. almost undrinkable i would never buy or have this beer again.

Canned 750 ml-Sparkling body, gold, nice frothy white head. Reminds me of a tripel. Aromas are corny, sugar, can, minerals?? Taste is sweet corn, mild hops, can, minerals, bland. Ok, not offensive, just not much here.
well...there isnt much to say about high life. Drank it alot in high school and didnt even like it then.

Ok. Here we go. I haven’t had the high life since I was 15. And back then it truly
was touted as the "Champagne of Beers". Mostly bottled it held an upper middle class clientel. Back then the three
kings were  Bud, High Life and Michelob.
Some of you can relate. Well lets get back to the rating. Pours a deep yellow classic pilsner color with a very white
head. Nose is nasty. Corn galore. Then
all of a sudden you take a sip and lo and
behold a contrast is at large. Light with
a bisquit malt running through. I’m not kidding. Who would have thought. Sure there’s a bit of corn in there. But by golly
this is not a bad brew.
I open the bottle and this beer makes me just want to vomit because thats how it smells.  Avoid the high life and go Lite anyday.

I hate to describe initial aroma of this beer as of an aroma of sweated shirt, wet blanket but id does smell like it so here we go. With time the foul smell goes away leaving us with crude sweet canned corn. Pale gold, small white head. Medium bodied for pale lager, not as harsh as some. Light bitter character with sweet malts. Short finish with alcohol on end. Average for mass produced American Lager.
just ok.   i like it better than most of the other macro crap.  speaking of crap this makes me meet the porciline gods the next morning so thats not a plus
A good bang for your buck.  Put on your best flannel shirt when you take a 40oz to the dome, this is the champagne of beers.
I Like the foam but flavor does not follow.  A littlr bitter.  Not good warm however.

Poured yellow with a small head.
Aroma and flavor of corn.
Watery body
Not badfor a swill.

bottle.  This beer may not deserve a high rating by this is my favorite mass produced crap beer out their. The "Champagne of Beers" is by far the most tasteful and good tasting beer in the American Macro brew market. Piss yellow in color with some what of a head. Savor the high life and enjoy.
From A Bottle.Yellow in colour,no head,chemical aroma,sharp,fizzy,usual story.

I rated this for what it is....a Mass produced extremely cheap beer and for that it is AWESOME.  Compared to some of the other "crappy" beers this is as good as any of them.  Perfect when you drink 2 times as much as the girly dude drinking the carona next to you.  You cant rate this against high dollar stuff but it is excellent for what it is.
I love this stuff....especially on a hot day.....this beer gets no compliants from me....
cheap. cool bottles. good ice ice cold when you are really thirsty. hot summer day with no money type good. not for uppity beer snobs. punk rock beer. hipster beer. not bad. it’s cheap too
Cheap, you get what you pay for.  Although it is better in the can. That is probably where it belongs. It tasted aweful. Can’t describe it more than that. They should call it Miller low life.

What can I say?
I sort of like this cheap stuff.
Granted, it’s not Heineken, but if you hold your nose with the back of your tounge and chase  it with a sip of soda, it’s not so bad.
......Errr........I like the can.....
The commercials are good as well (except the ludicrous one which featured a bunch of drunk co-eds breathing "Beer Breath" into the camera as some sort of sacrifice to the "Beer gods".
The old magazine ads from the ’50’s are pretty amusing as well.
Overall, cheap stuff, but not really awful and certainly tolerable.
The can and slogan "champagne of beers" make it looks sort of "classy" in a faux way, even though it’s not.
Cheap, has some funny comercials, better than miller lite in my opinion, definely worth the $7 for 12 pack

Better than Bud, Coors and pretty much all of the offerings from the mass produced big three.  But...still not that good in the grand scheme of things.  For the 6.99 12 pk bottles here in Ohio I will give it the credit it deserves.
i think this is one of the best mass produced commerical beer, but that’s not saying too much.  also it’s cheap.

Ok, i rated this with out tasting directly. Well the characteristics of Miller high life are pretty etched in my mind.  Lets see: Pours clear. Head diminishes quickly. The aroma is of like that of some sort of sand from Mars. And the thing about high life is that it is a one note beer. There is just that one crazy green tone from first sip to last. Aftertaste is pure regret.
Cheap, drinkable in mass quantities, cheap.  A bit of a bready taste in this one.  Keep it around for those mowing the lawn/ washing the car days.
Champagne of beers. What more can be said? Cringe with each sip. Yuck. I must exceed 75 characters and I’m not going to waste any more on this brew.
Horrible, horrible, horrible.  May the beer gods strike Miller Brewing down for this trash.
Check for signs of life.... This is the most lifeless, dead beer I have ever tasted. Flat, boring and repulsive. This beer makes Old Mill look like the life of the party! Hurl..........flatline...

Yeah i know im a alcoholic if i bought a 32 of this stuff.   Even if it was 99 cent.  Regular pale lager aroma thats gross and im beginning to hate even more. Alcohol flavored, and not good.  I will never buy this ever again.
Watery and heavily carbonated. I’d take over Miller Lite (especially with the price) but that’s not saying much. Still, it’s very drinkable cold and is a cheap bbq beer.

Love the ads, love the beer.  I do not rate it the same as others.  More of a cook out beer.  A bit watery, not sure if bold is the right term for the taste, bitter perhaps.  Would drink this over Bud any day.
this is a damn bad brew!!  the chamagne of swill!  the miller low-life!  I’d rather drink cough-syrup!!
Cheap beer.  Somewhat metallic.  Respectable for the price, though -- good and crisp for sitting on the porch in the summer.

I have pissed higher alcohol content than this.  If you mix water and budweiser you get the same taste.  There is an obvious reason that a 12 pack of bottles sells for $7.83 tax included, and that is to cover the cost of the bottles.  In closing I would love to know where miller gets off calling this skunk piss the champagne of beers!!!  It’s not even the ghetto sparkling wine of beers.
Free bottle. Pale golden with a nice head.  Neutral aroma. Light pale flavor.  Dry aftertaste.

Free bottle, and I want to make that clear. Looks like a beer, pale golden with a NICE white head, and the head was the best part, I may add. Neutral aroma. This is why my homebrew-club used this beer for the tasting kit. Flavor of light pale malts and rather neutral. Dry aftertaste and nothing to it.Blah blah blah. Not a good follow up to FFF Alpha Klaus.

Poured light yellow with a billowing off white head...that took about five minutes to fade, but when it did there was no sign that it ever existed...smell was sweet with corn...taste is corn, sweetly soured malts, and general garbage water...how this is rated higher than Miller Lite I have no clue...

I heard someone once eloquently describe the High Life drinking experience as such...
-We’ll be back in the high life again
-All the doors I closed one time will open up again
-We’ll be back in the high life again
-All the eyes that watched us once will smile and take us in
-And we’ll drink and dance with one hand free
-And have the world so easily and oh we’ll be a sight to see
-Back in the high life again.
I believe it was the artist "Winwood" who utttered those defining words. I concur. I really concur. Really. 
Drink it up

If you’re hot and sweaty, the bank account is low, and you just want to guzzle something to quench your thirst, this is it.  No need to swirl, sniff, examine, or even really taste it, but it goes down smooth and sweet for an American macro.  If I have to choose one beer produced by those yankee behemouths (and nobody says I do), this is one of only a handful that I can actually stand enough to finish the whole bottle.  Also an aesthetically pleasing color on a hot summer day, and the fizz feels good on the tongue.
There is only one beer that a man can wear while mowing a lawn in dress socks and loafers, and this is it.
ugh.  first experience with this beer, i had to chase it with straight rum.  This is not my swill of choice.  I can’t think of anything I enjoyed about this really other than the alcohol.
On the plus side  - it does have alcohol in it.  On the plus side - err, that’s it.

Lets look at this for what it is.  This is a cheap american macro.  Compared to its compition in that catagory its not bad.  No hop flavor not bitter just slighty sweet.  If I’m  short on coins this will work.
Not my favorite beer But whem your hanging drywall and its cold you will try it.  No malt flavor more like corn.  I don’t know if the use finishing hops.  Its like drinking colored water.

Lets get this straight. I’m only giving this beer a high rating because for it’s category (cheap college beer) it’s much better than bud or coors light. This beer has so little taste they should be able to sell it in coke machines at elementary schools.

Certainly not my favorite beer but I have tasted worse. As long as you expect a macro lager and not a Champagne beer you won?t be let down. I like to cook with this beer. It makes a wonderful beer bread and tasty boiled shrimp. Largely due to its strong malt presence and mild hop aroma. Miller I would love an actual Champagne beer. Maybe a Christmas special?

Being from Milwaukee I must drink Miller products...as it turns out this is my swill of choice.  Taking a trip up North rafting with friends or even a freezing cold December evening at the bar, this is the beer that makes all happy...it is also excellent for quarters playing, presidents, caps, tippy cup, drinking jenga, and many more wonderful drinking games.  As it turns out this beer isn’t half that bad...but again I point to my Milwaukee bias.
The high life...  I think the shape of the bottles are cool, and there is some picture of a chick sitting on a cresent moon.  Otherwise just another mass produced American brew, nothing special.

I’m comparing this to other beers of the caliber... Actually, this is drinkable crap.  A slight sweetness gives it a tang that lets the drinker know the brewer really cares.  I used to buy this in quarts on Friday afternoons after work- but that changed when I got a life.  A High Life.
Piss color, no head, and a sulfuric taste. Dreadful stuff. Definitley not the Champagne of Beers!
I have nothing to say about this beer.......................................

Not exactly the "champagne of beers" as Miller would have you believe, High Life is nonetheless reasonably solid for the ultra-budget group of American macros.  One of the few six packs that can be acquired for less than a fiver that actually has a discernable malt taste.  Like all low quality macros, taste buildup eventually sours on the tongue over the course of a sixer or two, but High Life is at least slightly gentler on the hangover quotient than many of it’s direct competitors.
Yes, same x-mas party here. This was not as bad,  tasted ok, while it was cold, but got worse as it warmed.
Bottle.  This actually has some barley present in the taste and a bit of a raw grain finish.  Champagne could never be this bad.

light color slight yellow hugh soapy white head.. very light scent of nothingness... other than maybe barely like driving by the miller plant... thin nearly non existant palate and the flavor is just not good.  

The champagne of beers my a**!

light gold with a volcanic white head. sweet malt alcohol aroma that is acrid. smells of nasty corn someone has half digested. taste is sweet and bland. finish is a mild bitter that does little. if you can get past the aroma of this stinker this is a drinkable "get drunk" beer. Screw you Lumpy for making me drink this.

Can. Thin yellow body with a head that looks like fluffy clouds. There is a hint if raw sewage in the nose-no joke. The taste is slightly better than the smell, but that a’int saying much. Tastes like every other macro swill I have ever drank.
What can I say, I grew up on this stuff.  Even though I can think of plenty of beers I would rather drink, if I have a choice from the mega-brewerirs, I’ll choose the high life.
I drank when young, poor and lacking wisdom.  Good riddance. "Never bitter"? Maybe they should try HOPS instead of corn in their product.
A beer you can never go wrong with.  Nothing exceptional, just a decent swill beer at a decent price.  It’s a college favorite cause you can drink alot of it pretty easily and its cheap.

Post-party ’fridge find. Here’s whats bad about this beer: canned corn aroma. Nasty sour taste. Here’s whats good: The little seven ounce bottles are just so CUTE. Plus, 7 ounces of this crap is better than 12 ounces of it.
Nice golden hue with a surprisingly thick head that left really nice lacing.As for aroma and flavor...almost non existent.I haven’t had this in years ..and now I remember why.

The legend. It is the beer on which all domestics should be judged. Refreshing, flavorful, and (regardless of naysayer’s comments otherwise) full of body. Loses a few points with me due to the metallic taste from cans. Drink from bottles or tap.
I rate this as the champagne of beers.  It’s the best cheap beer out there.  Plus, who can beat to motif?
i used to drink this beer alot utill i went the german beer rout tried to drink it again but i must have been hooked on cheep beer then

Champagne of beers ... I used to like this because it was like drinking carbonated water almost.  In hindsight, I was not sure what I was thinking.  The only redeeming quality of this offering is that it is very affordable.
I really enjoy this beer. It’s inexpensive, so for poor college students it’s great. It’s by no means the best, but I think it deserves more respect than it gets.

a disgusting beer made for a disgusting person....must be near freezing in order to drink...a vile sweetness complements its urine-like flavor (my guess anyways)....a stenchy aroma....a skunky shitty excuse for calorie consumption....drink out of the toilet instead
This beer definately has the potential once you get use to it.  The first drink kicks you but it does the job.  Cheap Beer and Great for Beer Pong.

This is my uncle’s beer. As long as I can remember, the guy has always had a cooler or fridge full of Miller High Life. Oddly enough, It’s taken me years to actually get around and try it for myself. And really, it seems that if I weren’t a beer geek and didn’t mind the taste of beer, I probably would have been a Miller man myself. There’s an extremely boring, cereal-like flavor, no aroma and no bitterness. What makes this better than the much-hated-by-me Budweiser is that it lacks that nasty flavor in the back that Budweiser has. This just doesn’t have much of anything.

The first few times I tried beer, honestly, I didn’t like it at all.

I attribute this to being introduced to things like Miller and Miller Lite, and Budweiser and such. I’ve liked some brews I’ve had, but still don’t really care for Miller. And if it isn’t cold, it isn’t even touchable for me.

*ahem* *ahem*



[gravelly voice]



When a man’s got nothin’ to do, he goes to the store.  Because a man knows his limits.  Because he ain’t got the time to fool around.


[bacon sizzling on the grill, next to cheese and bread]


You’ve got better things to do than that.  So, you decide.  And, in deciding, you’ve done what you’ve gotta do.



That’s...



The High Life.



[bacon starts to smoke]

Had this from a can because it mysteriously found its way into my parents’ refridgerator, and they needed to get rid of it.  Giving it a full length rating seems like bestowing upon it a tad too much credit.  Thus, for a simple summary, we shall say simply that it is a pale lager from a macrobrewery.  There is little else more to be stated about this beer.  Apparently, like other pale lagers, it has its sect of semi-literate loyal followers who believe it to be "strong", "flavorful" and, worst of all, "American" (neglecting the fact that the top three breweries on this site are American).  I guess you really can fool some of the people all of the time.
Tall snow white head, pale yellow body. Corny and brewing mashy aroma. Thin malty and citrusy flavor. Bland as hell. The champagne of my arse!!!

Corn is the predominant attribute of this beer, from the yellow color, corn flavor, and boiled corn aroma. However, it did have a somewhat lasting white head. Still...this is vile terrible stuff. I didn’t like it. Bland and uninteresting, gave me a headache.

Bottle. Skunked? Gosh, it’s not supposed to be, with its isomerized hops and all. Tried it from the bottle, tried it in a glass, both gave me a big mouthfeel of some plastic dissolved in it. THIS IS NOT BEER! It’s the Champale of beers.

Like the previous rater said this MUST be drank out of a bottle. Pale yellow, little head, bland smell and taste with a pretty smooth finish. Refreshing on a very hot day ICE cold, but that’s about it.
The M in BMC.  It is consistent.  I love the new ads saying that this tastes better than Bud.  Whatever.  It is better in the bottle as the can gives it a metallic taste.
The champagne of  beers... so they say.  It smells faintly of champagne but it’s cheap and cheap almost always tastes like shit.

This stuff is some of the cheapest brew out there, so it gets props for that. It is good enough that you can actually just sip it instead of being forced to chug the can. Pours out yellow with a tiny head.
For the price, a damn good beer for bbq’s.  It seems to have a bit of a kick as well.  Pretty light and somewhat of a funky smell, but the taste works.

This is my favorite summer beer. Mild sweet taste which I like with no aftertaste. I ONLY buy this in cans. The clear bottle skunks this brew real bad. It’s cheap  ($2.25 a six). It quenches my thirst better than any other beer so far. It’s 5% alky is higher than many other cheap brews. It looks good in a glass, and has a nice foam to it.

Bottles are usually better with most beer, but not true with high life unless you like skunky beer.

A tasty beverage right out of the can.  Just kidding.  Typical pale yellow.  Head is only redeeming quality in this beer.  Perhaps a hint of rice or corn in the aroma which is very subtle.  Metallic taste.  This is the first canned beer that I have had in a long time and I can actually taste the difference.

the champagne of beers, yes, if we are talking a 3 dollar bottle of champagne.  anyway, not bad color.  lasting foamy head.  beautiful bottle.  you get what you expect and what you pay for with this beer.  a somewhat sweet tasting pale lager from miller.

Ok, I’m not a beer expert as of yet. I’ve sampled maybe 30+ beers, but I’m young, I’ve got time. I do know what I like however and this is not it. Tastes like it was cold filtered through someones "you know what". If this is the Chapagne of beers I’d hate to see what the Boone’s Farm of beers tastes like. Just keep it away from me.
This is what I would refer to as a typical southside (Chicago) sports bar beer.  There’s little of any real flavor, and it only tastes good if you’ve already had too much to drink.
Fine if it’s ice cold. Good "American Beer" taste. I like it on a sunny Saturday afternoon, but prefer something more substanitive. Go down lite & easy.
Weird head. Typical piss color. Doesn’t have too much flavor. The flavor it does have isn’t the worst I’ve had. I like the commercials though. That guy has a cool voice.
Better than Genuine Draft. but there are other good beers out there. As someone said below, As long as it is very cold its ok. so i recomend to get the little bottles, not the cans.
I find it similar to Corona, but not as horrid tasting, a bit watery, but alright as long as it is very cold.
THis beer is aight, its not the worst they make, cause believe me they make much worse, so based on the other miller beers i rate this good.
This beer isn’t worth the 75 characters necessary to rate it.  Having that said this is a pretty bad beer but miller makes some worse ones.
This beer isn’t half bad if you like a little cheap brew.  Definitely not the best beer, but it beats most other cheap beers.

I find it insulting they proclaim to be "finest in American beers." No beer, that uses Corn or Rice as a main ingredient is fine or good. You want a Miller? No thanks, I’ll have a glass of warm water instead.

Better than MGD.  About the same as Miller Lite.  Not a great brew by any stretch.  Tastes of corn and smells like peas and carrots.  I can tolerate it because it’s cheap.  1.39 for a 40oz.  If you are going for a cheap american mega, not a bad choice.  As Miller products go, I’d still choose the Beast.

A pretty damn unique beer, if you were to ask me!  It’s so mellow in your mouth and goes down so smooth.  I think the carbonation guy was half asleep when Miller invented this brew.  It’s very very smooth going down; there’s not enough bubbles to really scratch or tickle your throat, but that’s okay with me.  High Life also has a very earthy feel to it.  It leaves an odd aftertaste, especially when it warms up.  Kinda makes you feel like you were just eating dirt or sulfer or something weird like that.  Even when I grab an ice cold can out of the fridge, it still tastes warm to me.  It’s hard for me to rate this beer.  There have been times when I loved a can of High Life right to death, and other times when I would have rather indulged in a glass of warm llama piss.  I think my favorite thing about High Life is the 16 ounce can... it’s just so big!  lol... and getting 4 sixteen ounce cans for $2.50 at an expensive gas station doesn’t hurt, either.  I think that if you’re looking for a real cheap beer that doesn’t make you feel like you just weeded your garden with your tounge, Milwaukee’s Best may be a better suggestion, but one should not pay any disrespect to ’the champagne of beers’.

The sample I had was made by Molson’s Canadian brewery in Toronto (no SARS jokes please).
 Better than most of the mega US brews, not as good as some...for wat that’s worth..ajunct beer is not really beer in my estimation. It does have quality process control...one is pretty much the same and another....I just don’t care for corn or rice in beer..too sweet and funky for my personal taste......that’s all. 

Color: yellow... probably from corn .
Poured with a weak bleaced white head that lasted all of 45 seconds...no lace and only a tiny white ring on the glass.

Aroma: sweet, boiled grains and corn (veggy smells) with a wisp of hops.

Start: mellow..lots adjunct taste outpacing the malt what there was of it.
Palate: a light watery body full of malty-corn taste with a quick funky-sweet finish and no after taste.

I have the feeling that even molson couldn’t damage this beer’s formula.

Ever feel like drinking shit?  I have been in this rut lately.  Now I am livin the high life.  If this is the champagne of beers, I’d like to make a toast...May another sip never cross these lips and may the best beer your enemy ever taste be this.  Salute.
the best beer ever... i used to think natty was the best but this isn’t much more expensive for a way better taste.  Real Men Drink High Life
Piss Coloring.  Little/No Head.  Corn.  Skunk...Little Aroma or Taste...any desirable taste...if it wasn’t a tail gate party at Miller Stadium..."uh, what happened?  I just blacked out!"
fuck yeah. the champagne of beers is where it’s at bro. cheap for a case and it gets you krunked, what more do you need?

Never Bitter? what kind of shit were they smoking when they were making it? its very bitter... But as a store owner.. i must sell it. But... in my opinion i wouldnt waste my precious time on this. so i give it a 2 overall and why the Champagne of beers? thats kind of a stupid moniker.. its known only in the U.S of A... it is skunky... and comes in a 24 oz. can my father used to drink this... but why? thats only for me to decide.

Livin’ the high life...  Typical cheap pale lager.  Smells like corn, cereal, skunk.  Does have a bit of head, but that doesn’t make up for the lack of aroma or the terrible taste.  Very watery, lots of corn, slightest taste of malts

Well this beer was one of my fav. back in college.  Must be the HIGH life.  Nice label, good color, average beer.   The head is thin, bubble action is average.  It definately has a unique interesting taste.  Can’t say much for it.  Old monk gives it 1 thumbs up.

This macro is certainly not pleasing to the nose or palate....smells a little like bad corn.   Head lingers for a good while...though it’s never a healthy one.
Would drink it if it was the only beer available....would not seek it out at all.
Another popular choice for "Bad Beer Night".  Strangely smooth and looks great in an iced mug, but rips through you and makes you pay the next day.
Yellow color, small fizzy head.  Has smooth hopless flavor--thanks to corn malt no doubt.  Slight skunkiness.  Very watery but not too bad for an american domestic.
BLAH.  It smells bad, and it tastes bad.  I expected alot but it didn’t have a pleasant flavor, and the bitterness left me looking for a good Canadian brew to wash it away with.

On draft at this year’s "Art for the Cash Poor" in Fishtown.  Was hoping for Yards, but Miller made a better offer.  Good looking brew with big creamy head.  Not much flavor, but it went down okay.  No nasty chemical or soapy taste

Actually looks good in the glass - clear and sparkling gold, inviting.  No smell except for mild skunkiness.  Like water on the palate, skunky and small amounts of hops.  Aftertaste has notes of upset stomach.  Dreadful
Not horrible, better than bud light but not much, definiatly not the champagne of beers.
The Champagne of Beers.  Right.  More like someone pissed into a can and sold it as beer.  This stuff is awful.
The only flavor I taste is alcohol (surprisingly) and water.  Yes water.  It is weak and fizzy.  No thanks.
Can.  Lightly lactic corn/barley malt and straw aroma.  Yellow with large white head.   Lightly sweet corn/barley malt and very mild hay flavor.  High carbonation.    Clean tasting (i.e. bland).

High Life. This is old school, I remember when they were in those litte glass 7oz bottles that you never see anymore. Anyway, this is your typical domestic crap. Creamy aftertaste, easy to drink. Just watch your ass if you drink this when it’s not ice cold. Definite hangovers.
The Chanpagne of beers!  Blah!  Lots of head that will leave you belching all night long.

Pretty Standard big American stuff. Yellow and thin. Overall it’s a good cheap beer for when you are grilling
I do love the bottle though. When I drink the BMC stuff, this is my choice.

12 oz bottle. Yellow color with a white head. Smells like most cheap macrobrews. Only drink this if you want to feel very blue collar or if the only other choice is Bud Light!  I have to admit though.. this is my favorite crap beer.
remember from high school, tried it again after many years, gave me a headache after only 3
Better than Bud/Coors Light/miller/ but that’s like being the highest Mountain in Kansas... don’t mean much.

Yellow, clear, actually a decent amount of head & retention was good as well, but flavors were full of corn & other additives, slightly dry finish, really only good if it’s free or there’s absoutely nothing else to drink (which includes water)
this is a good cheap beer. not much flavor but it still isnt bad.pretty fizzy. it gets old fast.

Dry, but surprisingly smooth for its alcohol content and bite.  Not a fancy brew at all.  Best served cold to be sure.  I drank a 40 oz. of this --wouldn’t recommend more to be honest.  Moreover, it destroys your palate for the rest of the night.  Yeah, but it’s smooth!

7 oz. pony. Head scatters fast from the yellow column of liquid as if the carbon dioxide molecules are rejoicing in the certain prospect of finding a better chemical state. Smell suggests a wet box of cooked corn but at least it’s not skunky. Flavor of corn and lemon beat the aroma by a hair. Worse than remembered and I never did like it.

bottled ,local bodega- Not bad at all,Much better than Bud,Coors or MGD but that aint sayin much.Re -Rate had this again today ist was ice cold and that couldn't save it i dont know what i was thinking.

16 oz can. Yellow, quickly dying head. Smells of corn and grain. Tastes of corn and grain. Light to medium bodied, not too offensive. Better then Red Bull:) I use to adore this stuff as a teen, feeling a bit nostalgic. Drink on boys.
Had this after softball tonight, no selection at all in the bar.  Some slight flavor in there, guess people back in 1950 didnt have taste buds.
Ahhh yes... The Champagne of Beers.  Its absolutely poo-tacular.  Its just another American beer mass produced for the uncultured masses... Can I sound more beer snobbish?
alot better than the light beer they make...the champagne of beers my arse.

Just not a very good beer but probably under-rated by today’s beer snobs. If and when you need to complete a beer card somewhere this will not be the worst thing you will have to drink, but definatly in the bottom 50%

Well, I’ve heard this beer described two ways: the champagne of beers or piss.  I’m here to tell you that Miller High Life is better than that. Here is how I define Miller High Life: better than Bud Light.  Given, that’s not saying much, but it’s not as piss-poor as everyone makes it out to be.  Sure, it’s watery, it has a non-existent palate, and it looks like urine, but hey, at least it doesn’t taste like urine!  It is somewhat wheaty in taste and aroma, with a hint of sweetness.  It is very watery, which probably lends to its popularity among fraternity folk, by encouraging the consumption of mass amounts.  Not a horrible beer, but not one I’d really ever keep around.  Try it, if you have it.
Ah, what can be said about the high life. It's carbonated about as much as champagne, probably why it's the champagne of beers. Taste is watered down and um, well, gross!

Huge head, JUST LIKE CHAMPAGNE!!! i bet they keep this in cellars and turn the bottles everyday n shit. God at least it isnt as bland and wretched as its light counterpart. truly spawned in the devil's anus.
Actually had a nice head that lasted.  Corn, little lemon, chemicals.   Not the worst swill.
Can we say beer Pong? Power Hour?  Asshole?  FUNNEL!!!!!  The College beer.  It's Cheat and the next College Beer behind Nautral Ice.
ok so its bad beer, but I respect it, it's the champagne, and its where I turn when I'm in need of a hug.

I won't lie, I have ejoyed some crazy college nights with 40's of this. Goes down smooth and easy like water (which is pretty much what it tastes like), so it is easy to keep pounding and get drunk.... so it serves its purpose. Why else would anyone buy it?
O, beautiful golden longnecks that cost about $0.46 apiece.  You don't taste like anything, but you're smooth as water and perfect on August afternoons.
i didnt drink this tonight, but i could have sword i rated this.  apparently i didnt. this is not good- thats my rating.
I like the commercial better then i like the beer. Not one of my first choices but will have one here and there
You gotta love the Champagne of beer's.  Light and refreshing taste.  I'd drink it over any bud, miller or coors products.
I don't really think that this is that bad of a beer.  I'd mst definately drink it over a Bud.  I think the worst thing about it is the swillish mouthfeel it has.
I wasn't too keen on this one at 7pm but being on sale myself and a few others bought every last one in the bar. By 4am it was an excellent beer.

Insipid, diluted stuff that is drinkable only if you're already tanked.  Who actually pours this swill to examine the head and color?  I, for one, don't wanna see it unless it's in a 40 and I'm past the point of caring.
I remember the first time I had this boiled cattle piss. I need to forget it.  I couldn't even finish a can! It tastes horribly generic and somehow sweet. I wouldn't let my dog drink this.
I detect microscopic flavor.  Otherwise, this is bland and non-interesting.
Pale. Carbonated. Yeasty. Fizzy. Watery. Corn notes. I suppose it qualifies as "beer."

Bottle.  Pours VERY light with initial burst of champaigne bubbles that quickly die off, like a switch was flipped.  White head goes away, no lacing.  Odor is yeasty, bitter, noticable skunk(reminds me a lot of 1554 odor, but not nearly as complex).  Flavor is bitter, some apple skin, but not really enough to make it good and some skunk and metallic flavors.  Mouthfeel is very fizzy; body lighter than water.  Overall: I'm not sure that I'll finish this glass.
When poured it has a great look, as it sits there on the table it appears extremely drinkable. But, way too watery, fruity flavor, and just a striping taste. Looks great though.

The King of Macro-Swill, no joke. The Champagne of beers is as good as it gets*( When buying in cases or more) 
Smell is worthless, taste is corn and assorted adjuncts, mouthfeel of water and the drinkablilty is hindered by the off putting corn flavors

I made the mistake of going home and not bringing my own beer.  After a Saturday night at Buckeye drinking great beers, lunch Sunday was accompanied by Miller High Life (which Dad bought because it was cheaper than Busch the day he was in the store).  It smelled like the can it came out of and was a dull pale yellow color.  It did have the TV bubbles rising to the top.  This was the epitome of fizzy yellow beer.  Corn sweetness with more metal in the finish.  I don't think I've ever had one before and I guess I expected more from the champagne of beers, but this beer was just weak all the way around.
Sweet, almost too sweet.  Actually had a little bit of a head that didn't fall to the Earth in 5 seconds.
40oz variety.  good stuff.  smooth, easy to drink.  cheap.  if you're in the mood for a simple, easy drunk w/out the extra burden of comprehending complex flavors, this is a solid choice.
On draft, this beer is better than a typical macro brew. Sweeter macro-brew flavor. It has a nice creamy head where I have it on tap. No hop character or bitterness.
This beer isn't so bad for the cheaper beers. One of my favorites when im strapped for cash!

Bottle- Apearance:Fizzy, white,quickly diminishing head. Body. Pale yellow with many large bubles. Sub par aroma of cooked corn and rubber. No hops or malt noticable.  Finishing flavor pleasent enough for what it is(tinny touch of malt at end).  Light and watery.

This beer is actually a pleasant suprise compared to its brethren and its price category. The Robust flavor it has raises it Head and Shoulders above the other Macros. The lacing left behind in the glass is impressive. When ends don't meet and money is tight try the Life.

Poured a clear golden color, almost no head. Fairly non existent aroma as well. Taste is of mildly sweet corn; watery and thin. It's not horrible, but not very good. Standard American macro brew ... better than the Beast, but not by much.

It doesn't get much worse than this, folks. It's this kind of crap [Scheisse] that gives beer a bad name. The only thing I can think of worse is Michelob Ultra or Miller Lite or Coors or Bud Lite. I hate lite beers. I don't mind a light beer, but I hate a *lite* beer.
the champagne of beers, a cost effective way of becoming intoxicated, it is niether appealing to look at or taste. before i'm through i can put away alot of 'em
The head and flavor are nto bad, especially for the price.  BUt I don't make two bits an hour teaching college kids just to drink cheap beer.

a pale yellow-gold with a white head.  This is an old standard cheap mass-produced beer.  Very easy to drink and inexpensive.  If you have a choice between this and MGD, I would go for the genuine draft.  High Life has more corn taste than MGD and less beer flavor.  Neither is exactly anything to get excited about.  But Miller beers bring back fond memories of walking into the beer store as an under-aged teen and trying to look grown while buying beer for whatever crazy party we were going to that night.  So I guess it served some purpose when I look back on it.

Sample - 24 oz. can. Not an overly horrible beer for the price 'eh. Pop the tab and you get hit with a slightly astringent smell. Color when poured porders on the typical American Standard urinesque. Little to no head to speak of. Taste, when cold tastes essentially like nothing, but as it warms, you are hit with a not totally unpleasant corny taste mixed with the taste of low grade dilluted vodka (Popov comes to mind...) It is at least clean crisp and refreshing. The can leaves much to be desired - looks like they haven't changed it since the Korean War! The truly fine points of this brew can only be appreciated when weathering a winter evening during the winter of 1998 @ Ohio State. Nothing like drinking a case of this stuff, braving subzero temperatures to go to Cluck-U-Chicken, and then proceeding to go on a drunken rampage in a construction area by  pushing about 7 4 foot tall spools of BX wire into 11th Avenue, and setting up roadblocks with the sawhorses. Ah, if only I were 18 again....Precious memories like this can be had by you for as little as $5000 a year at Ohio State.

Old man beer. Old man wearing wife beater undergarment beer. Old man gone bowling beer. Not good, not good. Seriously, I remember the neighborhood's drunkard husbands all drank this beer. I can't stand it, not the taste, the smell, or the associations. Drain pour!!
has a tangy edge like the stench of bad cheddar.  the finish can only be appreciated by some.
I think this is a pretty good beer.  It is a crisp and clean tasting beer.  Plus the bottle is pretty cool.
This beer has little to offer in terms of taste and quality. ..............

I got curious as to just how much differnce there was between this and MGD.
I wanted to taste them side by side on the same nights. rating as well. 
I  Can't say much for this either , but as far as super macro's go, Not terrible. Carbonation was good
the head poured light and fluffy, and did manage to hang around to the bottom of the glass. Head was a tad fluffier, creamier and ended with more at the bottom of the glass than MGD. It alos had  decent lacing.
This is so close to MGD, in almost every respect, that if I have to take a macro, either one would do in a pinch.

Yay - another crappy American domestic. While I do like it better than Coors or Bud, it's still not good. Smells freakin' AWFUL (1 out of 10 is too high) although it does taste a BIT better than it smells. REALLY sticky mouthfeel (like I'd just chugged a Coke) with a funky kind of overcooked-popcorn aftertaste. Not even the best choice for just getting smashed, because you'd have to drink way too damn much of it. Better off chugging a couple high-alcohol 40s and get the job done quicker.
Is this really supposed to taste the way that it does.  Its old and sweet flavor makes the lack of carbonation all the more intolerable.
Safe enough to use in place of water in a fish tank! For a cheap macro, it's pretty good. Smooth and golden. good in a can, bottle, or keg.

Can: aroma is of grain, malt, and adjuncts. Pours a pale yellow with minimal head. Cheap adjunct taste with over-carbonation and thin-bodied. As a cheap beer, this is drinkable. I'd take it over any AB product.

The Champagne of Beers!  Why it's called that I'll never understand, especially when I can pick up a 30-pack for 11.50 (and coors light is 17.00).  Good for cheap bulk buying only.  Surprisingly not as terrible as you'd think, but it's best to make sure you have at least 5 to drown out the taste.
[can] Pale yellow with a quickly dissipating head. Not much of an aroma or taste. A good beer to drink lots of very quickly.
Clear gold. Light corn aroma, possibly some malt. Lighter sweet flavor. Light body. Better than Bud.

Appearance: looks like my piss after a long night of drinking. VERY LIGHT yellow, lots of foam.

Gross smell. Smells like festival garbage cans... you know the ones. The blue platic barrels with the ripped black bags in them, with hunks of hotdogs, pizza crust, and plastic beer cups spilling out over the top.

Taste isn't horrible, considering it's a Miller product. But that smell that is now permeating my room is making this beer less and less drinkable by the minute.

VERY light in the mouth. Feels like water going down, except the afterburps have a pukey flavor. Unyum.
Bottle: Pale yellow with small head; strange taste, some hits of metal?! last sip was sickening.
The official beer of my frat.  Not too bad after two or so, of course. Nothing to say- cheap American.  Right now it's on sale- $11/30 pack.
yeah this is it, worst one i have ever tried.  do your self a favor guys pour this one out for the homies.
Keg @ birthday party.  Good time.  Can't say the same about the beer.  I like this more than most BMC products.
Drank it out of a 40 (not kidding).  Actually better than I though it would be.
Watery mass produced garbage. Compared to the rest of Miller's products it's ok.

This is not as terrible as some beers I’ve had.  The worst part is the aroma - it’s terrible like piss.  For really cheap stuff I would usually rather have this, except that it gives me a nasty headache after only one.

I don't understand why this is rated higher than MGD.  High life is fine if you wear a cowboy hat and hang out at a bar where everyone knows your name, but it's not OK for the rest of us, buster.  Flavor is generic like other macrobrews.  Yes, there are worse beers in the world.  But not many.
alot of nostalgia in this rating.  i remember seeing this beer in the clear slender bottle and thinking ..... WOW!  the champaigne of bottled beers!  NOT!  overall - it's not a bad cheap beer!
If I have to drink a macrobeer, then it's going to be High Life. It's the essential bowling beer and all bowling alleys should be required to serve it. Overall, it's an okay. Perfectly cheap, too.

This canned brew poured a medium sized head of fine to medium sized white colored mnostly lasting bubbles that left behind a transparent softly carbonated straw urine yellow colored body and a fair lace.  The mouthfeel was buddly and mild with a malty finish.  The aroma is mildly malted and almost non-existant.   The flavor is mild with thin malty notes.  Can I have another stout PLEASE!!!!!!
this is the best of all cheap beers the hop content is correct the malt level is prefect what more could you ask for

Would be ok if not for the poor aftertaste.  Save yourself and drink it ice cold out of the bottle if you drink it at all.  I believe "Champagne of Beers" is a reference to the awful hangover you get from too much of this.

This poured straw-yellow with a huge soapy head that actually took a while to go away.  There's a distinctly malty aroma and unbelievably a not-disgusting malty flavor.  Damn, if they actually put any hops in this, it might not be so disgusting.  Just finished drinking Coors and Coors Light, so this seems great after that.  But "Champagne of Beer"?  C'mon ...
Light straw in color almost transparent.Small white foamy head,high carbonation.Appearance was the best part of this beer.
high life is decent, it taste better in bottles than it does in cans. i would recommend this beer for a cheap social night
Very nice lager for the price.  Comparable to a Corona except you could get two cases of miller for the price of one corona.  Good buy for the money

Not a favorite of mine, with its almost harsh rough flavor and mild aroma.  Easier to drink out of a can but you sacrifice its body. Then again its body is almost gross so i don't know what to say.  Stick with other Millers.

Bottle, Keg. Honestly smells like urine. This is of course, the beer I have to drink often at parties in college. It is a light-tasting beer with a smooth mouthfeel, but simply disgusting in all other departments. I'm not a snob, (as you can see by my beer list) but some things are worth paying the extra couple dollars. Drink something better.
I did not enjoy this beer. It left a funky bitter aftertaste. Not very enjoyable.

A lot of folks out there don't like this beer, but for whatever reason, I enjoy this beer.  Its smooth and crisp, though it lacks in the flavor department a bit.  Very inexpensive though and very drinkable, much more so than other varieties at this level.

This is a beer I could never really get myself to life - even when it was free.  Way too much head and not enough flavor.  It always seems to spill out the bottle, yet it doesn't satisify any of the beer loving traits other than to just get piss drunk.

This was my most favorite beer in the world for a few years when i lived in Georgia( USA that is)..its cheap, it tastes ok..and goes down real easy on a hot humid Georgia summer night..and it goes well with fried catfish! What more could you ask.
Its still a pretty good American style lager beer..its good value for what it is..nothing fancy working mans beer.Still drink this in the summer now and again..but not as often here in Oregon.

Had this visiting a friend in Santa Barbara. it was classic yellow fizzy stuff. Reminded me of MGD. Pretty harsh to drink. Cheap? Yes. Good? No. I walked to the nearest liquor store an bought a sixer of stone IPA. Yes, I know I'm a spoiled beer snob.
This is good beer. Better from the bottle than the can. Probably the best popular American beer.
Probobly the best of the cheap beers out there, Thats not saying much mind you.
"The champagne of beers" my ass!  High life? Try "I'm piss poor and I need to get trashed so maybe I should buy this beer "life!  Geez!

Tried again recently and found it less offensive, but still, a typical corn fed macro lager. Pale gold body with plenty of carbonation. The aroma is dish soap, lemons and spolied potatoes. Flavors are in your face with honey and corn sweetness. There is also a banana aftertaste. Pretty bad beer. Bad memories from being an undergrad. Crap like this kept me from liking beer for a long time.

Lawnmower fodder.  I like Miller High Life, and I really like the quaint 7 oz. bottles that harken back to a bygone day when 7 oz. seemed like a reasonable serving.  But let's face it:  Miller tastes like virtually every other American Pilsner.
Better beer than other cheap competitors. If you want to save some money but drink something other than water, stale soda and food coloring, then this beer will suit you.

Like most people I went through a kick in college where this was my go-to beer.  I drank so much of it that upon graduation I figured I’d never buy it again.  Fast forward 10 years and reality hits.  2 kids in daycare, no raise in sight, $17/case looks decent again and I must say, Ms. High Life, you are there for me again. Best shit beer on the market in my book.
I didn't bother pouring into a glass, the mini champagne bottle was about the most excitement I figured I'd get out of this one.  Probably one of the better American standard beers.
this is another okay beer but there are many better tasting beers out there to drink. i prefer something with more taste
Pours a straw color.  Nice head with artifical looking carbonation. Taste is sweet and body is full of never ending carbonation bubbles.  Not that terrible.

It is just so funny to see "champagne of beer" on the label!  Deepish yellow color.  Big irregular lace head created a briefly-lived spider web effect.  Once settled down, this gave a nod toward a natural cider--flat and a bit sweet, but with some lingering after-effects, such as corn and rice.  This beer went flat too quickly, leaving me just the comfort in knowing that I had bought a slew of 32 oz. bottles (one each of all available junk beers) for the low, low price of $1.49 per bottle.  Value in the acquisition of poor quality is no virtue, however.

My Favorite cheap beer. Unlike many here I like the yellow/gold beers. I think they look and taste refreshing. I especially like High Life w/ Italian. It is also great for tailgating. It's extremely cheap and it's easy to drink a lot of.
it's getting a 2 in flavor from me since it tastes better than mgd......
Really yellow and fizzy, but surprisingly smooth and palatable.  Probably a good thirst-quencher on a hot summer afternoon.  Bottom line:  It's a macro, but there's much worse out there.
Beats the crap out of Bud.  Not something I would pay for, and I'd turn it down if it was offered for free.
Just what you would expect from a macro-brew. Fizzy with little real taste. Have it with a hamburger.
I found this to be incredibly light.  It was very easy to drink.  Having said that, this beer lacked any flavor.  It is better than most other domestics.
Very yellow. What's with the frigging head?  It never goes away.  Very bland and sweet.  $3.50 for a 6 pack of 16os at the local dive should tell you who it is marketed at.
My favorite of all domestic beers. It has a little saltiness to the taste but a distinct pilsner. Much better than Bud. Just dont let it get warm.

This is the worst beer I have ever had. Skunky taste. All of them had a skunky taste. And I've had a lot since being in college to make sure it a bad batch. No hops. No malt. Little head. And to be honest I get sick after drinking 3 of these.
Mild spicy and malty/corn aroma. Smooth and sweet with some maltiness, drinkable but very bland overall. This one never did do much for me but I think the MGD version is marginally better.
Last night I forced down a quart of this swill. Some times I drink bad beer on purpose, in order to keep my palate honest. This beer was really bland and a bit harsh at the same time.
good for what ales ya!!!  just a typical american domestic that never fails to get the job done.  not a beer snob beer for sure!!

Not really the "high life" at all.  Tasted like a 40 of OE that someone drank half of and then filled the removed portion with water to make "OE Lite" or some equivalent.  It's what my college friends sadly equate to a "good, non-Yuengling beer"
This used to be my "unenlightened" beer... now I can't stand the stuff. Watery and wimpy, this beer just isn't very good.

Updated 10/20/03 - Pulled this one out of the back of the fridge to cleanse my palate from the atrocity of my last beer experience, see Brimstone Big Ale. Clear pee color. White decent artifical carbonation head. Minimal lacing. Smells like charcoal. Flavor is not horrid but very one-dimensional, what that dimension is I am not sure. Body is very watery and fizzy like a soda. It performed its job of cleaning my palate quite admirable!
Yellow with a small white head. Pretty lacking in flavor either good or bad. But I still like it,and its  my favorite of the big macro beers.
Better than budweiser. Most Wisconsin Beers are. This is the beer your grandparents drank. Past is the past. Not anywhere near a part of my drinking future.
Better than Budweiser. Leave it in the bottle though while drinking, otherwise it gets rather flat pretty fast. (Not that I am recommending it at the moment).

A friend of mine bought a 12 pack &#40$6.99&#41 of this, drank two of them, and then tried to give me the remaining ten. I took one to rate. It’s been at least 12 years since I tried this one. It pours a clear golden color with a small, fizzy white head that lingers a minute or two before completely dissipating. The aroma has some very faint hints of malt and corn. It has a very light body with lots of carbonation and a crisp mouth feel. The flavor is faintly grainy and malty up front with no hop presence. The finish is crisp with no lingering flavors, off or otherwise. Actually, not all that bad, just a typical bland, no flavored American standard lager.
A pretty good beer I'd have to say, knocked just because it's American and marketed, but overall a good cheap beverage.
Medium straw color; head was huge and fluffy from the foaming agents; mild hops in the nose. Actually not as terrible as I would have thought.

Okay...so, I'm in the working class and this "champagne of beers" is supposed to make me feel like I've worked hard and earned something good to end the day??? I'm worth more than this, Miller! This stuff isn't even good out of the freezer.
Overall a pretty awful beer, but it got me through my first year in university due to its cheapness. One of those beers that belongs in a can.

"It's the champagne of beers," my friend said to me, trying to convince me that High Life is bad. Heck, I know it's the champagne of beers because it says it right on the bottle. And it is, for all the right reasons. There's no aftertaste, no bitterness, and I certainly don't have to chew like with other beers. It's just plain good and those who don't like it probably haven't tried it or aren't willing to accept that anything from Miller could be good.

Don't knock it just because it's a cheaper beer.  It's got a great flavor and if you're on a budget you can't do better than this.  I can say, without exaggeration, that this is my choice of all domestic beers.  If you don't like this beer, it's probably because you've been drinking too much of the fancy stuff.  High life got me through college.  She may not be the best looking girl at the party, but she'll do.

Yes, Miller uses nice technology to avoid skunk flavor in the clear glass bottles.  Yes, they make a consistent beer.  No, I would not recommend this over carbonated 'beer' to you.  The good news is that it tastes like a light mega-swill light beer made by Miller.
Give me this over Schlitz, Strohs, PBR or any other Pabst acquisition.  For its price, it's not too bad.  Low headache factor.  Tastes better in warm weather, and you must have it in bottles.
Actually not too bad; it has some fruity notes, and is smooth on the way down. "...never bitter." isn't beer supposed to be bitter? Not a whole lot better than a malt liquor, but with less alcohol.
Cheap and nasty.  I would recommend that you only drink this only after drinking lots of something els that way you can get past the taste and aroma.

I liked it better than most mass produced.  A great alternative to light beers, gets you drunk but won't fill you up. Cheap, and believe it or not actually a bit of a treat when you're in college. Try it with Ritz crackers.
For an everyday low price of just $6.99 (12pak), it's the best bottle 'o' piss for your buck.

Rerate 11/29/03:  I’m going to try hard to give a serious rating this time.  Poors a very pale gold color with a head that looks good from the top (small bubbles, pillowy), but terrible through the sides of the glass (huge bubbles).  Tons of carbonation clinging to the side of the glass.  Aroma is purely corn.  Taste is initially somewhat malty, but the corn takes a progressively more dominant role through the middle, finish and aftertaste.  Still, the malts upfront are better than expected for the style.  Too much carbonation on the palate.  Tastes better if you swallow quickly.

The only good thing I can say about this beer is it pours up a big fluffy head that does not dissipate completely.  It is not very fizzy and does have some lacing.  There is basically no aroma and almost no flavor.  This would serve if one were in a desert dying of thirst.
Not bad overall.  Not much aroma.  The appearance is golden yellow.  To much alcohol flavor.  Nothing much to brag about here.
not much to say. it's not much at all. i have nothing else to say, frank.
as far as american beer goes this one is my favorite.very unique taste.quite a good beer.

Pours with a clear pale yellow body topped by a medium thick white head with good lace. The Slightly sour weak aroma with a slightly sweet malty background.  Slightly sweet malty flavor with a sour background.  The finish is slightly sour and salty.  Very light bodied and smooth.  The champagne of beers? I don't think so!

Although in it's price range, this beer doesn't necessarily provide the best taste; by purchasing and consuming High Life you are truely living life the right way.  It is a must to consume this beer while eating cheddarworst and baked beans followed by an upper-decking of your buddy's toilet.  This beer is an American hero.
Never liked this beer even before I discovered good beer.  Taste of corn syrup.  No hopps to speak of .  light watery swill.
The best beer in the Miller line up. It's hard to beat a bottle of High Life straight out of a chest of ice. Beats the hell out of anything brewed in St. Louis, truly The Champainge of beers!
The champagne of beers is cheaper than a glass of champagne most places which should tell you something....beer pong beer?  Oh yes.

Can.  Light yellow in color with a big foamy white head.  A slight must to the aroma and something else that adds an odd funk.  The flavor is fine for a macro american standard.  I happen to prefer Miller High Life above the other giants.

High Life tastes so much better out of a bottle. The cans are horrendous. If you come across an 8 pack of the high life ponies, I suggest buying them just to see how quickly you can put them away.  Live the High Life!

What is this world coming to?  Introduced by the COBfather,The Champagne of beers is the best beer going.  Life is to short to drink anything else. Is there really any beer easier on the eyes. The taste is priceless, and the sight of that beautiful bottle makes me giz my pants every time I see it.
the Champagne of beers? if Champagne taste like dog piss then i guess its ok.  very bitter
I'll have a good, cheap 40 of "Thug Life" every now and again. Not that bad a taste, decent color... just a good American Standard.

Yup, it is nasty American macroswill.  Having said that, there are occasions when  an ice cold 40 of the High Life just seems appropriate.  My "favorite" American Standard.  Possibly because of the purity of the corn taste, unadulterated by the presence of those pesky hops.

Can. Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain), with a light note of DMS. Flavor is moderately sweet. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. If this is the champagne of beers, what does that imply about champagne?
Like the review before me, it's not the nices to look at, and not the best smelling, yet it is the finest of the cheap american macrobrews.
It's not the nicest beer in the world to look at, nor is it the nicest smelling beer. Theres something in the taste though. Truly the champagne of domestic beers.
Finest in American beers, between them and A-B, someone should sue for false advertising. Miller LOW life as I like to call it.
oh yeah - A game at Miller park and A Miller High Life to go with the Chicken Nacho Grande. "The Champagne of Beer"?  Maybe as in Baby eat my caviar and drink my champagne!

Yes, it's "just your typical American cheap beer"

That's true. But... I've been grabbing cold 6s of this lately for campfire drinking while eating grilled bratwurst and corn on the cob -- it's perfect. The tall-boy 16oz can keeps it nice and cold for a long time. 

It's so kitchy - such a throwback to the cliche beer of the 1950s or something. And, at $3.99 for a 6, it's a steal. 

A great summer-time beer.
It is the Champagne of Cheap beer. Not bad overall taste. Better on a hot day and the beer is cold.Corn taste with some pale malts.

Miller High Life isn’t as bad as most people make it out to be. It isn’t a great beer either, but for macroswill, it’ll do. Makes a
good summer time lawnmower beer. For 3.2 beer, it’s fine for those hot summer days that you don’t want to get hammered on.
It’s a nice golden color, with a decent enough head. It tastes like cheap adjuncts, however. So, if you’re looking for something
esoteric, look elsewhere. It has that typical midwest, cornbelt taste to it, not something I enjoy drinking all the time, but if
offered a freebie, I won’t turn my nose up at it either. Might be worth your trying it, at least once.
I would rather drink toilet water than another can of this shit.  I bought it because it was on sale.  That's the only way stores can get rid of this crap.
This is shitty beer.  Big surprise.  Did you think the "champagne of beers" would be any good?

Yellow water.  Not much of anything here to speak of.  It's a standard American mass produced "beer".  The only reason I even opened it is because a friend left it in my fridge, and I don't like to waste beer, not even this one.

Tried some from a pitcher at the Pirate's Adventure in Orlando. Keeping my streak alive of not paying for a beer I am positive I won't like. Fizzy yellow crap, and I would rather eat belly button lint than pay for something like this.

Pale golden, more yellow than anything. Thick white head, zero carbonation.  Corn and some pale malts, along with rice and a hint of alcohol.  Heavy with corn, actually fills the mouth for a moment.  feels fake and lame.  Corn an a mild hop presence on the finish.  A classic of course.
My friend from Wisconsin drinks this stuff by the boat load.  I think it is disgusting, it's right on par with IceHouse or any of those other mass produced foul brews.
I can't believe this is still brewed.Total drain pour little else to say other then it,better not clog up the drain

OK from the keg, tastes and smells like shit from the can. My dad used to drink this stuff until he discovered Killian's (it is a step in the right direction). It is the 'champagne' of beers if you compare it to something as rank as Cook's.

the champagne of beers. yeah it's bad, but it's probably the best of the marcoswills. fun party beer. best when mixed with other beverages; example of a classic recipe: Load- 1 handle cheapest vodka, 1 bottle sprite, at least 1 bottle lemonade, and 6 pack of High Life. now that's the way to get hammered on a nice spring/summer afternoon. but seriously this stuff is bad

You gotta be high to get through a can without cringing. Absolute swill. On par with Bud. From a part of thr country where somehow the residents of the 1930's-50's were convinced this is what beer should taste like.
The ugly design of the can really needs to be improve in order to attract more customer.Despite having 5%,it is still relatively weak.As weak as LITE beers.
Naty light smell. However, it does taste like it's name, champagny, and for that it gets a little something. not much, but a little.

Typical pale lager with a sort of corny aroma. This thing has a massive soapy head with some wicked lacing. Should I be scared of that from swill? The flavor is a bit on the sweet side. Lots of corn and other filers present. The upside is it’s not offensive and pretty easy to pound back a few on a hot day. I prefer MGD but still it’s like comparing turds. Overall easy drinking, non offensive swill. Not much else to say
Clean, smooth taste...hmmm, my bottled water tastes the same as well when served at 40F.  This stuff is suprisingly not bad from a keg.  Otherwise, it's about what you expect for a bargain beer.
Ok this is not the good stuff, but served very cold it can serve a purpose. Somewhat crisp and refreshing - but has that less than 100% malt syndrome. Living the high life...
I was confused for a minute, in this part of the world it is called HIZZO! The best beer for a budget!!!
Basically it's Miller Lite with more calories.  Taste is marginal, but the price is right.  This is the best beer for those nights you just wanna get tanked.
Just a typical mass produced American beer. The flavor is pretty poor and leaves an after taste.

Not bad for macroswill. The price is right and it goes down smooth. Still has that funky Miller aftertaste/aroma though. This is THE old school beer to drink in Wisconsin. Not as bad as you would imagine.

very carbonated, has a foul aftertaste, cheap and just not worth it, might as well drink malt liquor.

32 oz gold cans look cool though, got one in a bar once
$0.74 for a 24 oz can!!!  It was late, I had no money and I couldn't resist the price tag.  So I bought 2.  Oh yeah...it tastes like piss.
This one makes me want to cry. Why do the watery american macros waste time making some of these?

Golden.  Flavor of hops.  A little sweet when cold, but often finishes with a sour aftertaste.  Not as thin as other beers in this class.  Not as good as Grain Belt Premium, but better and less expensive than most American macros.  Best in 24 returnable case.

Tastes like cold piss - unless you have a warm bottle - then you're in trouble. It does hold a warm place in my heart however; it reminds me of Friday nights in my teens - drinking pony bottles and running from the cops!

My favorite American. At least it has some body, some flavor and some color.  Strangely enough, a six pack of tall boys is less expensive than a 6 pack of 12oz or an 8 pack of ponies... you have to appreciate it on its relative price/value ratio alone, and against it's peers, it is at the top of the class.

My dad drinks this stuff. He's old school. He tells me about drinking Piels, Ortliebs, Schaefer, and Ballantine when they were premium beers. He thinks this stuff is great. I guess after years of thinking Piels is great, I'd think this stuff is good, too. It tastes very grainy. Leaves a bad after taste in my mouth. I will drink it in a pinch.
Completely awful.  The only thing making it better than O'Doul's is the alcohol content.

not too sure if the "champange of beers" is the best name for this beer, but it cool if you wanna make urself feel better. a pretty light taste but still pretty cheap so gotta hit it up every once in awhile. used to be better when it was 99 cents plus tax for a 32.

Can version. Yeasty, grain aroma. Not enough carbonation to be the "Champagne of Beers." Frothy, white head. Excellent lace. Pale yellow in color. Among the better American Standards due to offering if nothing but a semblance of bitterness. Nothing distinctive about this one; why waste the calories when you can have a Lite? Or much better yet, a craft brew with some flavor!

My favorite cheap beer..kinda reminds me of that cheap date I would call in the middle of the night just to get laid.  Golden color, soap sud head...she doesn't give it for long.  Sour old rusty pipe taste to her.

Foul; metallic and leaves a bad taste on the tounge, probably just a bad one (drank a cold can)
update: ok, it's drinkable.  cheap and oh so classy.
My personal favorite among the dirt cheap beers. When I can't afford the good stuff, I live the high life by drinking the champagne of beers.
this beer is why god created lemons. Had it during a blizzard, i love lemons, is there anything they can't do?
The one and only time I thought Milwaukee's Best tasted good............
Ah the High Life, more like low life if you are drinking this stuff.  Always found miller to be to sweet for me

The champagne of beers. This beer was the bomb when I was making $40 a week in college. You could always rely on any gas station in town to be selling the 32oz bottles for 99 cents.  Two high lifes in brown paper bags and you were ready to get your game on.

It"s Miller High Life!  Isn"t it funny how all the worst American beers get all the finest names ("The Champagne of Beers", "The King of Beers", etc)?  These are great to get in the pony size and pretend you"re doing some heavy drinking.
Poor quality beer. Drink this stuff at any temperature to warm to kill your taste buds and you will enjoy some truly foul flavors
Ah, the High Life...I only buy this when I'm rolling pennies, that's why the 20 for OI...good old cheap swill is still appreciated by the penny-rolling crowd, thanks Miller...Union made.
TERRIBLE. This is urine colored water. No flavor, no density. Absolute garbage.

A fine, inexpensive beer. Nothing wrong with drinking one of these from the can while watching a game on TV. It's well carbonated, with little or no aroma, but it's got a nicely balanced flavor. It's price/quality ratio is exceptional. It's probably the best "discount" beer that you will ever have.
The champagne of beers... what more can be said?............................
Corn and grass aroma, pale yellow, big head. Corn, grassy taste, watery. Poor.
Clean smooth taste?? Let me translate WATER!! With some yellow accents and carbonation
A classic American Macro brew-bowling alley beer. Good cold from the can but best in glass. A frosty 40 of this goes down good.

This is a good all around marco brew. I think it is the only Miller product worth getting. After re-testing this after have some good german beers this sucks. no mouth feel cheap taste an another disapointing american macro.
Light, bitter aftertaste. The only American I''ve tasted. ..................
Well... they call this the champain of beers????? i don''t think so... they should only make labatts
Miller High Life 40oz are the shit. They should be drunk in a paper bag and that is the meaning of life. The High life. they dont call it the champagine of beers for nothing.
Cheap... cheap... uh... cheap? Thats about the only good things going for it. Watery and weak tasting. Champagne of beers? Yep, no wonder I dont like champagne.

Crap. Bitter aftertaste. It tastes like watered down MGD, which isn't good either. I will not even let someone buy me another one of these. Here is a tip: Anything that costs less than $3 a six pack is guaranteed to suck ass. This is no exception. I can not believe Norton's review. Are you drunk?

RERATE-2: My overall rating reflects a bottle sample. RERATE: Converted a Bud drinker into a High Life drinker at the races this weekend.  OLD: Way before the trendy TV ads, this was a staple in my fridge. This is how a good ol' American brew is supposed to taste. This is THE All-American Beer! Sneak it into your stuck up Bud Light drinking friends' glasses and they'll marvel at how great a REAL beer tastes... if they don't then they don't really like BEER!!!!!!!!!
well balanced as a light beer with virtually no hop taste.  But water is a good alternative.
There is no better beer for the money!......................................

mmmmmm....the champagne of beers.  fun bubbles keep rising, perhaps that''s fun to watch after you''re a bit drunk?  Other than that, just another cheep beer.  Drink it out of the bottle, not a glass, you''ll get less aroma.  Also, it will maintain more of it''s head inside the bottle.

Soapy aroma with very slight floral notes and a big canned-corn aroma. Not altogether pleasant.
Crystal clear light yellow hue. Small, creamy white head. Mostly diminishing with so-so lacing.
The flavor is of seltzer water with just a touch of hop extract and corn... Ok, Ok, I tried to rate this beer seriously. I give up! It’s just another rice/corn laden American standard beer.
