If you must drink it, do so ICE COLD in a frosty mug so you don’t actually have to taste it. Drink it in the parking lot before a football game in the freezing cold.
very cheap beer to buy. excellent choice as a college student like myself...
A quality, cheap beer, that tastes great.  I'm from Canada, and when I saw this stuff for like a $1 a bottle, I feared the worst.  But I don't mind it at all!
Sweet.  Cheap and good to drink at parties.  Lovely for college kids like me.

Fuck it, It''s Beer!!!

Aw Swiller,  One of my first favorite beers...When I was 16 my friends and I would buy a couple of 30 packs and just drive to a derserted rode where we would get drunk and shoot roman candles at eachother,  If thats not male bonding I don''t know what is!!!

don''t listen to the television ad''s. this is not the party tyme beer for a high life man. this is the i couldn''t afford a good beer and wanted to get f**ked up beer. nothing really champagne about this beer. it''s a sweeter beer than you would think and runs right through ya if you know what i mean.
The champagne of beers, my ass.  This is way too sweet of a beer to even stomach.
Smells bad. Tastes worse. Commercials say it''s the high life, but i''ve only seen low life''s drinking it. Go figure.
One could do way worse for the money.  Pure golden color, white head that dissipates rather quickly.  Found carbonation to be somewhat lacking.  Would drink again, but only as a last resort.
This beer sucks man, a night of drinking this made me shake and sweat in anticipation of getting the sweet taste of Milwaukees Best again.
cheap and tastes pretty decent. if you don't have enough money to get something really good this is the way to go
This is great cheap beer.  I used to drink it almost every single day.  You cant go wrong with the champagne of beers.
Canned. Pale yellow with airy head. No aroma. Very light chemical soapy corn flavour. Nothing else. This one was real bad.

A very faint yellow with a creamy white head.  Nearly endless stream of carbonation rising from the bottom.  Smells of alcohol and corn.  Taste is fairly light, with a corn and creamy taste.  Really not much on the palate, perhaps a surprisingly unpleasant alcohol flavor in the end.  Rather distinctive, but not exactly good.
If clean, smooth taste equates to water they would have got the description right...
this means that you''ve put slightly more then the lowest amount of effort into planning your bar b que.
I do not like this beer. I had to drink it to find out for myself. Why beer like this are so popular when no one likes it I don''t know.
This beer is trash. It''s the worst from the miller brewing company other than Red Dog and i wouldn''t pay for it.
Certainly a below average beer. As far as cheap Miller products go, I would rather have a MGD.  As bad as this is, I would take it over a Bud for sure.

Somewhat skunky taste and aroma.  As with all other Miller brands I have tried, has a bad, lingering aftertaste.  Better than Lite, but not as good as MGD.  One to avoid unless it''s the only thing available or you are broke.
its not to bad. MGD is alot better. this has too much sugar in it. you can taste it
high life..as you must be high to drink this? I'm not even sure a Tijuana whore would screw around with this..
The weakest of the standard Miller beers. Lite Ice gives you more of what you''re looking for in this can.
Miller High Life is the perfect blue collar working man''s beer.  It brings images of patato salad, coleslaw, cook outs, and axel grease.  Great stuff!

My SO drank this for awhile so I always had some. His excuse was that it was "cheap and we have to save money." MHL is only better than the other MBC products because of the cool bottle and clever advertising.
For my tastes this is better than MGD or Miller Lite, but not by much.......

This is the epitome of the fizzy, yellow American lager. It tastes, basically, like carbonation. You can suck it down fast if you so desire or pour it down the drain and take a shot of whiskey. Same effect.

Used to be my cheap beer of choice. Great ad campaign but lacking in taste. Has a sort of rubbery, nostril-filling taste with an off-putting sweet aftertaste. Barley is not the only grain that went into this, for sure. Much better than MGD (gag) or the dreaded Lite.
Yuck. Pay the extra 5 or soo bucks and get MGD or Miller Lite if your bent on buying a brew from...well...Miller.
Substitution for water, and it is not a light beer! Buy it over Coors, Milwaukees Best and Schlitz (almost extinct for a reason) but that is about it.

I think this is the same as miller life just marketed towards white trash.  I picked up a case of Paulaner Oktoberfest and some Sam Adams Winter Lager today- and some bum was buying a case of High life- I think I make my point.
I have consumed so many miller high lifes that you could float a boat..no serious that many
THE CHAMPAGNE OF BEERS!!! not too bad either................................

Golden color, HUGE, fluffy white head. Super Belgian Lace. The head lasted through a 22oz beer in a tall glass. OK, so it''s not the most flavorful beer in the world. Compared to the other mass produced swill in this country, Miller High Life is the best.
One of the few big time beers that I''ll still order when a place has no craft beers, but I won''t be happy about it.
Tates as close to nothing as you can get, but at least it doesn''t taste BAD

Miller High Life, the name says it all, A good brew for good times, Football Beer at its finest!  I love the 16oz cans, and the taste as well, for a standard american beer it is fairly exotic, don't ever change it!  Good stuff!
Great picture on the front... makes no sense, but who cares. Light, crisp and not much else.

This beer is an American classic and is pretty cheap. I like it better than Genuine Draft, as it has a little more flavor. Sure its grainy and adjunct loaded,  but overall its a decent macro if you're in a swillin' mood.
Er.. Um.. Boring comes to mind. Yea, thats it!..............................
I hope the High Life doesn't represent the finest in American beers. It's an average beer, but they do have nice commercials.

The champagne of beers.  The color is about right, but I think that's where the claim loses credibility.  While slightly better than bud, I'd still rather patch my camaro with more bondo than drink this.  So utterly tasteless, the closest comparison would be seltzer water.
I have enjoyed many beers in my day and this is definitely a quality beverage. It is excellent after a long day on the garbage route to sit back and enjoy a cold miller high life.

this is a quality beverage at a quality price. i am an avid consumer of alcoholic beverages and this is one of my favorite beers. behind keystone products and and rickards pale this very well could be one of the greatest beers in the whole species of beers.
The after taste is not too bad, but it is with out a doubt a college beer, by the price and the poor quality. It seems almost see through and has some sort of skunky smell to it.

Someone left one in my cooler after a flag football game...I had to drink it didn't I?  The beer of my youth - still have scars from opening the bottles.  A step above Bud in my opinion - little bit more of a skunky aroma though.  Appearance - can almost see through it. Kind of a sweet aftertaste.
Beer????  I dont think so.  but the day on the beach in the sun checkin out the bikinis wouldnt be the same without it.

The Champagne of Beers. This beer has been around for over 100 years. The only things that bothers me about this beer is the price. What was Miller thinking about when they lowered the price on such a fine brew? This is a classic and will remain that way long after the Micro brews have faded away.
not to bad for a budget beer. i usually fall back on this when i'm poor and want a tall can of something
I've seen a lot of guys knocking this beer...I come from a long line of beer drinkers who's motto is quanity rather than quality.  Cheap, 5%ABV, how can you go wrong.
A little better than Milwaukee's BEAST. A hell of alot better than MGD......

Well, when someone hands you a free beer it's always polite to thank them and then drink it.  I hadn't tasted Miller since back in my college days.  It was no worse or better than I remembered it. No particular taste stands out; not very sweet nor bitter. I'd have to say it looks better than it tastes.
Light yellow. Very fizzy. Extremely slight hop and malt aroma. Slight malt flavor. Slight hop flavor. No real bitterness. Not as bad as I had remembered although nothing stunning.

It truely is the champagne of beers. This brew is inexpensive, yet has an alcohol content that is comfortable to everyone. I choose this beer when I go to parties, because I'll prob. be the only person with it, and I can tell if someone is taking my beer. I highly recommend this brew. (plus this group of kids that call themselves the "associates" think its a good brew, and they are the coolest **cough cough** bullshit)
For a mainstream beer this is a drinkable. Foul smelling IMHO, but looks decent and has an okay taste. I wouldn't buy it myself!
i could not like this beer,very poor all around..nasty......................
I've recently moved to a college town. This was the best thing I could find in the grocery store(sad). Awful stuff, corn syrupy. Nothing but adjunct flavor here,and a little popcorn.

I grew up on this beer and progressed to MGD and finally on to REAL beers with hops and malt.  This is a nice sweet beer, which is perfect for the younger generation.  Not much of a bitter taste..the Miller people don't want to offend the kiddies that drink it.
pretty good beer not as good as mgd but close prerrt smooth.................

Haha, this just makes me laugh for some reason. I picture a sophisticate sipping this from a crystal glass...pinkie out. It's definitely a bit of the bubbly, but somehow this just doesn't stand out as anything champagne-esque.  This proves that yes, it is possible to carbonate donkey piss.

The saving grace of this beer is that it tends to be highly carbonated enough to have some action, if not taste, on the tongue.  It also works fine for watching a few amateur fireworks sparkle across a small northern Wisconsin lake, a roaring bonfire nearby and promise that the conversation and northern lights will eventually compensate for the beer.
It's got a uniquely sweet taste that grows on you as long as you've had good experiences while drinking this beverage.  First time out of a bottle.  It was better than from the can.

A beer drinkers beer.
A classic American beer.
Love it!...................
Average macro beer. Refreshing. Good for when you're on a budget and don't have money for the expensive shit. Drinkable and not skunky, but very dull tasting.

Well I went Old School again tonight, if Bud is the King, then Miller is the Champagne, and of what, Piss, that is what, another low quality bad tasting American macrobrew, better than a Bud, but Bud`s marketing will outpace Miller everytime. Never Recomended
Miller High Life just sucks.  Its cheap and it is pretty obvious why........
And they call this the champagne of beers.  More tolerable than a Budweiser, but that doesn't say too much

Feh! this beer shtanks!
generic crap,,no head no aroma.....................

Definitely better than simple ole MGD, but not much of an improvement. Goes down better, but its still heavily carbonated and the taste just dies near the end. Not something i can drink much of or on a regular basis.

Even on tap, I was struck by the metallic tang of the aroma---oh, yeah...by the way...there were traces of hops in there, too...Color is a light yellow-gold with a thin head that did try to cling to the glass--It is more attractive, at least, than MGD.  The first thing to greet the tastebuds is carbonation--not a good omen...later in the day were trace levels of malt/adjunct sweetness and some facsimile of hops, which came through a bit better in the finish. Body is predictably thin, and over-carbonation ruins what balance might have been there. I do award points, however, for a beer not having "Light" in its title.
Pretty good, tastes like bitter corn........................................
Tastes a lot like Grainbelt Premium.  In other words one heck of a good beer.
Millions of little bubbles relentlessly attack the palate with metallic swords...Awful...
Good malt notes and head retention. At $3.99 for 6 tall boys you can't go wrong for an American Standard
Where's the tast??? I didn't know there was 5% in water because that is what this was water I wouldn't call this a beer on a good day!
Oh, one of my favorites......nah, just kidding.  always tastes watery to me, the last one i had was better than MGD, so there.
Very much like miller light, but much more sour.............................
There's something to be said about their ad campaign that makes it seem unAmerican to hate this beer.  I guess I hate to love it.  It's drinkable, at least, and it's not terrible.
Did mine come skunked? oh wait, theres no way of telling cause thats how it always tastes!
Skunky, sour taste. Worthless. Why did Miller decide to cheap down what was once a great American beer?

Worty, weak aroma. Slightly sour and little hops. Light pale yellow with temporary head. Fizzy, watery body. Weak and watery taste. Very little hops, adjuncty flavor and after. General American weak swill.
More American beer designed solely for getting drunk off of.  Easy to drink, but why bother?
So, this is the Champaigne of Beers, right?  I think I'd rather have the beer of champaignes.

A decient american beer. Nothing special. Stated as advertised, smooth, drinkable, good for get togethers. Also a good beer for meals. It has a gentle flavor which doesn't over power the food. Also it is cost effective for a party beer.
I always enjoyed this mre than Budweiser.  Wouldn't drink it much know but really used to enjoy this.
Grab a 16 oz. Tall Boy and drink 'er down!  Refreshing and further testament to the fact that Milwaukee puts out a better brand of Beer than St. Louis.
if a god exsist this is his thoughless demise for the human race............

OK taste, Good price, and OK appearance.
This beer is OK, but don't mix 
it with Blatz.  If you do contact your doctor immediately
I can remember seeing many an ice chest filled with this stuff as a kid.  It was the first beer I "snuck" so it holds a soft spot in my heart.  Having said that, I moved on.

Egads! Have I not rated Miller High Life?!?! I've certainly bought my share of Miller!  $2.19 for 4 tallboys down at the Petro station! This is lawnmower beer at it's pinnacle! It has a certain funk to it, and a flavor profile that's laden with corn and adjuncts.  Not particularly hoppy, and clings to the palate.  I use this frequently for marinade.  For some reason, I have a soft spot for MHL...

An absolutley foul chemical revolting grassy gassy assy aroma. Every grainy smell that you can imagine that should not be in a beer's aroma wafted from this taster. I wanted to find something in here to like...after all I rate Bud, Pabst and other American Standards relatively high (1.7ish), but not this one.
More offensive than either MGD or Lite; is that enough info for you?........
Used to drink alot of it before I knew better. Has a funky after taste I can't quite put a finger on. If you have a choice,  choose something else!
Eh. Not too much flavor, a little too much carbonation. But its cheap and palatable. MGD has more taste and heft to it
In high school (20 years ago) this was the shit. Quart bottles from the drive-in liquor store. Worthless nowadays.
Champagne of Beers? How about the Week Old Goat's Piss of Beers. I still don't see how anyone could drink this stuff.
Possibly my favorite beer, great tasting, cans are great, bottles are better.  If your looking for a good beer for a cheap price can't go wrong with the this one "the chapagne of beers".  Great brew.

*Re-Rate* - This brew pours from the bottle a pale sparkling gold.  The generous white frothy head is on the edge of creamy.  The head is full lasting (I had over an inch of head at the bottom of the glass when finished) and has good lacing.  The faint nose is very neutral with hints of caramel, flowers, pine and wet paper.  The flavor is light, crisp and sweet (very pilsenerish) but lacks depth.  The finish is average and flowery.  The brew is light of body with a lively oily texture and feels clean at the finish.  This is a highly quaffable brew for someone on a budget.  I am doing a head to head between this and Budweiser today.  *Original rating 2/8/02: 3-2-5-2-7; 1.9  (from memory)*I was weaned on this stuff.  I have many childhood memories of family get-togethers watching the drunken derelict dagos stagger around with a can of either this, or Pabst Blue Ribbon in their hands.  I have a much easier time choking this down than Bud.

Ok, the champagne of beers..blablabla.  It's decent, but let's not talk it up so much. The only thing that makes it the "champagne" of beers is its high carbonation and light body.  
But not to bad mouth it too much, it's a decent brew with a distinctive taste.  Good one to try.
Whoa, this beer tastes like water, very fizzy water.  It should be called Miller Corn Life.
Some light, corn-tasting, sweetish flavors, no hops at all (what a shock)...
A drinable cheap beer.  Has a sweet taste that you stop noticing after yu have half the case down.

Really not a bad beer, especially for the price.  Kinda nice to just sit down and watch some football sith a good American beer.  The taste is not overly strong, which is good because it prevents it from being offensive like most American Standard beers.
Not a bad beer.  I prefer darker beers, but not everyone else does, so I keep some cans of this around the house.  Not bad to have on a hot summer day or after basketball.
One of my worst beers (Schlitz actually wins the title).  Light, unsatisfying.  Makes you burp a lot.  Head last a second then it a yellow tea sort of look.  Pass.
Only every 10 years will I drink one. It is really cheap for a reason: homeless people need beer too. If this was all I could afford I would just quit drinking.
Good stuff, I drink it like water, very fizzy water. It gets me drunk and I don't get sick, so I can't complain. Tastes a little like Grainbelt Premium.... but cheaper!

This beer tastes great ice cold in the small stubby 7oz bottle. Great color, flavor, and good bite. Those 7 oz bottles are made to go down cold and fast. The colder the better. Scores high on my list.

This is not such a bad beer, the champagne of beers, not likely.  My brother used to make fun of me for drinking this stuff by saying that it smelled like farts.  I never noticed this, but I did notice that its much better from the bottle than the can.  There is noticable rankness in the can, but in the bottle, its not too bad.
what is it? the champagne of beers or something? alright....................
Musty smell, very sweet,nice copper color. Not a bad american pils, lacking hops I guess that is why they say Always smooth never bitter.
One is usually all I can handle before I want something different.  I'll drink it, but not necessarily like it.
As far as American beers go, this one is okay, but I would never drink it unless I was in dire need of a beer.

Me and my buddies drank a boat load of this stuff in high school.  My best buddys dad used to buy 2 to 3 24 packs at a time and we were always getting shitfaced off of this.  The champagne of beers was what my best men and I had at my wedding in place of champagne, everyone laughed when we pulled out cans of high life when it was time for the toast.
It's a bad beer, but it's better than coors or bud..........................
Hey, as far as macros go it's far from the worst, and often at a price cheaper even than Natty or Beast.
As I drink this pissbeer, I'm trying not to puke............................
why would anybody go to the trouble to urinate in a can?..................
Quite possibly the worst beer I’ve ever head in my life. It’s a bad american beer similar to Milwaukee’s Best but worse (shockingly)due to the worst aftertaste ever. Undrinkable.  Overpriced too.
The Champagne Of Beers  They would not say it if it was not true............
This beer is good. I am tired of beer snobs trying to put this beer down. ..
For a macro, this isn't the worst you can find.  I know that isn't saying much, but if you're looking at the Miller's, this is probably the best one to get.
After tasting High Life, I was moved to try my own feces.  Poop isn't much for taste, but at least it gets rid of the nasty nasty taste of miller high life.

I enjoy drinking Miller High Life....there I said it.   I Always have always enjoyed the High Life and sfter drinking it again I still do. Do yourself a favor a buy bottles over cans, it'll taste better.

Same disgusting crystal clear straw color every macro has with no lasting head.  Just a touch of sweetness, but it isn't malt sweetness.  Slight bitter finish.  This is to beer as champale is to champagne.  The amazing thing is that they make light and ice versions of this crap.

This beer is certainly better than most give it credit for. It is after all, "The Champaign of Beers".  This is my favorite American Macrobrew. Nice slightly sweet flavor. "Always smooth, never bitter" just about hits it on the head. Excellent budget beer and great with most American cuisine.
Absolute piss, High Life's head fizzles away like it's soda, which is a good precursor to its taste.  Good for chugging, though.
Mega Brew that I don't like.  I actually prefer Miller Light to this.  Champagne of beers?  NOT! Bit of bitter aftertaste and the bottles just look funny.
Typical American Macro beer.  I've had a few but at some places this is the best thing to be had...  I try to stay out of those places.

As far a mass produced cheap beer goes, this has to be my favorite.  The price is right and it has a less noticable metallic, water, and cereal taste to it.  Easy to go down, but definitely not something to savor.
Moderate amount of carbonation and a firm, thick head. This beer is a little on the sweet side and it has a finish that lingers on the palate with a slight corn-taste finish.
Champagne? Maybe for winos and frat boys, but those of us who are more civilized try and drink things that don't taste like they've been in someone's urethra.
I'm in high school and the chicks even like it so...........................

As an american standard, most likely my favorite.  While I agree that in the grand scale of beers this is not even close to the top, but per style about as good as it gets.  If fresh, great white head with nice lace.  If poured correctly the over-carbonation is released.  The malt and corn flavors are well bananced with the flavor and bittering hops.  The one thing I like with this beer as compared to others in this style is that there is actually some yeast character in this one.  A great low priced summer grilling session beer.
Prefer the lite version, this is painfully carbonated.......................
Definitely priceworthy and gets the job done................................

what can i say, its the champagne of beers
................................

Getting home late after workin for since 11, happy because I have 85 bucks in my pocket. I'm stressed out and wanna drink into a high life induced slumber. So I'll spend 7$ on a 12'er and settle up with the tv and get plowed. A fav for economical drunkness!

The slogan for this beer rules. I used to buy this stuff for 5 bucks a 12 pack at the Jersey shore. This beer has an acquired taste, so be careful. However, I enjoy drinking this beer at the bar with the fellows, over a long discussion on how we beat our wife’s and/or girlfriends. We also discuss the life and the untimely death of the Dunkin Doughnuts midget. Thanks Miller High Life, you are the true champagne of beers.
best cheap beer out there, very good bbq beer, goes down great..............

My room mate, Keith Schroeder, at Iowa State used to do "Beer Engineering" each Wednesday.  That was when the weekly beer ads came out.  He'd figure out which beer was the cheapest per ounce.  Each week, we'd head over to the Keg Shop, because that's where you could by cases of 40 oz. Miller High Life.  Drink two, and you were guaranteed to feel like you ate something rotten the next morning.
Way to go Miller, keep marketing to rednecks!  Your beer tastes bad and is not the champagne of piss!
Lord help me...what was I thinking.  If you can finish the large bottle, your're a brave soul.

When I was a lad, I worked in a supermarket  in Detroit.  Every Saturday evening like clockwork, an elegant and very elderly lady came in, and amongst
her other sundry groceries, she always purchased one  -  exactly one  -  bottle of Miller High Life. If you are the kind of person who likes one bottle of beer as an occasional treat, Miller is a good one.
If you think of the world of beer as a fascinating continent with many exciting new areas to be explored, you can skip right over Miller High Life.
Champagne of beers?  Whoever made that claim must like really crapy Champagne too.
Not that good, but sometimes you gotta slum it..............................
i like this beer because it is not strong and i get a buzz off only a few of them
equivalent to the beast, a 2, fine to slam, terrible to taste.  ............
If you want to get drunk and are low on cash, get this.  Do not drink though to enjoy flavor.
Better than Bud and Coors, at least.........................................
best served in a creek overnight and all muddy cans. but it is the champagne of beers. severly underrated

Corsendonk Pale Ale is the champagne of beers. This is the caffeine-free Diet Pepsi with lemon of beers, except that I'd drink caffeine-free Diet Pepsi with lemon if I was dying of thirst in the Sahara.

pretty smooth beer, enjoy the taste, overall good beer for the money
......
Very reliable and drinkable. Great for chuging and binge drinking. Cheap and cost effective. Minimal hangover side effects.

The Champagne of Beers. One of my friends says all of his "kin" in the deep south and appalacia don't drink anything else (except moonshine.) My dad won't even drink this beer. And take my word for it, that's a bad sign. However, it's a good cheap beer and I consider myself an expert on cheap beer.
HIGH life yes maybee you need to be high to drink this and have it taste good,,,horrid taste and even a more horrid body and after taste
The first beer i ever had.  Thought it was great at the time, now i think it sucks.  Score reflects nostalgia value/
It looks like beer. It sort of tastes like beer. I have a friend that swears by the stuff, so at his barbeques I must suck it up and do the Champagne of Beers. O-well.
champagne of beer?  more like the wine-in-a-box of beer.....................
It looks like beer, but it sure does NOT taste like beer. Skunky, tasteless, overly metallic (that can be from the can, though). A waste of time.
probably the best cheap beer out there; i wouldnt be disappointed if someone handed me one.  nothing offensive about this beer at all.

Was a great beer waaay back when. Too bad people are buying all that 'tough man' advertising B/S. This beer sucks and it's what I see bums outside the liquor store on the floor drinking (on a good panhandling day). It has a cheap beer taste, but somehow it doesn't connect right. AKA Miller Low-Life.
The commercials say it all.....I'm a High Life Man..........................

i like high life, its far better than anything from budweiser, coors, and much tastier than any other miller products.  bottles do taste much better, but i usually keep a 30 pack of cans at the house.  you can drink it with friends, and not feel bad about wasting alot of money.
damn, why did i waste my time with this crap!...............................

So remember......... When it’s time to relax .... one beer stands clear, beer after beer ..... if you ’ve got the time ... we’ve got the beer ... Miller Beer.

Always smooth, never flavorful. That said, it's hard to mess with a classic. Ever since I did a scan job on a 40's photo of a guy drinking an old cross top bottle, I have had respect for the 'champagne of beers'. There's little taste, but that's not why regulars buy it, right? Beware of hangovers, of loose women, on second thought I DO like it.
Cheap beer.  I have to argue with it being the "Champagne of beers" though.

This is one of the first beers I ever had. You can't dis it, it's the champange of beers.

What can you say about Miller High Life.  Everyone's first beer.  If I'm not mistaken, years ago, wasn't it priced and positioned to compete with Budweiser?  Now it's a cheap beer.  And why is it so much more drinkable in bottles, even more so than other beers?  I NEVER buy this stuff in cans, and would barely take a free one.  The tall glass bottles that it comes in now are cool.  A good fishing beer, but overall not very good.
Very reliable and drinkable. Party time beer. Cheap nuff said...............
Looks like a light beer, and it smells like one too. The taste isn't great, and it is kind of watery. I thought this wasn't a lite beer? Oh well, it does the trick.

The first beer that ever made me barf (not because it was bad, because I drank too much; and it was only a 6-pack...hey, I was young...)  My friends & I set up some tents in the woods, got one of our older brothers to buy us a case and we rocked!!  I remember singing Eric Clapton's "Cocaine" with a little different ending.... "We're all high, we're all high....Millers!!!"  Ah, memories of what was once a beer I had a pretty good opinion of.  How times have changed.
I'll pass next time someone offers me a glass of this.......................
A classic beer, not worth drinking in cans..................................

 the appearance looks like someone peed in the bottle.

i almost puked when i took a sip of this beer.

Smoother than most domestics. Easy drinking, but lacks characteristic flavors. MHL typifies American domestic beer.

Most of you know that one of my hobbies is beer.  But what you probably didn't know is that another of my hobbies is industrial espionage. Well, it took a while, but I've finally secured the files which contain all of the Miller Brewing Company's recipes.  The recipe for High Life is as follows:  for 1000hl batch, take 990 hl water, add 9 hl corn syrup and boil two hours.  Transfer from "mash" tun to fermenter via used catheters from Shady Pines Nursing Home.  Ferment with yeast scraped from the fingernails of cadavers.  Once fermentation complete, spike with 10 hl gasoline.  Top up with paint thinner to taste.

Most other Miller product aren't too bad but this beer is terrible. The only thing good about it is its slogan "Champaign of Beers".  I don't care if you can get a 30 pack for $10, this is amongst the crappiest beers I've ever tasted.

Of all Miller products, I like this one best.  It still has that slight sweetness and better-bodied taste I remember from years ago.  Yes, it's different, but to me it's a step up---albeit a small one---from most American crap.
Miller Lite is alright.  I have no idea what this crap is.  It definitely has a unique flavor.  Uniquely terrible.

This tasted good after I drank half a bottle of cheap Scotch on Valentine's Day last year. Having tried it under circumstances more conducive to beer-tasting, I find that it is bland and characterless, though certainly quite fizzy.
This is as bad as it gets.  Fizzy yellow beer at its worst.  The champagne of beers?  More like the horse's ass of beers. Corn and chemicals dominate the taste.  The bubbles hurt my tongue.
I love this beer because its cheap and actually tasted good.  By far the bst product from Miller and far better than most of the crap produced by AB and Coors.  This is a great party beer.

Busch might not be good beer, but it is a notch above this. The High Life still tasted bad to me.  It has a weird chemical-type aftertaste and in general it is not good beer.  To each his own.  If you like it fine. Do I aspire to drink more of the High Life?  No.  This is more like Low Life.
ha ha ha once again about the only props I can give this beer is it's mild resemblance to beer... if you have any good sense at all please don't support miller and buy this beer...

As a fruity punk who likes imports and micros, I tried living the HIGH LIFE but discovered that living the HIGH LIFE really means occasionally being able to raise your head from the gutter.  Granted, this is a better macro than most of the stuff out there, as it actually has something resembling a flavor, but it's still by and large a tasteless, urine-colored beverage best buried under a large rock and left alone for many, many years.

I started out on decent beers when I was younger so I do not understand where this Miller fits on the social stratification of Millers.  The term "High Life" makes me thing "top of the line" or "aristocratic".  It tasted like the same trailer park urine that I would come to expect from a company like Miller.  One time I actually saw a mullet-wearing domestically violent redneck drinking this during a shakedown on Fox's Cops show.  As if my impression of this beer after putting it into my mouth wasnt bad enough.  Im tired of American companies pushing this "always smooth, never bitter" bunk.  I think Evian could have the same slogan for their drink.
